story:
Laney’s wish is to make her world more handicapped accessible!  We are working with a company to create a handicapped friendly backyard with wheelchair ramps and an adaptable swing set.  We're hoping to also put in a covered play area because too much sun exposure causes Laney to have seizures.  This would allow Laney to be outside and would really open up her world!

 

Thank you so much for helping make Laney’s wish come true!

Thank you so much for helping make Laney’s wish come true!

story:
About NESA Night Camp

Our NESA Night Camp, with a late summer start, will reach inner city and disadvantaged youth ages 6 to 12 years old during their most critical window of development. Currently, there are several hundred kids in the greater Boston area who cannot attend summer camps or programs and are left playing in the streets and crime-filled neighborhoods during the summer. New England Sports Academy can address the need for a summer camp for a thousand children through our scholarship initiative combined with our incredible camp offerings, leaders in training program, and our world-class coaches. We are confident that the scholarship students will grow immensely as people and incorporate the skills and values learned into their lives!

For every donation made, we will share the stories of the scholarship recipients who benefitted from the program! 

What We Need & What You Get

New England Sports Academy has launched a separate program as a part of this project. A variety of camps, from dance to basketball to mixed sports to soccer will be available from 4-8pm on each weekday of the summer. It costs only $200 per child to attend a week of camp! Our goal is to raise money to cover the cost of accommodating 100 kids in this program, AND transporting them from downtown Boston to NESA and back.

Each year, we have over 300 kids from local towns attending one or several of our 10+ camps. They are able to choose what they would like to do each day: dance, soccer, gymnastics, basketball, parkour, academics, or perhaps be a princess or a pirate. We would love to give the same options to disadvantaged youth as well.

The Impact

Many inner city families cannot afford to provide their kids with the exciting experience of summer camps. We would like to help them bring their kids together and build the community through athletics, academics and fun! Sports teach lots of life lessons, such as teamwork, goal setting, hard work, communication skills and many more. This is why we want to make this opportunity available for those who cannot afford it.

We will be including a "leaders in training" course for the scholarship recipients. The topics in this course include: goal setting, negotiation, team building, public speaking, qualities of leadership, types of leaders, informal/formal leaders, and financial interest.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

* Share on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr

* Spread the word by emailing it to your family & friends

 

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank you for helping us help the kids!

story:
The Vitamin D Council needs your help!

High quality research has come out this past year showing that vitamin D can help in lots of diseases and illnesses; some saddening, some life-threatening; some that severely affect the quality of life of entire families. These conditions include:

  • Multiple sclerosis
  • Infant heart failure
  • Cystic fibrosis
  • Low grade prostate cancer
  • High blood pressure and more

The problem? The studies that found vitamin D helped in these conditions used much higher doses than government recommendations.

Because of this, few patients with these conditions know that vitamin D can improve their condition.

Help the Vitamin D Council get the word out

With your support and membership, the Vitamin D Council can spread better awareness to patients, their families, doctors and other health care professionals. With your help, we can improve the lives of people suffering with these conditions.

Join the vitamin D community, donate and sign up for membership

With your donation, you will be given membership to the Vitamin D Council. Your membership will allow you to:

  • Access every article from the Council's blog
  • Participate in discussions with vitamin D experts
  • Become a better steward on the importance of vitamin D and sun exposure

Plus, if you'd like, you can receive a shirt, signed book and/or beach towel showing your support for vitamin D, the Council and the importance of sun exposure!

How the Council will use your donation

The Vitamin D Council will use your contribution to:

  • Create better and more lay-friendly content for patients and health care providers
  • Create better and more materials for patients and health care offices
  • Improve usability of website
  • Launch more powerful awareness campaigns
  • Continue to support current programs and day-to-day operations

More reasons to donate

  1. The Vitamin D Council is a nonprofit organization and relies on individual donors
  2. Your contribution is tax-deductible
  3. When you become a member of the Council, you expand the vitamin D community and further bring awareness on vitamin D to the world.

And did we say, we need your help!


Thank you for your support,

Vitamin D Council team

story:
Join esteemed Met's first baseman Edward Emil Kranepool, also known as "Steady Eddie", and others, in assisting the Wearable Artificial Kidney Foundation, Inc. ("the Foundation"), an IRS approved Non-Profit Charitable Organization, to raise public awareness and support research to give Dialysis patients their life back.

ABOUT DIALYSIS PATIENTS

There are more than 2 million patients being treated for End Stage Renal Disease ("ESRD") globally, with over 570,000 receiving treatment in the US. ESRD ("Dialysis") patient numbers continue to grow steadily at 8% annually worldwide and most of this growth is attributed to an aging population, increasing obesity, diabetes and hypertension due to genetic predisposition as well as increasing adoption of Westernized dietary habits.

 


Additionally, China and India, where about 1/3rd of the worlds population reside,  have recently announced that they will be providing coverage for ESRD, which should increase the global ESRD patient population by millions.

PRESENT TREATMENT FOR DIALYSIS PATIENTS

The only treatment for ESRD is Dialysis or a kidney transplant, if you are that lucky, as the vast majority of patients waiting for kidney transplants will pass before a new organ becomes available for them.

The average mortality rate for US Dialysis patients is about 20%. This means that approximately 20% of US Dialysis patients will not survive each year. 

SO WHAT IS THE WAK™ AND HOW CAN IT HELP ?     

The WAK™ is a miniaturized dialysis machine that can be worn as a belt by a patient.  The WAK™ operates on batteries and weighs less than 10 pounds, allowing patients to wear the device continuously instead of being tethered to conventional dialysis machines several days a week for many hours. 

                                      

        Trial Participant wearing 1st Prototype in United Kingdom WAK™ Trial

it is this miniaturization, like the computer, which went from a system that took up an entire floor to the tablets and laptops we now use, that provides the Dialysis patient the possibilities we are now discussing.

                                    Miniaturization is the Answer

WHAT IS WRONG WITH THE PRESENT STANDARD DIALYSIS TREATMENT

With the approval of the WAK™,   we believe that millions of Dialysis patients in the US and around the world will no longer be tethered and chained to a refrigerator sized machine for 3-4 hours a day, 3 times week, and spend the days between such treatments recuperating from the effects of such treatments. 

We believe that they will no longer be subject to the many possible hardships, resulting from standard dialysis, such as:

•Anemia •Arrhythmia •Blunt and massive changes in fluid balance •Brain strokes •Coronary disease •Depression •Disability •Draconian diets •Endothelial dysfunction •Fluid restriction •Hemodynamic instability •Hyperparathyroidism •Insufficient clearance of “middle molecules” •Insufficient  phosphorus removal •Left ventricular hypertrophy •Neurological deficit •Poorly controlled hypertension •Poor removal of protein bound toxins •Poor sleep •Post dialysis fatigue •Salt restriction •Sleep apnea •Sudden changes in electrolyte concentration and pH

Who is Developing the WAK™ and what is its status?

The WAK™ is being Developed by Blood Purification Technologies, Inc. ("BPTI"), a Washington state Corporation. At the present time, the FDA has approved the WAK™ to commence its human clinical Trial #1 of 5 trials to be conducted. While most of the costs of Trial #1 have been paid, BPTI still needs approximately $400,000 to complete Trial #1. Your assistance is vitally requested.

WHAT IS THE PURPOSE OF THE FOUNDATION ?

The Wearable Artificial Kidney Foundation is an IRS approved Charitable Organization that has been formed for the purpose of both raising awareness to the plight of Dialysis patients and addressing several unmet needs in the treatment of Dialysis patients. The object of its research goals are:

• Improve the quality of life of Dialysis patients and reduce their mortality.

• Provide a clinical solution for treating small children that require chronic Dialysis.  Today, many infants and small children cannot receive chronic hemodialysis because their blood volume is too small. The miniaturized size of the WAK™ will, for the first time, allow babies to be dialyzed on a chronic basis.

The Foundation will be doing so by funding the neccesary research, including FDA human clinical trials on the Wearable Artificial Kidney, which has already had successful human clinical trials in Italy and the United Kingdom.

WHAT DOES THE FOUNDATION NEED?

The Foundation needs only one thing - FUNDING and it needs it Critically !!!!!

REASONS TO DONATE TO THE FOUNDATION

It is critical to move the WAK™ through all 5 planned clinical trials in order to allow the use of the WAK™ by the general public. It is the goal of the Foundation to improve the lives of millions of Dialysis patients and give them back their lives, through the use of the WAK™.

It is also immensly important to raise public awareness of the human cost of today's standard dialysis treatment.

WHAT ARE THE PARAMETERS OF THE FDA TRIALS ?

WHAT ARE THE APPROXIMATE COST OF FDA TRIALS ?

The cost of FDA mandated trials are calculated to run around $35 Million. The Foundation will make every attempt to raise as much of this as is possible, with other funds being raised by alternative methods.

If you can’t contribute, for any reason, but you understand the importance of this project, please let all of your friends and colleagues know about our project.

We thank you from the bottom of our heart, as will every Dialysis patient once the WAK™ is approved and available worldwide.

WHAT ARE THE CONTEMPLATED END RESULTS OF USING THE WAK™ ?

We, as many others, believe that patients will live longer and their quality of live will be real. We also believe that patients will be able to function as productive citizens, work, play, eat many foods otherwise restricted, such as oranges, bananas, ice cream, salt intake, etc. and live longer healthier lives all at a cost to their governments which are substantially less than they expend now.

In addition, we envision that the WAK™ will provide superior clinical results for patients and give Dialysis patients back a more normal life.

Our belief is based upon the many clinical benefits described below through daily Dialysis and we believe that the WAK™ will deliver no less.

Treatment for kidney disease represents more than 10% of U.S. healthcare spending at a cost of over $30 Billion annually and is steadily rising.  It is our belief, which is shared by many others, that the use of the WAK™ will result in a annual savings to the U.S. of approximately $10 Billion. 

WHAT IS THE FDA INNOVATION PATHWAY 2.O PROGRAM ?


In March 2012 the WAK™ won the the FDA’s Innovation Pathway 2.0 award, which was created to speed pioneering and life saving devices to market.  The FDA has indicated it is committed to the goal of shortening the time from development to market, and the WAK™ has been actively engaged with a specially formed FDA team for “hands on” collaboration that is intended to accelerate the approval process of the WAK™.  This collaborative effort has resulted in the approval of the human use of the WAK™ in the U.S. for clinical research purposes.  

IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN HEARING MORE ABOUT THE WAK, PLEASE VIEW THE FOLLOWING 30 MINUTE LECTURE GIVEN BY THE INVENTOR OF THE WAK™ IN SHANGHAI CHINA DURING A HEMODIALYSIS SYMPOSIUM

WE BELIEVE THE CLINICAL BENEFITS OF WAK™ WILL BE AS FOLLOWS:

·  Daily dialysis normalizes the blood pressure of ESRD patients, eliminating or greatly reducing the need for blood pressure medications.  Normal blood pressure achieved by daily dialysis or continuous dialysis with the WAK™ would also greatly reduce the incidence of strokes and heart attacks that Dialysis patients currently experience.  These incidents often require hospitalization and can be disabling or even fatal.

·  Patients with kidney failure do not eliminate excess water from their bodies, since they produce little or no urine.  The retained fluid accumulates in the lungs, resulting in severe breathing problems.  As fluid that accumulated over two or three days must be removed bluntly over three or four hours, this fast, unnatural removal causes great discomfort and increases the risk of strokes and heart disease.  Fluid overload is one of the main causes of hospitalizations in this population.  Daily dialysis has been shown to eliminate this problem, as would use of the WAK™.

·  Dialysis Patients retain large amounts of phosphorus, which becomes toxic.  In order to address this problem, patients receiving dialysis three times per week have to swallow 12 to 15 pills a day in order to remove the excess phosphorus through the gut.  In daily dialysis, excess phosphorus is removed without the need for any pills.  The WAK™ has been shown in animal and human studies to remove the same amount of phosphorus as in daily dialysis.  Continuous dialysis using the WAK™ would not only eliminate the patient’s need to swallow 12 to 15 pills a day (and save associated expenses), but would also greatly reduce the incidence of bone disease in these patients.

·  Shunts (connections between an artery and a vein) used in conventional dialysis, often clot or become infected.  This results in the need for repeated surgical interventions and hospitalizations.  Repeated and more frequent needle insertions with daily dialysis have already resulted in increased need for surgical procedures.  The WAK™ is connected to a vein via a specially designed catheter, in a less complex outpatient surgical procedure.  The WAK™ blood connection is expected to greatly reduce infections incurred by patients and avoid painful repeated needle sticks.

·  Dialysis patients using conventional dialysis are often malnourished, which results in a greater risk of infection and other complications.  Daily dialysis has been shown to eliminate malnutrition in Dialysis patients.  The WAK™ has been shown in animal and human studies to have the same biochemical effects as daily dialysis and, therefore, it is likely to eliminate malnutrition.

·  Conventional dialysis treatment does not remove enough salt from the body, but daily dialysis does.  Accumulation of excess salt in Dialysis patients is a common cause of high blood pressure and heart disease.  This condition requires imposing severe restrictions on the salt intake of dialysis patients.  The WAK™ would allow patients to ingest salt, making food more palatable.

·  Dialysis patients in rural areas are subject to additional hardship and expense since they often have to travel great distances to get to the nearest dialysis unit.  The WAK™ would reduce the frequency and duration of those trips.

·  Dialysis is physically debilitating such that most dialysis patients are unable to work  and earn a living.  Daily dialysis has been shown to rehabilitate these patients and greatly increase their ability to work and exercise. 

·  Daily dialysis greatly enhances patients’ quality of life with respect to the frequency of shots and pills and the time required to travel frequently to clinics.

 ·  Foods commonly consumed by healthy people become restricted for Dialysis patients, further hindering their quality of life.  Failure to observe these restrictions can result in serious complications, including bone disease, strokes and heart disease, and sometimes, even death.

Unfortunately daily dialysis remains, for the most part, impractical due to operational constraints at dialysis centers.  If each patient were to spend more time on dialysis machines every week, additional machines, space and personnel will be needed.  Many centers already lack adequate facilities and staff resources at their present levels of utilization, in which patients only receive treatment three times a week. 

 

Dialysis Clinic/Hospital Room, we believe may soon no longer be necessary!

There is little investment incentive to build twice as many units as we have today, and insurance carriers and taxpayers show no desire to pay more for dialysis time.  Further, there are not enough nurses and technicians to allow for the delivery of daily dialysis.  While home dialysis is a viable alternative to providing more frequent and longer dialysis it only reaches 10% of the ESRD population.  Again, we believe that the WAK™ will deliver the clinical benefits of daily dialysis as well as a major enhancement to the patients’ quality of life.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT

We hope that Mary's story, and maybe some of the rewards, have encouraged you to take part in this Indiegogo fundraiser. Even if you don't donate money to the cause, you can still be a huge help assisting us in raising awareness of the failure of standard hemodialysis treatment to provide a true quality of life to Dialysis patients.

Please share this campaign with your friends, and family, whether in person or on social media as virtually everyone knows someone on Dialysis.  Thank you for your support from the bottom of our heart.

The content of this campaign is the sole property and responsibility of, and has been developed exclusively by the Foundation. The Foundation is not affiliated with any University, Medical or Commercial enterprise and is an IRS approved 501(c)3 Charitable Organization. Please note: donating to this campaign will not influence patient recruitment or enrollment in the FDA Trials, as we have no involvement other than funding.

twice as many units as we have today, and insurance carriers and taxpayers show
no desire to pay more for dialysis time. 
Further, there are not enough nurses and technicians to allow for the
delivery of daily dialysis.  While home
dialysis is a viable alternative to providing more frequent and longer dialysis
it only reaches 10% of the ESRD population.  Again, we believe that the WAK™ will deliver the clinical benefits of daily dialysis as well as a major enhancement to the patients’ quality of life.THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORTWe hope that Mary's story, and maybe some of the rewards, have encouraged you to take part in this Indiegogo fundraiser. Even if you don't donate money to the cause, you can still be a huge help assisting us in raising awareness of the failure of standard hemodialysis treatment to provide a true quality of life to Dialysis patients.Please share this campaign with your friends, and family, whether in person or on social media as virtually everyone knows someone on Dialysis.  Thank you for your support from the bottom of our heart.The content of this campaign is the sole property and responsibility of, and has been developed exclusively by the Foundation. The Foundation is not affiliated with any University, Medical or Commercial enterprise and is an IRS approved 501(c)3 Charitable Organization. Please note: donating to this campaign will not influence patient recruitment or enrollment in the FDA Trials, as we have no involvement other than funding.

story:
(sigue versión española — english version below)

Le rêve d’une équipe!

Présentation de l'équipe

Une équipe de cheerleading, c’est 20 athlètes qui pratiquent au minimum 6 heures par semaine après les cours pour améliorer leurs performances. C’est 20 personnes complètement différentes qui s’unissent dans un même but : offrir le meilleur d’elles-mêmes. Ce sont des jeunes aux origines diverses (québecoises, françaises, sud-américaines, haïtiennes, russes, chinoises, maghrébines, africaines, vietnamiennes…) qui sont tous ensemble pour s’entraider et se pousser à aller plus loin. Ils ont entre 12 et 18 ans, ils sont bons ou moins bons à l’école, ils sont grands ou petits et ils ont tous une place essentielle dans cette équipe tissée serrée.


Présentation du projet

À l’école Sophie-Barat, les Phénix sont l’incarnation de cette définition et cette année, nous avons un rêve : nous voulons participer aux Championnats Canadiens de Cheerleading qui auront lieu à Niagara Falls les 10 et 11 avril prochains. Cet événement représente pour nous l’aboutissement de plusieurs années d’efforts, de difficultés surmontées, de blessures guéries, de conflits résolus, d’encouragements soutenus, de lutte contre la paresse si souvent reprochée aux adolescents. 


Comment  vous pouvez participer à notre rêve

Pour vivre ce grand rêve, nous avons besoin de vous. En faisant un don à notre campagne de financement, vous contribuez à faire en sorte que nos jeunes croient en leurs projets, qu’ils réalisent que lorsque l'on veut quelque chose, avec beaucoup d’investissement, on peut y arriver et ça, c’est une leçon extraordinaire pour un jeune.

Merci de nous encourager, merci de croire en la jeunesse, merci de nous faire confiance, merci de montrer aux jeunes qu’ils ne sont pas seuls et que leur communauté est là pour les soutenir lorsqu’ils ont des rêves qui leur paraissent inatteignables.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

El sueño de un equipo

Un equipo de cheerleading, son 20 atletas que practican un mínimo de 6 horas por semana después de la escuela para mejorar sus competiciones. Son 20 personas completamente diferentes que se unen para un mismo objetivo: ofrecen lo mejor de ellos mismos. Son jóvenes de varias nacionalidades (quebequesas, latinas, haitianas, rusas, chinas, etc.) que todos juntos entrenan y se apoyan para llegar mas lejos. Ellos tienen entre 12 y 18 años, son buenos en los estudios, son grandes o pequeños y todos son primordiales para nuestro equipo.

En la escuela Sophie-Barat, los Phénix son la encarnación de esta definición, y este año, tenemos un sueño: queremos participar en los campeonatos canadienses de cheerleading que se llevaran a cabo en Niagara Falls esta primavera. Este evento representa para nosotros el resultado de todos los esfuerzos de todos estos años, de dificultades superadas, de heridas curadas, de conflictos resueltos, de apoyos que nos sostienen, de lucha contra la pereza y la fatiga que muchas veces reprochamos los adolescentes.

Para vivir este gran sueño, nosotros necesitamos de ustedes. Haciendo una donación a nuestra campaña de financiamiento, ustedes contribuirán a asegurar que nuestros jóvenes crean en sus proyectos, y que ellos realicen que, cuando quieran una cosa, con mucho esfuerzo pueden alcanzar sus metas y sus sueños, es una lección extraordinaria para los jóvenes.

Gracias por apoyarnos, gracias por creer en los jóvenes, gracias por tenernos confianza, gracias por mostrar a los jóvenes que no están solos y que la comunidad está allí para sostenerlos en los sueños que les parecen imposibles.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A cheerleading team

Twenty athletes who spend 6 hours a week training and working to make their dream come true. Twenty athletes who all unite in order to achieve one goal: to be the best they can be. Some come from across the globe, Russia, Vietnam, China, Africa, and some were born and raised in Québec. While they all came from different places, they were brought together to help and push each other to go further in life. Aged between 12 and 18 years old, some are good in school and some are not, some are tall and some are small, but they all belong and matter in this team.

This year, they would like to share their dream with you: to be able to participate in the Canadian National Cheerleading Championship, which will be held at Niagara Falls this spring. This competition would give them a chance to show our country how hard they've worked in the past few years. Teens are sometimes said to be lazy, but they put their blood, sweat, and tears into this team, and throughout the obstacles and the injuries they've substained, they still came through.

In order to make their dream come true, we need your help. Each donation you make to our campaign brings this team one step closer to actually living it. It teaches these athletes that when they put their mind up to something, their strong will and hard work can be used to achieve anything. 

Thank you so much for encouraging us. Thank you for believing in Québec's youth, for showing them that they're not alone in this world and that the community will always be there to support their dreams no matter how hard to reach they are.


NOS BESOINS

Pour atteindre notre objectif, nous menons plusieurs levées de fonds telles qu'une vente d'objets promotionnels, des activités sociales et ludiques, des demandes de subventions diverses, etc. Mais nous aurions besoin d'un coup de main supplémentaire pour l'hébergement et une partie du transport.

Hébergement: 1 900 $ (deux nuitées pour 23 personnes)

Transport : 200 $ (essence)

Autobus: 700 $ (partie de la location)

Nous sommes persuadés qu'avec votre aide, nous pouvons réaliser notre projet puisque tous les autres frais sont déjà budgétés.

story:
QLIPP is the ultimate tennis performance sensor. It measures every part of your stroke, analyzing the spin, speed and sweet spot accuracy of each shot-- designed to improve your game with the most advanced analytics possible.

And it can even wirelessly team with your smartphone to shoot video of your stroke. After each volley, you’ll gain insight into your stroke. And after each practice, you’ll know how to get better. Whether you are a beginner or an advanced tennis player, QLIPP was made for you.

 

Using QLIPP’s advanced wearable tracking technology, you can pinpoint the exact ways to develop your game. QLIPP can unlock your tennis potential, and it’s so easy to use.

 

 

Stretch Goal Update (27th July 2015)

Thank you for helping us reach our crowdfunding goal! We have just released our stretch goals. Let's hit these targets together!

 

Stretch Goal Update (11th August 2015)

Thank you for helping us reach our $40,000 target! Get ready your Apple Watches for our QLIPP Apple App!

 

$40,000 Compatibility with Apple Watch (Delivery December 2015)

With this QLIPP Apple Watch application, you will be able to receive instant notifications of your performance on your Apple wrist watch. Correlate this result with the activity app of the watch to find out your calorie burn during your tennis session. (Watch not included!)

 

$60,000 Release of QLIPP Squash App (Delivery June 2016)

 

 

The QLIPP tennis sensor has been designed to work on all major rackets including open throat squash rackets. At $60,000, you will be provided with an additional mobile application for use in squash using the same QLIPP sensor. Its like buying two sports sensors for the price of one!

If you are using a close throat squash racket, do check that the distance between the middle strings of your racket are at least 10mm apart. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The QLIPP sensor tracking technology attaches to your tennis racket quickly and  begins recording your swings and movement right away. During practice, it transfers all the data to the QLIPP mobile app in real-time so you can get immediate insights on your strengths, weaknesses, and how to improve your game. It's like having your own digital tennis instructor helping you get better all the time!

 

 

How QLIPP works with the Apple Watch

How QLIPP video function works

Tutorial on how to attach the QLIPP unit to the racquet

 

Tutorial on how to remove the QLIPP unit to the racquet

 

 

 

 

 

 

The QLIPP app can save and monitor each session so you can track your improvement and see what parts of your game you need to work on. From utilizing your smartphone’s camera for video analysis of your form to providing session by session progress tracking, the app can help you identify errors in your form and provide guidelines on how to develop a stronger swing.

 

 

 

With our sweet spot heat map, keep track of how close you are to hitting that perfect spot. Improve the accuracy of your strokes by knowing the point of contact of the ball with your racket. The detailed analysis that accompanies each stroke ensures that you are never too far away from reaching your goals.

 

 

 

You can also share your progress with friends on your social networks and compete against others to see who's becoming the most refined player, developing additional motivation to become the best player on the court!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Stuart Daw: Previously Berkshire Tennis County Cup U18 Captain. County Champion (UK) at U12, U14, U21 levels.

"The weight and the size of the QLIPP sensor is perfect. I am sure tennis players will love this."

 

Mary Ngiam: Nationally (Malaysia) ranked #1 in the under 10s, 12s, 14s, 16s category. 2007 through 2009, Mary won the All-Conference Singles Title.

"I don't even feel the weight"

 

Alex Meyrick: Tennis Distributor

"We were amazed at how good the software is!"

 

Marc Koh: Board Member of Singapore Tennis Association (STA)

"Qlipp allows you to video your techniques, record essential racket head speed and spin data for analytical use. Qlipp is a must have for any serious player looking to improve his technique."
 

Daniel: Tennis Enthusiast, Beta Tester

Peter Freeman: Top Performance Tennis Coach

 
Peter Fryer: Tennis Coach

 

Safwane: Tennis Enthusiast, Beta Tester

"With this tiny sensor that will replace your dampener, you will be able to count your number of strokes, how many forehands you've hit, how many backhands, volleys, smashes, services and have an idea on the amount of spin that you put into the ball or to see exactly how good is your ball centering (or not)."

Check out the rest of his online testimonial of QLIPP here: http://tennis-connected.esy.es/228

 

 

Hank: Tennis Enthusiast, Beta Tester. Independent Review on Tennis Warehouse

http://tt.tennis-warehouse.com/index.php?threads/mini-review-qlipp-tennis-sensor.539660/

Beta User article from France

 

QLIPP French Review

 

Our REDDIT Thread

 

http://www.reddit.com/user/qlippsensor

 


 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

Today we have a working prototype, but in order to bring QLIPP to the world, we need your help. We’re raising funds to build the mold, purchase materials and gain FCC and CE Bluetooth certification. Each of these steps will be critical to our ability to manufacture QLIPP and give people everywhere an easy way to improve their game. 

 

The QLIPP sensor is currently in the DVT (Design Verification Testing) Stage. This will ensure the manufacturing quality of your QLIPP sensor. After this stage we will be sending your QLIPP sensor for electronic certification (FCC and CE). What this means is we will be obtaining a license for this electronic product to be used in your geographical region. Once this certification is approved, your QLIPP sensor will be shipped immediately. In the meantime, you will also be provided with timely updates and will be kept posted of our progress. The video below is a short clip of our manufacturing process and electronic testing of our beta trial units.

With your help, we can get QLIPP into the market. Also, once we’re funded, we have plans to expand into other sports like racquetball, running, baseball and many others. Just imagine the potential.

 

We started with a vision to make QLIPP something that could help all tennis players play better. After 2 years of testing and R&D, we’re sure that QLIPP can fulfill our goal and we’re excited that your help can bring us one step closer. The QLIPP team is part of 9 Degrees Freedom, a company founded in February 2012 by Donny Soh and Cen Lee, a pair of entrepreneurs with a passion in innovative lifestyle sports technologies. 9 Degrees Freedom is incubated by NTUitive, a startup accelerator from NTU.

 

What you see today is the result of more than two years of Research and Development. A lot of effort, resources and promises have been poured into this and we are truly happy and excited to be able to have the opportunity to present to you and the tennis community, the QLIPP sensor.

You can be well assured that we are fully committed to delivering your QLIPP sensor. Since 2013, we have started prototyping with our manufacturer just to ensure that you will be able to receive a product of utmost quality. We take a lot of pride in our work and your satisfaction will be our utmost reward.

 

 

www.qlipp.com

 

 

 

 

Q: What makes the QLIPP sensor different from the rest?  

A: Apart from being one of the lightest in the market, the QLIPP Ultimate Tennis Performance Sensor can also be attached to any racquet with its registered "twist and lock” technology and provides a dampening effect as well.

 

 

 

Q: Do I have to pay for the mobile application?

A: No, the mobile application can be downloaded for free with each purchase of our QLIPP sensor.

 

Q: What features does the mobile app have to offer?

 

A1: Stroke by stroke breakdown into speed, sweet spot and spin

A2: Session overview, including the best stats and your average performance for that session

A3: Video recording with slow-motion playback, along with the accompanying stats for every stroke  

A4: QLIPP Community – For you to share your data and videos with like-minded tennis players and also to track your progress.

 

 

Q: Where can I buy the sensor and when will I receive it?  

 

A: We are currently in the midst of taking pre-orders 

at http://www.igg.me/at/qlipp

The estimated time of shipment for the QLIPP Ultimate Tennis Performance Sensor will be shipped out for free by late November to early December.

 

 

Q: How much does the sensor cost?

A:  The sensor will retail at US$129 (suggested retail price). Currently, it is available at US79 (early bird price) for all pre-orders at http://www.igg.me/at/qlipp

 

Q: Will the sensor be launched internationally or only in the US?

A: Our sensor will be launched internationally and free shipping will be provided to all countries for pre-orders.

 

Q: What strokes will it be able to detect?

 

A1: Forehand- Topspin, slice,flat

A2: Backhand- Topspin, slice,flat

A3: Serve- Topspin, flat

 

 

Q: Will different rackets and strings affect the accuracy of the sensor and its readings?

A: No, they would not affect the sensor and its readings as our motion analytics have already accommodated for such differences.

 

Q: Will it be able to give Rpms for spin and mph for speed?


A: For speed, there will be in both mph and kph. For spin, we will be using the standards and statistics from a pro-athlete as our benchmark.

 

Q: Does the sensor measure ball speed or racket speed?

A: We will be using the racket head speed to derive the estimated ball speed.

 

Q: What devices are compatible with the QLIPP Ultimate Tennis Performance Sensor?

A: Please refer to the specifications above for the list of devices.

 

Q: Must my QLIPP sensor be close to me when I am in the court?

A: You have to bring both your QLIPP sensor and your smartphone into the court in order for your measurements to be recorded and saved. However, your smartphone does not have to be near you as our QLIPP sensor has a detection range of 40m- 50m (whole court).

 

Q: Can I use the QLIPP sensor in the rain?

A: No, it is not recommended that you do so as our sensor is not water proof. 

 

Q: What happens when an incoming tennis ball hits the sensor?

A: The sensor would not damaged, although there is a possibility that your readings for that particular stroke might not be as accurate.

 

Q: How long can the battery last?

A: The battery is able to last for 4-6 hours per charge.

 

Q: Do I have to inform the app of the types of strokes that I will be doing?

A: No. After you have selected whether you are a right or left hander, our sensor is able to differentiate your serves, forehands and backhands automatically by measuring the corresponding vibrations of each type of stroke.

 

Q: How long has the QLIPP sensor been in development?

A: 9 Degrees Freedom was established in 2012 and the QLIPP sensor has been in constant development for the past 2.5 years.

 

Q: Has the QLIPP sensor been tested with actual tennis players?

A: Yes, we have tested our sensor with ex-pro tennis players, tennis coaches and also club players for the past few years.

This will ensure the manufacturing quality of your QLIPP sensor. After this stage we will be sending your QLIPP sensor for electronic certification (FCC and CE). What this means is we will be obtaining a license for this electronic product to be used in your geographical region. Once this certification is approved, your QLIPP sensor will be shipped immediately. In the meantime, you will also be provided with timely updates and will be kept posted of our progress. The video below is a short clip of our manufacturing process and electronic testing of our beta trial units.     With your help, we can get QLIPP into the market. Also, once we’re funded, we have plans to expand into other sports like racquetball, running, baseball and many others. Just imagine the potential.    
 
We started with a vision to make QLIPP something that could help all tennis players play better. After 2 years of testing and R&D, we’re sure that QLIPP can fulfill our goal and we’re excited that your help can bring us one step closer. The QLIPP team is part of 9 Degrees Freedom, a company founded in February 2012 by Donny Soh and Cen Lee, a pair of entrepreneurs with a passion in innovative lifestyle sports technologies. 9 Degrees Freedom is incubated by NTUitive, a startup accelerator from NTU.
 
What you see today is the result of more than two years of Research and Development. A lot of effort, resources and promises have been poured into this and we are truly happy and excited to be able to have the opportunity to present to you and the tennis community, the QLIPP sensor.
You can be well assured that we are fully committed to delivering your QLIPP sensor. Since 2013, we have started prototyping with our manufacturer just to ensure that you will be able to receive a product of utmost quality. We take a lot of pride in our work and your satisfaction will be our utmost reward.
 
 
www.qlipp.com
  
 
 

 
 
Q: What makes the QLIPP sensor different from the rest?  
A: Apart from being one of the lightest in the market, the QLIPP Ultimate Tennis Performance Sensor can also be attached to any racquet with its registered "twist and lock” technology and provides a dampening effect as well.
 
 
 
Q: Do I have to pay for the mobile application?
A: No, the mobile application can be downloaded for free with each purchase of our QLIPP sensor.
 
Q: What features does the mobile app have to offer?
 
A1: Stroke by stroke breakdown into speed, sweet spot and spin
A2: Session overview, including the best stats and your average performance for that session
A3: Video recording with slow-motion playback, along with the accompanying stats for every stroke  
A4: QLIPP Community – For you to share your data and videos with like-minded tennis players and also to track your progress.      Q: Where can I buy the sensor and when will I receive it?       A: We are currently in the midst of taking pre-orders   at http://www.igg.me/at/qlipp The estimated time of shipment for the QLIPP Ultimate Tennis Performance Sensor will be shipped out for free by late November to early December.      Q: How much does the sensor cost?  A:  The sensor will retail at US$129 (suggested retail price). Currently, it is available at US79 (early bird price) for all pre-orders at http://www.igg.me/at/qlipp     Q: Will the sensor be launched internationally or only in the US?  A: Our sensor will be launched internationally and free shipping will be provided to all countries for pre-orders.     Q: What strokes will it be able to detect?     A1: Forehand- Topspin, slice,flat  A2: Backhand- Topspin, slice,flat A3: Serve- Topspin, flat      Q: Will different rackets and strings affect the accuracy of the sensor and its readings?  A: No, they would not affect the sensor and its readings as our motion analytics have already accommodated for such differences.     Q: Will it be able to give Rpms for spin and mph for speed?  A: For speed, there will be in both mph and kph. For spin, we will be using the standards and statistics from a pro-athlete as our benchmark.     Q: Does the sensor measure ball speed or racket speed?  A: We will be using the racket head speed to derive the estimated ball speed.     Q: What devices are compatible with the QLIPP Ultimate Tennis Performance Sensor?  A: Please refer to the specifications above for the list of devices.     Q: Must my QLIPP sensor be close to me when I am in the court?  A: You have to bring both your QLIPP sensor and your smartphone into the court in order for your measurements to be recorded and saved. However, your smartphone does not have to be near you as our QLIPP sensor has a detection range of 40m- 50m (whole court).      Q: Can I use the QLIPP sensor in the rain?  A: No, it is not recommended that you do so as our sensor is not water proof.      Q: What happens when an incoming tennis ball hits the sensor?  A: The sensor would not damaged, although there is a possibility that your readings for that particular stroke might not be as accurate.      Q: How long can the battery last?  A: The battery is able to last for 4-6 hours per charge.     Q: Do I have to inform the app of the types of strokes that I will be doing?  A: No. After you have selected whether you are a right or left hander, our sensor is able to differentiate your serves, forehands and backhands automatically by measuring the corresponding vibrations of each type of stroke.      Q: How long has the QLIPP sensor been in development?  A: 9 Degrees Freedom was established in 2012 and the QLIPP sensor has been in constant development for the past 2.5 years.     Q: Has the QLIPP sensor been tested with actual tennis players?  A: Yes, we have tested our sensor with ex-pro tennis players, tennis coaches and also club players for the past few years.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. My name is Darren Van Soye and I am the Co-Race Director for the Race Across the USA. 

It should be no surprise to hear that childhood obesity has more than doubled in children and quadrupled in adolescents in the past 30 years. At the present time, 12.5 million children, ages 6-19 in the United States, are obese. Many more are overweight. 

Starting January 16, 2015, an international team of athletes will begin a 4 1/2 month journey, running the equivalent of 117 back-to-back marathons across the United States, with the goal of sparking a renaissance in childhood health and fitness.


What We Need & What You Get 

We currently have a dozen runners who have a passion for the cause and have committed to run coast to coast to inspire our youth. These runners will visit schools along the route and participate in community events to raise awareness about the benefits of childhood fitness.  In order to participate in this charity event, each runner must make a registration payment to cover liability insurance, campground fees, hotel reservations and gas. 

The problem is that this registration amount doesn't begin to pay for the full cost of running this event. Right now, we are short $14,000. That's why we are asking for your help. Every dollar you donate will help us close this gap. That said, our runners are "all in", and have told me personally that they will do whatever it takes to make this event happen. No one, including myself, is getting paid. This is an all-volunteer event.

We have several perks that we hope you will enjoy. We call the most popular one "Sponsor a Day".  In return for your contribution of $125, you will receive a lasting memorial on our website. You can honor a loved one, celebrate a birth, or commemorate an anniversary. Any date between January 16 and June 2, 2015 can be "sponsored". When users hover over that day, a window will appear with your personal message and a photo of your choice.  


Check to See if Your Date is Available

We will only allow a day to purchased once.  You will have an opportunity after you have paid to tell us your date.  If it isn't in red below, it's available!

Jan 16 Feb 08 Mar 03 Mar 26 Apr 18 May 11
Jan 17 Feb 09 Mar 04 Mar 27 Apr 19 May 12
Jan 18 Feb 10 Mar 05 Mar 28 Apr 20 May 13
Jan 19 Feb 11 Mar 06 Mar 29 Apr 21 May 14
Jan 20 Feb 12 Mar 07 Mar 30 Apr 22 May 15
Jan 21 Feb 13 Mar 08 Mar 31 Apr 23 May 16
Jan 22 Feb 14 Mar 09 Apr 01 Apr 24 May 17
Jan 23 Feb 15 Mar 10 Apr 02 Apr 25 May 18
Jan 24 Feb 16 Mar 11 Apr 03 Apr 26 May 19
Jan 25 Feb 17 Mar 12 Apr 04 Apr 27 May 20
Jan 26 Feb 18 Mar 13 Apr 05 Apr 28 May 21
Jan 27 Feb 19 Mar 14 Apr 06 Apr 29 May 22
Jan 28 Feb 20 Mar 15 Apr 07 Apr 30 May 23
Jan 29 Feb 21 Mar 16 Apr 08 May 01 May 24
Jan 30 Feb 22 Mar 17 Apr 09 May 02 May 25
Jan 31 Feb 23 Mar 18 Apr 10 May 03 May 26
Feb 01 Feb 24 Mar 19 Apr 11 May 04 May 27
Feb 02 Feb 25 Mar 20 Apr 12 May 05 May 28
Feb 03 Feb 26 Mar 21 Apr 13 May 06 May 29
Feb 04 Feb 27 Mar 22 Apr 14 May 07 May 30
Feb 05 Feb 28 Mar 23 Apr 15 May 08 May 31
Feb 06 Mar 01 Mar 24 Apr 16 May 09 Jun 01
Feb 07 Mar 02 Mar 25 Apr 17 May 10 Jun 02

Example:

This is what your sponsored date will look like on the website.

The Impact

In April/May, my wife Sandy and I drove the course backwards from Washington D.C., all the way back to California. Along the way, we met with mayors, members of the press and schools. Here are some of the highlights:
  • We met with the mayors of Raleigh (NC), Greenwood (MS), Ft. Worth (TX), Roswell (NM), and Payson (AZ). All of them were super supportive of our project and committed their full support to the effort. For example:
  • Ft. Worth has already committed to a Street Fair on the day we run through their community.  Leaders of the city, lots of kids and members of the Dallas Cowboys will be participating.
  • Roswell has already booked their convention center and committed to having all of their 4th graders there. They have also committed to giving us the use of their museum, which is right next door to the convention center.
  • We were interviewed by the local press in Sanford, NC and Roswell, NM. In fact, we made the front page of the newspaper in Roswell. This told me that we were on to something because this was just the scouting mission. Just think what they would do for the "real thing".

We have partnered with the 100 Mile Club®, a childhood fitness charity that challenges kids to run (or walk) 100 miles in a school year.  In fact, we will be running right past their headquarters in Norco, California, on the second day of our event. The 100 Mile Club® is currently operating in over 700 schools in all 50 states, as well as Canada, New Zealand, and Japan.   In addition to paying registration, each coast-to-coast runner has committed to raising $2,000 to be used to provide scholarships for nationally-recognized sports fitness programs.  Your donation will provide us with the funds to hold this coast-to-coast event, which in turn, will spark a renaissance in childhood health and fitness.

    


Risks & Challenges

Safety is our number one concern. To ensure the success of the overall event, we have committed to the following measures:

  • The route has been carefully selected to minimize the time on busy roads and maximize the size of the shoulder. Runners will run on sidewalks when they are available. Runners will run single file. They will never run past dusk.
  • Aid stations will be set up along the route every 6.6 miles. At the aid stations, runners will receive water or sports drink plus snacks. Each station will have a first aid kit.  
  • Volunteers will man the aid stations. On the back of their cars, there will be large colorful signs saying “Caution: Runners Next 26.2 Miles”.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, there are other ways to help. For one, you can volunteer.  If you are a teacher, we would love to hear from you! We would also appreciate it if you can share this campaign with your friends and family via the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Company

Batu Biologics is a privately held immunotherapeutic company with laboratories at Janssen Research and Development in San Diego, CA. The company was founded by Samuel Wagner and Dr. Alan Lewis subsequent to a successful $26 million exit from Dr. Lewis's former company Medistem Inc.  Through leveraging existing manufacturing, regulatory, and clinical relationships, the company is in late stage preclinical development for two immunotherapy products.  The products are anticipated to enter clinical development through the FDA IND process in Q1 2015 (ValloVax).

ValloVax -  A novel cancer vaccine targeting the tumor endothelium

Tumors cannot grow larger than 1-2 millimeter in diameter without stimulating new blood vessels to feed them, demonstrating that new blood vessel formation (angiogenesis) is critical to sustainable tumor growth.  Blocking angiogenesis led to the development of multibillion dollar blockbuster drugs such as Avastin ($5.9 billion 2012), Sunitinib ($1.2 billion 2012), and Revlimed ($3.2 billion 2011).  Unfortunately these drugs target only one pathway of the angiogenesis process, and as a result tumor remissions are temporary, and in many cases not sustainable (for example 2011 FDA retraction of breast cancer indication for Avastin).  ValloVax is based on leveraging the immune system’s ability to selectively seek and destroy tumor-associated blood vessels, while sparing non-malignant blood vessels.  Proof of concept has been demonstrated in vitro and in vivo, and the company is currently refining GMP manufacturing protocols together with Cook General Biotechnology.

Use of Proceeds

Batu Biologics is seeking $100,000 to: 1) Define release criteria for ValloVax and secure clinical grade manufacturing 2) Additional IND enabling mouse studies 3) Filing of IND application for ValloVax 

Developmental Timeline

−  Q2 2014 close seed funding round

−  Q2 2014 establish academic collaborations

−  Q3 2014 SBIR grants

−  Q3 S1 approval (public non-trading company, REITs model)

−  Q3 2014 complete FDA animal studies

−  Q1 2015 IND ValloVax


The Batu Biologics Team

Samuel C Wagner - President & CEO

Samuel Wagner studied engineering at the University of California San Diego, and was a member of the engineering honor society, Tau Beta Pi. Mr. Wagner previously worked at the Scripps Whale Acoustics Lab engineering, maintaining, deploying, and recovering their proprietary data acquisition system, known as High-Frequency Acoustic Release Packages (HARP)s, which use piezoelectric crystals to passively record the sounds of the ocean over a wide range of frequencies. Sam took a leadership role in the lab operations involving a variety of applications from towed arrays and multi-channel HARPs to a Wave Glider which converts wave motion to propulsion offering continuous mobile monitoring. Sam has also taken a keen interest in entrepreneurship starting his own small business which offers CNC prototyping and milling services at a discount to university students.

Dimitri Theofilopoulos, J.D. – Chief Operating Officer

Chief of operations and legal matters for Batu Biologics. Dimitri was in-house business counsel for consulting transactions and research compliance at The Scripps Research Institute from June 2010 – March 2013.   Prior to that he practiced employment and health care law. Dimitri holds a J.D. from USC School of Law and a B.A. in History from UCLA. He has also published The Bar Exam Memorization Book, a useful study aid for the bar exam.

Hong Ma, MD, Ph.D, M.B.A – Chief Scientific Officer

Dr. Ma has an extensive history in academic and translational research. Subsequent to completing her medical degree she performed basic research in the area of molecular biology of endothelial associated pathways in her doctorate and postdoctoral studies. She has been critical in establishing numerous ventures and collaborations in the area of biosciences. Dr. Ma has over 20 peer reviewed publications and has worked with prestigious institutions in the USA, China, and Japan. She received her M.D. from Dalian Medical University, her Ph.D in Cardiovascular Pharmacology at Asahikawa Medical College, and has also earned her MBA at the Rady School of Management at the University of California in San Diego.

Blake Stock, M.B.A. – Chief Financial Officer

Manage a $40m Radiology Operating Budget, Created Business Intelligence and Analytics Dashboards, Project Management, Process Improvement, Craft Proposals for $5m Yearly Capital Budget, Created and Maintain Department Website, and Real Time Location Systems (RTLS) Committee Co-Chair, Project Management.

Andy J Kim – Vice President of Scientific Research

Having a background in entrepreneurship, computer science, and computational biology, Mr. Kim graduated from UCSD with a degree in Computer Science with a specialization in Bioinformatics. Mr. Kim performed research during his last two years at the UCSD Research Center for Cancer and Stem Cells, focusing on next-gen sequencing data analysis, evolutionary genetics, and wet lab experience. Prior to joining Batu Biologics, Mr. Kim was contracted at Illumina with the title of Bioinformatic Software Engineer & Automation developing and optimizing cost effective commercial software used for processing, sequencing, and analysis of genetic data.

Brandon R. Dolan – Research Scientist

Brandon Dolan received his M.S. in Biological Sciences from UC San Diegos School of Medicine. He has spent over four years performing biomedical research at the La Jolla Institute for Allergy & Immunology and has relevant clinical research experience in the Department of Infectious Diseases at UC San Diego Medical Center - Hillcrest.

story:
Short Summary

As midwives within a homebirth practice, we are striving to create a community birth center in order to offer more ways for women to connect, educate themselves about pregnancy, birth, and parenting. Our passion is that we want to offer mothers more birthing options and become a space that opens up community for them, as well as offering low-cost, affordable healthcare during pregnancy. Help us create that space! Our birth center will also employ local midwives as well as give local women a place to train if pursuing midwifery.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500,000 to build the building and make sure we make our birth center oasis as much like a home as possible, to include:  
  • We need an ultrasound machine for our on-staff technician to use 
  • Lab equipment for diagnostics necessary to pregnancy 
  • Furniture for birthing, appointment and waiting rooms, such as beds, tables, couches and chairs so that pregnant women and their families can feel comfortable during appointments and while giving birth. 
  • We are also offering our largest donor the honor of naming the birth center.
All monies will be used to forward the birth center project until we reach our goal amount!

The Impact

If we meet our goal you have just helped statistics for mothers to have a natural birth and made sure that women in this community get good quality affordable care.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challege is funding! Other challenges include community education on the safety of home and birth center birth. Licensed midwives in Florida regularly attend out of hospital birth, working with their local hospitals to provide transfer care if needed. Our birth center can work with you and others to help decrease induction and cesarean rates in our local community! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand if you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please share this campaign to all your facebook friends, twitter, and any social media.
    • If you want to donate items please call my contact at 813-381-6430 and we can coordinate where to drop off the items. If you are shipping I will give you the address where to ship.

Lab equipment for diagnostics necessary to pregnancy 
Furniture for birthing, appointment and waiting rooms, such as beds, tables, couches and chairs so that pregnant women and their families can feel comfortable during appointments and while giving birth. 
We are also offering our largest donor the honor of naming the birth center. All monies will be used to forward the birth center project until we reach our goal amount!
   The ImpactIf we meet our goal you have just helped statistics for mothers to have a natural birth and made sure that women in this community get good quality affordable care.   Risks & Challenges Our biggest challege is funding!
Other challenges include community education on the safety of home and birth center birth.  Licensed midwives in Florida regularly attend out of hospital birth, working with their local hospitals to provide transfer care if needed. Our birth center can work with you and others to help decrease induction and cesarean rates in our local community!   Other Ways You Can Help I understand if you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 
Please share this campaign to all your facebook friends, twitter, and any social media.
If you want to donate items please call my contact at 813-381-6430 and we can coordinate where to drop off the items. If you are shipping I will give you the address where to ship.

story:
MARG Energy’s Story Continues

We want to thank everyone that took the time to review our campaign. We now understand our campaign was flawed from the beginning and will find our funding elsewhere. We do want to thank our very few funders and appreciate their effort to jump start our Campaign. Thank you

story:
Making it Easier to Engage in Conversations about Health, Wellness, and Illness. 

Health education moments come at times when we aren't ready for them. Sometimes they come shortly after a surgical procedure, that we are just happy to have gotten through…or after a diagnosis has been given that we didn't expect or want. And the language is often not a language we understand. 

HealthWords can help solve this problem. We offer health education in a non intimidating language and environment, in a medium you can use at your convenience. We also give you a community in which to share your education, giving you the opportunity to see others using HealthWords, near and far. 

We make it easy and fun to learn the things you need to take care of yourself or your loved ones, and to understand conversations with your friends and colleagues that once made you uncomfortable because of jargon you did not understand.  We are helping to create a better dialogue for engagement. You may have a clean bill of health,  but it is likely that you or someone you know is not so lucky. Learn the language.  Be prepared to engage in health conversations and be more helpful to those around you. 

Play-it Health: Optimizing Health Engagement

Play-it Health is a creative, determined digital health group dedicated to optimizing health engagement.  We believe a key way to do this is by making health fun, hence our name "Play-it".  We have already designed our core system that consists of a reminder/education app coupled to customization, reporting, and telemed services.  Now we are focusing on  enriching our rewards and games, the elements that will engage you with this system, and happily bring you back to Play-it Health and your health community,  day after day. We want to add more fun, and we believe that our system will be better, if you help us design it. 

Learn about the overall Play-it Health Solution in the video below. 

We Need You!! Be a Part of a New Method of Development: Crowd Design for $2

We need your thoughts, your energy, and your support.

We have conceptualized and created the first mobile medical word game, Health Words. Yes, there are word games about many things, but we created the first mobile medical word game.  We launched the game a pilot as a  game for transplant clinicians at a meeting in Google Play. Now we are here to enhance this game for you in the subjects you desire.  We believe that even the most serious situations sometime benefit from a little good natured humor or wit, and HealthWords is going to add that to the medical mix.  

Propose a game for development for $2. If it falls within our toolbox, we will post development of your proposed game as a $2 perk. If your perk gets 20 votes, we design your game and you get all HealthWords games for a year free of charge. 

Be a Leader: Be one of the First to Order Health Words, in the Category of Your Choice for $10

Help us pick the next modules for development.  Vote for your choice by preordering a game ($10 Perk). Your $10 vote also gets you all HealthWords games created through 2015 free of charge. We have listed timetables for development of several games already in the hopper.  With your help, however, we can go much faster and to the areas you desire most.  


Use HealthWords to Educate, Engage, and Entertain Your Practice or Employees for $250

We can design a HealthWords for your practice or business. Fill the game with the content you desire from the available topics. Lace in data that you would like to transmit specifically for your practice or employees: new services you have added, prominent milestones,  holiday greetings, even just hours and contact information. We can add the latter features in our Feature of the Day function, giving users access to this information 24/7.


Other Perks: T Shirts and Hats

The cornerstone of our perks are our games. We will get these to you as soon as wel complete them. If you want something in the more immediate future to show your support, buy a Play-it Health hat or T Shirt and spread the word. 


With This Campaign, We Will Enrich our Gaming Platform to Make it Work For You

We are all different. Different items motivate us, and we all see different things as fun. This campaign will help us create more diversity in the games coupled with our system. Our belief is that the world works best through diversity, in every way. 

Specifically, before your eyes, we will:

Pick the next modules of HealthWords,

Modify the features of HealthWords,

Enrich the challenge platform,

Get to know your fellow crowdfunders.

Create our community.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are ways to contribute other than funds. Let us here your voice. Join our Facebook community  and become part of our growing family. Please tell your friends, and share us from this site. Send us a picture of you, your family, or your friends having fun being healthy and we will post it on our wall. 
    Follow us, and be with us when we launch the game we design from here. 

    Play-it Health Thanks You

    Our team thanks you for listening.

There are ways to contribute other than funds. Let us here your voice. Join our Facebook community  and become part of our growing family. Please tell your friends, and share us from this site. story:
Importance of Oral Health + Hydration

What's the connection between oral health and overall health?

Did you know that your oral health can offer clues about your overall health — or that problems in your mouth can affect the rest of your body? Understanding the intimate connection between oral health and overall health is key to staying healthy.

Taking good care of your mouth, teeth and gums is a worthy goal in and of itself. Good oral and dental hygiene can help prevent bad breath, tooth decay and gum disease—and can help you keep your teeth as you get older.  Researchers are also discovering new reasons to brush and floss.  A healthy mouth may help you ward off medical disorders. The flip side? An unhealthy mouth, especially if you have gum disease, may increase your risk of serious health problems such as heart attack, stroke, poorly controlled diabetes and preterm labor.*

Like many areas of the body, your mouth is teeming with bacteria — most of them harmless. Normally the body's natural defenses and good oral health care, such as daily brushing and flossing, can keep these bacteria under control. However, without proper oral hygiene, bacteria can reach levels that might lead to oral infections, such as tooth decay and gum disease. 

*Additional details on Oral Health: http://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-living/adult-...

Why is it so important to stay properly hydrated?

Whether you’re a serious athlete, recreational exerciser, or just trying to stay healthy, it’s important to make sure you get the right amount of water before, during and after exercising. Water regulates your body temperature, lubricates joints and helps transport nutrients for energy and health. If you’re not properly hydrated, your body will be unable to perform at its highest level, and you may experience fatigue, muscle cramps, dizziness or more serious symptoms.

Water is life.  You need water to eliminate toxic substances, produce digestive enzymes, maintain healthy skin, hair and organs, and to help your body absorb essential vitamins, minerals and natural sugars.  Water also regulates body temperature, stimulates metabolism and helps promote regularity.  Fluids other than pure water don’t act the same as water in your body, and they don’t meet your needs for hydration like water does.  Most people are slightly dehydrated from relying on other fluids besides water for their fluid intake.  Coffee, tea, alcohol, sodas (or any other caffeinated beverages) don’t count; they’re diuretics, which means they actually remove water and nutrients from the body.
Chronic dehydration has been linked to the following symptoms and disease processes:  Fatigue, constipation, headaches, indigestion, muscle and joint aches and pains, high blood pressure, depression, allergies, lack of mental clarity, skin issues and excess weight.
Introducing Breathometer Mint

Introducing Mint™- the worlds first portable Breath Quality and Hydration level detection product.  Simply place Mint in your mouth, let it automatically draw a sample of the air in your mouth and within seconds the Breathometer app on your smartphone will let you know the quality of your breath, as well as how hydrated you are. 

How do we measure Breath Quality? 

Volatile Sulfur Compounds (VSCs) are created by anaerobic bacteria biofilms in the mouth.  VSCs can be elevated by certain foods and beverages you consume and may also indicate gum disease and tooth decay.  In all cases, elevated VSCs can reduce breath quality and increase social anxiety about your breath.

(Our Breath Quality Sensor is measuring: Hydrogen Sulfide, Methyl Mercapthan and Hydrogen Disulfide levels in parts per billion)

How do we measure Hydration?

Detecting hydration levels in the mouth is accomplished by measuring the moisture level of your mucus membrane - which is the first place where dehydration symptoms occur.  The importance of maintaining hydration levels for optimal health and wellness continues to grow.  Mint detects hydration where it first shows signs of impact.  Certain medications can also cause dry mouth- or oral dehydration.   Mint provides information about the state of oral hydration and allows you to track hydration level trends and will present recommendations on how to improve your overall hydration goals.

The Breathometer App

The free Breathometer App will work on an IOS iPhone 5 or newer, as well as select Android products when it is released in January 2016*.  Android compatibility will include: Samsung Galaxy S4, Samsung Galaxy S5, Nexus 5.   The same Breathometer App is used to support all Breathometer products.  Available on Google Play and the AppStore.

Mint Beta App Screens:

 

What We Need & What You Get

Breathometer is launching Mint™ on Indiegogo to obtain Beta Program participants to further test and validate the features prior to shipping a final product later in the year.  We also want to provide our Indiegogo supporters with access to the first production units when we are ready to ship direct customer orders in January 2016*.  Simply select the Perk that fits your needs best!

  • Beta Program Perk has been closed- as we secured the necessary participants during the original campaign period.  
  • Mint Perk customers receive the first production units we ship to our direct customers!    
  • International Customers- our International Perks include the shipping costs of the Mint products, which will be provided as gifts for your contributions when we are shipping production units- expect to have ready in January 2016.  
  • All funds raised through this Indiegogo campaign will go towards the development and production of the Breathometer Mint product. 

Autocad designs of final production unit:

Final design of actual production unit:

Technical Specifications

    Sensor Technology:  Electro-Chemical Fuel Cell

    Connectivity:  Bluetooth LE Wireless

    Battery:  Rechargeable- Micro USB Cable included

    Battery Life:  10-14 Days per charge

    Warm Up Time:  None

Production Timeline 



Risks, Challenges & Where We Are 

We are building a product that has never been made available to consumers before!  There are clinical systems available for dentists and labs like the Halimeter®-which like the Mint™, measures VSCs in parts per billion to assist dentists in treating halitosis with their patients during office visits.  Breathometer is combining this sensor technology in an ultra-portable product with hydration detection to provide consumers with the ability to better manage their overall breath quality and hydration levels. 

We know the sensors in Mint™ work, the information is relevant and that the data is actionable.    Prototype Mint products are already in use in our lab, where we are refining sensor calibration and testing different hydration and VSC settings.  We need some active Beta Program Members to assist in refining our detection settings, evaluate in different environments, recommended actions and additional features in our application.  We expect to be shipping direct customer orders in January 2016.  Beta program members will start receiving Beta samples by May 2015.

Company Story    

The Breathometer team successfully launched their first product -- the Original Alcohol Breathometer on Indiegogo in March 2013!  The Original Breathometer got us started and opened the door to pitching all 5 Sharks on Shark Tank later that year. Following the lead of our original Indiegogo supporters – all five Sharks supported our vision of using sensors and breath detection to help people make more informed decisions and to live healthier lives. 

With two products now on the market addressing Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) detection with the Original Breathometer and Breeze™ the wireless and wearable breathalyzer- we are ready to address a totally new category!  Introducing Mint™, a Breathometer to detect Breath Quality and Hydration levels!  Key indications of your Oral Health and overall wellness!

The Breathometer Team 

Breathometer In The Press

"Breathometer already has a highly-accurate BAC breathalyzer on the market called the Breeze, and the company's repurposed that same technology for the MINT.” 

-Andrew Liszewski

Gizmodo

"The latest product from Breathometer — the company that brought us a clever Bluetooth breathalyzer in 2014 — functions as a wireless breath vacuum that gives you a real-time evaluation of your oral hygiene and hydration. It’ll also offer advice on how to improve them. “

-Alyssa Bereznak

Yahoo Tech


Referral Program

Help us spread the word about Mint by email and social media. Earn a free Mint for referring 3 or more friends who buy a Breathometer Mint through our Indiegogo campaign.  ***New program offer !  If you refer 6 or more people to purchase a Mint Perk of $89 or higher- you will also receive a Breathometer Breeze!

The fine print: Once the Indiegogo campaign is over we will apply all your earned credits for referrals to your account. Contributors cannot refer themselves. Only the contributor named by a referred person at the time of the referred person’s purchase will receive credit. To receive credit, you must first be a Breathometer Mint Indiegogo contributor.

Frequently Asked Questions

> What is Breath Quality really measuring?  

Our Breath Quality Sensor is measuring: Hydrogen Sulfide, Methyl Mercapthan and Hydrogen Disulfide levels in parts per billion

> What is the Beta Program?  

We are looking for 200 people to test our product before it is released.  This program will provide participants with pre-production products and early versions of our Breathometer app for the Mint product.  Beta Participants will be required to execute a Non-Disclosure agreement and provide regular feedback on their product experiences.  At the successful completion of the Beta Program, each participant will receive a final production Mint product with the return of their Beta Mint Product.  Beta Participants will need an iPhone 5 or newer. The Beta program will not support Android- prior to shipping final products in January.

> When will Mint ship? 

We expect to fulfill all orders by January 2016.  Our Beta Program will start in May 2015 and if all goes as expected, we may be able to ship final products before January.

> How is the Mint Powered? 

Mint is powered by a rechargeable lithium battery, that supports 7-10 days of normal use (4-5 tests a day) on each charge.  Recharging is supported through a standard micro USB cable connected to a powered USB port.

Does Breathometer Mint require FDA Registration?

Mint will require the same medical device- Class 1 clearance requiring  FDA Registration.  The same clearance obtained for all prior Breathometer products.

Does what I eat effect breath quality?

In short — yes it very well can.  However, not all foods and beverages effect the VSCs we are measuring.  Onions, Garlic and other foods naturally can impact the VSCs immediately after eating, as well as hours later.  Items like cigarette smoke do not necessarily impact VSC levels directly — so those would not be detected.

What smartphones is Mint compatible with?   

The Breathometer App is available on the App Store and Google Play.   Supporting IOS 8 or newer, running on iPhone 5 or newer.  Android version 4.3 and above.  Specifically supported phones: Samsung Galaxy S4, Samsung Galaxy S5, Nexus 5.

How do I contact someone on the Breathometer team?

Please visit our Contact Page on our website.

Breathometer.com
#BreathometerMint

story:
Hi there! I'm Zita, 24. I'm from the Netherlands but currently I live in Liverpool, United Kingdom. Almost a year and a half ago, I set myself the challenge to run the New York marathon in 2015. And now it's time. I've struggled a lot with injuries, but it's a fight I'm battling and willing to undertake. A lot of people fight a much more difficult fight: cancer. That's why I am running this marathon, to raise money for the Dutch Cancer Foundation. I would love your support. 

Why this is important:
Because we all know someone who lost the fight, who is currently fighting or who won the fight against cancer. We want to contribute to the best of our ability because we believe everyone deserves a tomorrow.

Run for Life team 2015 exists of 35 runners and many more supporters. If we all meet our targets this year, Run for Life will have raised over €125.000 for the Dutch Cancer Society in the last 5 years. This is something that we are really proud of and we are confident that this money has contributed and will contribute towards better support, more research and an improvement of treatment and quality of life for those affected by this horrible disease.

What's Next:
This is just the beginning! On November 1st I will run a full marathon and I need all the support I can get! I'm aiming to raise about £1500 through crowd-funding, offline campaigns and the support of friends and family. I am already on my way, but I need your support!

This is how you can help:

Please donate to help me reach my target. No matter how big or small your donation is, I will be eternally grateful for your support. 

Please help spread the word and tell people about Run for Life and my efforts.

If donating is not possible for you, don't worry. I understand. Mental support helps me too!

Thank you. 


Zita

story: I am looking to raise around £80,000 to enable me to open a healing and retreat center in Kefalonia, Ionian Islands. The Property will be small, enough to hold retreats, training and healing events. A tranquil place that brings peace and calm serenity. The Property will be used for deep therapeutic healing light work and also will be available for other Practitioners/Therapists to rent out or just for a holiday break.

story:
Pittsburgh Octane lacrosse is an Amateur indoor lacrosse team made up of players from the Pittsburgh and surrounding areas.  We are a team of 25 guys who have a passion for lacrosse. 

Each year our players pay to play themselves and most of our players are fresh out of college who cannot always afford to play because of this.  Contributors will allow these players to continue to play and share their love of lacrosse. 

When you Donate:

All money donated allows the Octane Lacrosse team to play indoor lacrosse.  All of our funding goes to the following areas:

* Field Costs (Rental fees for practice and game facilities)
* Uniforms
* Travel (we travel throughout the Mid-West often in our own cars up to locations 6-8 hours away)
* Insurance Costs (Keep the players safe)
* League and Tournament fees.

Even if we do not hit our goal any and all money helps us offset these costs so that players do not have to pay exorbitant amounts to play.

The Impact

The impact of this allows our players to continue playing this exciting game and also allows us to share the incredible game of indoor lacrosse to the youth players of the Pittsburgh area. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute today, anything counts and sharing our campaign with friends, family and amateur sports lovers also contributes to our team.
