This is how Clair-S was created.It was not easy to add the whole new technology to the original product, maintaining its basic features. We had to utilize the extra inner space just to add up the additional function as needed without disturbing the optimized air channel.It was a very difficult work but our amazing engineers never gave up and finally made the stablized module by downsizing the newly added parts. Now, we are about to get into mass production and we need your help to launch Clair-S in the market with full of pride. story:
The Move It Swift Smart Boxing Gloves with 6-axis motion sensor and patented algorithms track your every motion and tell your performance with unique lighting effects, all in real time. You can enjoy online programs and professional instructions and review your workout summaries on the App.

 

With patented tracking algorithms, the App will show your punching data in real time such as force/speed/calories. It will learn your punching style, which means the more you use it, the more precise the algotithms can be.

 

The gloves come equipped with interactive lighting effects that can respond to your workout intensity, helping you understand your workout progress at a glance. Dynamic changing lights make your punches look distinctive and unique!

 

With high precision of 6-axis gyroscopic motion sensors, the Move It Swift can accurately track your movements and tell if you’re delivering straights, hooks or uppercuts, even if you’re chaining them together.

Its patented algorithms will optimize to your training style. This can help you scientifically assess your own workouts, so you can avoid injury and maximize your efficiency, speed and power.

 

Summaries are synched to your mobile device so you can look back and measure your progress over time. 

Your time is valuable, so Move It Swift can help you adjust your personal training plan according to your training data, and help you train smarter and more efficiently than ever before.

 

There are optional courses in the Move It Swift App, from beginner to master. Whether you’re a novice looking to improve your fundamentals, or a skilled professional looking to move in one step further, you can always find a tailored course that suit your level of fitness on Move It Swift App. 

With our partnered professional coach, you will feel the same exercise-induced effects as on a gym atmosphere. You are not only provided effective programs, but also be encouraged to regularly workout at home.

 

The Move It Swift App will automatically capture your spotlights, which you can share with your friends through social platforms!

Your workouts will be scored based on the training data. And TOP 100 of the month will be displayed on 3 ranking boards: Punch Count, Average Speed and Average Force.

 

Made of durable materials with special, ergonomic design, the gloves are perfect for long-term, heavy-duty use, without wearing out.

In addition, the Move It Swift gloves use high density foam padding and full-length cuffs for shock absorption and wrist protection. And the mesh fabric lining design is made for better breathable experience.

 

One of the best things about the gloves is that it can be used anywhere with no restriction. Wether in the gym , office or outdoors, Move It Swift never stops helping you challenge your limits. 

The second point of Move It Swift is that it supports all the platforms including TV, IPad and Phone! You will never miss a punch training when you are ready.

The detachable sensor can be charged separately. Fully charging within 40 minutes, it can last 5 days with 30-minute daily using or a month for standby. You don’t need to worry about your gear but just focus on what really matters - bringing all you have to every punch. 

 

Gloves aren’t the only thing you can punch with! There is also a Reflex Bag you can add to your training plan.

Adjustable height and rebound speed make this ideal for users of any height or experience level. Plus, the cemented carbide spring is made tough enough to withstand years of use and abuse, all while bouncing back reliably and safely from even your most punishing strikes.

The outer skin is wear-proof and punch-proof for long-lasting use. It also contains special multi-layer paddings that provide perfect cushioning to protect you from injury.

The bag delivers unparalleled stability with its unique suction pad design. No matter it’s on ceramic tile or wood floor, you will never worry about it tipping over or moving around.

 

We are here to help you choose the correct OZ for your boxing gloves. Regardless if you are searching for an all-round boxing glove or specific sparring gloves, we will help you find the correct size to choose when buying boxing gloves.

Typically used for fighting and competition only. Very small on adult hands so reserved for full contact tournaments and fights. Best used for women and youths. Also very regular in competitions in the stadiums of Thailand.  (Up to 110 lbs – 50 kg)

The smallest practical adult glove, a great choice for hitting pads with your coach or on the heavy bag. A 10 oz glove will be appropriate for someone with smaller hands looking to hone techniques. It is recommend that you should train with 10 oz before a competition so that you can emulate the gloves used in the fight. (100 lbs – 150 lbs / 45 kg – 67 kg)

The 12 oz is more common use for pads and light sparring. Works also excellent to use when drilling with your training partner. The best all-around training glove is an 12 oz glove if you are not sure what size to buy. (100 lbs – 150 lbs / 45 kg – 67 kg)

Used mostly for sparring and a very good “all-rounder” glove. This size is suitable to use in free-sparring and hitting pads. They are slightly lighter than the large 16 oz’s and as such don’t tire your arms as much when you’re hitting pads.  (151 lbs – 175 lbs / 68 kg – 79 kg)

Used for heavy sparring. If you hit hard, have big hands or weighs over 80 kg, these gloves are essential in protecting your partner’s safety. They are bigger and safer because they have a wider area with more padding. You should definitely use these gloves when you are sparring, but they will also work great for pads.  (Over 175 lbs / 80 kg)

 
 
 
 

Move It Pro is a four-in-one portable home gym. It features an interactive workout platform that links the fitness equipment to intelligent handles and sensors. The professional programs on Move It App provides instant feedback on reps and calories burned, motivating you to keep training at home.

 

Eggplant Tech established on December 2014 in Asia as an IoT company. In 2015, our brand "Move It" completed its first product crowdfunding campaign on Xiaomi's Youpin platform. Since then, we have become part of Xiaomi's ecosystem, as well as one of the leading integrated hardware and software brands in smart fitness. We are a passionate team of over 40 people, consisting of specialized individuals in business development, design, software, electrical, and backend development.

 

Move It is the core brand of Eggplant Tech. The name is based upon the idea that you just need to "Get Up and Move" to achieve good health. Move It is focused in providing engaging fitness workouts and community experiences to help people feel connected and motivated, so that exercise will be embraced as part of their lifestyle.

 

 

 

 

Move It Swift products have entered the mass production stage. As a group of fitness fans who want to change the fitness equipment market, we honor our ideals and also cherish our relationship with customers. We promise guaranteed delivery as an official team. You will always have our back.

Move It Pro is a four-in-one portable home gym. It features an interactive workout platform that links the fitness equipment to intelligent handles and sensors. The professional programs on Move It App provides instant feedback on reps and calories burned, motivating you to keep training at home. Eggplant Tech established on December 2014 in Asia as an IoT company. In 2015, our brand "Move It" completed its first product crowdfunding campaign on Xiaomi's Youpin platform. Since then, we have become part of Xiaomi's ecosystem, as well as one of the leading integrated hardware and software brands in smart fitness. We are a passionate team of over 40 people, consisting of specialized individuals in business development, design, software, electrical, and backend development. Move It is the core brand of Eggplant Tech. The name is based upon the idea that you just need to "Get Up and Move" to achieve good health. Move It is focused in providing engaging fitness workouts and community experiences to help people feel connected and motivated, so that exercise will be embraced as part of their lifestyle.    Move It Swift products have entered the mass production stage. As a group of fitness fans who want to change the fitness equipment market, we honor our ideals and also cherish our relationship with customers. We promise guaranteed delivery as an official team. You will always have our back.

story:
A battery-powered motor fan pushes air into the BioVYZR, creating positive pressure inside the BioVYZR's hood. This positive pressure pushes out exhaled air from inside through two filtering air vents. Inflowing air passes through a KN95 filter to remove up to 95% of particulate matter from the inflowing air. This includes, but is not limited to, aerosol-transmitted pathogens, mist droplets, pollen, dust, soot, and pet dander. It's important to keep in mind that if infectious particles are caught in the filters, it is important to take precautions when replacing the filters to avoid contamination. Your BioVYZR will come with detailed instructions on how to safely replace and dispose of used filters. 

 

 



 

 

 

 


 



We're able to execute this ambitious production timeline because we already have established material sourcing and manufacturing partners on the ground. Before pivoting to the BioVYZR, we were already in the process of manufacturing our own product lines. As of June 10, 2020, we're currently in the middle of production for our first batch.  Please be sure to check our update for the latest information.  
 

 

PRODUCT DESCRIPTION 

The BioVYZR is an outer layer that protects against airborne hazards in our daily environments. When it comes to protecting against airborne hazards, it can provide better protection than face masks and KN95 respirators. Its proprietary design offers a 360-degree seal to shield your personal space on all sides. It also features a built-in air purifying system to filter out pathogens, allergens, and pollutants from the air you breathe. The BioVYZR a type of PPE known as a Powered Air Purifying Respirator (or PAPR). These are mostly used in industrial or healthcare environments. The BioVYZR 1.0 packs this critical technology into a practical design to help keep you safe on the go.


KEY FEATURES

  • Anti-Fogging Face Shield
  • High Optical Clarity and Wide Angle View
  • Air Purification System works for up to 8 hours on a single charge
  • Ultra-quiet airflow less than 10 Dba
  • Includes 1 box of 10 KN95 Particulate Filter Discs
  • Built-in reversible glove for scratching face 
  • Convenient front storage zipper pocket 
  • 3 Sizes: Small, Medium and Large (see sizing chart)
  • Two adjustable side straps with buckles
  • Lightweight and Durable
  • Easy to wear and remove
  • Compact and Packable
  •  Innovative Canadian Design
  • USB port allows you to power the BioVYZR, whether you're stationary or on the go, using any USB compatible power source.


SPECIFICATIONS

  • Materials: Neoprene, Marine Vinyl, Silicone
  • Weatherproofing: Sealed seams
  • Air Filters: KN95
  • Weight: 2.2 kg (with power bank).
  • Product care: See Care & Safety Instructions


WHERE TO USE IT

  • Crowded public spaces
  • Indoors Air Conditioned Spaces
  • Airports and transport hubs
  • Public Transport (Subway, Train, Bus)
  • School and University Classrooms
  • Work, Meetings and the Office
  • Social gatherings and functions
  • Events and Conferences



VYZR Technologies was founded by siblings Dina and Yezin Al-Qaysi in response to the lack of innovative and effective Protective Personal Equipment (PPEs) available to the public in the face of a global pandemic. 

Our team is made up of passionate designers, problem solvers, and entrepreneurs working in overdrive to create gear for our new normal. Based in Toronto, Canada and working in quarantine, we believe that our real challenge is not COVID-19. It’s dealing with a complete lack of effective PPEs required to protect the population and prevent transmission. 

The first product we’re deploying, the BioVYZR, is a consumer-grade Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).

We hope it will help you breathe easy as we prepare for life beyond quarantine. 

​

 

IMPORTANT:  We only ship to addresses in USA & Canada. We charge a flat rate of $55 CAD ($41 USD) to ship each BioVYZR. Please note that BioVYZRs come in a large box, with dimensions of 33'' x 22" x 9.5". 

If you want to ship your order to an international destination, please consider using a shipping forwarder like MYUS.com or shipito.com. We will ship to the US address that they provide and they will consolidate your shipment, and send it to your country at highly competitive rates.  Please note that given the complexity of International Shipping, we will be unable to process returns for international orders. 


 

Our project team is comprised of seasoned entrepreneurs, product designers and supply chain experts with more than 25 years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience. We’re committed to making sure that our products will exceed your expectations. 

The BioVYZR is a first in its category. It’s also the byproduct of a new and uncertain time and there are many unknowns ahead. Our manufacturing partners are on board and they assure us they have the materials and manpower to get everything produced on time and to our exacting standards. 

We'd also emphasize that what you’re seeing on this page are prototypes, so expect the final product to be better built and more amazing looking. We're actively working on our round two prototypes which will have the finalized air purifying and ventilation functionality. 

One of the supply chain risks we’re concerned about relates to the N95/N99 filters our BioVYZRs will require. Two of these layers use a very special material called Melt-Blown fiber. Not only is this nano-filtering material extremely difficult to produce, but with the global COVID-19 pandemic in full swing, there’s a global supply shortage. This has made it both scarce and more expensive. Luckily we have many connections to suppliers of this material, but there is a risk that accessing it could become even more difficult in the near future. 

The final risk is any disruption in the transport of goods globally. We know that oil prices are experiencing a lot of volatility as are the airline and shipping industries. We’re monitoring the situation closely and we’re committed to doing our absolute best to make sure you get your BioVYZR in a timely manner.

Anti-Fogging Face Shield
High Optical Clarity and Wide Angle View
Air Purification System works for up to 8 hours on a single charge
Ultra-quiet airflow less than 10 Dba
Includes 1 box of 10 KN95 Particulate Filter Discs
Built-in reversible glove for scratching face 
Convenient front storage zipper pocket 
3 Sizes: Small, Medium and Large (see sizing chart)
Two adjustable side straps with buckles
Lightweight and Durable
Easy to wear and remove
Compact and Packable
 Innovative Canadian Design
USB port allows you to power the BioVYZR, whether you're stationary or on the go, using any USB compatible power source.
SPECIFICATIONS
Materials: Neoprene, Marine Vinyl, Silicone
Weatherproofing: Sealed seams
Air Filters: KN95
Weight: 2.2 kg (with power bank).
Product care: See Care & Safety Instructions
WHERE TO USE IT
Crowded public spaces
Indoors Air Conditioned Spaces
Airports and transport hubs
Public Transport (Subway, Train, Bus)
School and University Classrooms
Work, Meetings and the Office
Social gatherings and functions
Events and Conferences
VYZR Technologies was founded by siblings Dina and Yezin Al-Qaysi in response to the lack of innovative and effective Protective Personal Equipment (PPEs) available to the public in the face of a global pandemic. Our team is made up of passionate designers, problem solvers, and entrepreneurs working in overdrive to create gear for our new normal. Based in Toronto, Canada and working in quarantine, we believe that our real challenge is not COVID-19. It’s dealing with a complete lack of effective PPEs required to protect the population and prevent transmission. The first product we’re deploying, the BioVYZR, is a consumer-grade Powered Air Purifying Respirator (PAPR).We hope it will help you breathe easy as we prepare for life beyond quarantine. ​ IMPORTANT:  We only ship to addresses in USA & Canada. We charge a flat rate of $55 CAD ($41 USD) to ship each BioVYZR. Please note that BioVYZRs come in a large box, with dimensions of 33'' x 22" x 9.5". If you want to ship your order to an international destination, please consider using a shipping forwarder like MYUS.com or shipito.com. We will ship to the US address that they provide and they will consolidate your shipment, and send it to your country at highly competitive rates.  Please note that given the complexity of International Shipping, we will be unable to process returns for international orders.  Our project team is comprised of seasoned entrepreneurs, product designers and supply chain experts with more than 25 years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience. We’re committed to making sure that our products will exceed your expectations. The BioVYZR is a first in its category. It’s also the byproduct of a new and uncertain time and there are many unknowns ahead. Our manufacturing partners are on board and they assure us they have the materials and manpower to get everything produced on time and to our exacting standards. We'd also emphasize that what you’re seeing on this page are prototypes, so expect the final product to be better built and more amazing looking. We're actively working on our round two prototypes which will have the finalized air purifying and ventilation functionality. One of the supply chain risks we’re concerned about relates to the N95/N99 filters our BioVYZRs will require. Two of these layers use a very special material called Melt-Blown fiber. Not only is this nano-filtering material extremely difficult to produce, but with the global COVID-19 pandemic in full swing, there’s a global supply shortage. This has made it both scarce and more expensive. Luckily we have many connections to suppliers of this material, but there is a risk that accessing it could become even more difficult in the near future. The final risk is any disruption in the transport of goods globally. We know that oil prices are experiencing a lot of volatility as are the airline and shipping industries. We’re monitoring the situation closely and we’re committed to doing our absolute best to make sure you get your BioVYZR in a timely manner.

story:
Though we may have reached our initial financial goal on Indiegogo, our mission is far from over. Every penny will accelerate the development of a working prototype, accelerate the necessary testing we will need to do, and ultimately accelerate manufacturing. The more money we raise through this Indiegogo campaign, the more resources we can deploy to speed this technology into the hands of the people who need it. 

For example, recently we were able to purchase a piece of equipment that will allow us to execute one portion of our micro-blower construction completely in-house. Read more about why this is so important.  Click here to read more.

 

We invite you to learn more below about the Airing technology and contribute what you can to make Airing happen. Informed and committed, we are all in this together!

 

 

 

 

 

 
You read that right. We invented a micro-CPAP device that has no hoses, no cords, and no mask. We did it because too many people have sleep apnea, and too many of those don’t wear their CPAP masks. Who can blame them with those masks and hoses? But we need your help to get it out of the lab and into your hands. 
 
 
 
Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) is typically caused by a blockage of the airway when the soft tissue in the rear of the throat collapses during sleep. Untreated, OSA causes a number of serious health problems, including high blood pressure, cardiovascular disease, memory impairment, weight gain, and headaches. The standard treatment for OSA is what is known as “Continuous Positive Airway Pressure,” or CPAP. 

CPAP machines can mitigate this problem, but their poor design causes sleep apnea sufferers to give up on it: 80% of CPAP users stop using it within one year. Airing intends to change that with a revolutionary design that will work as well as any other CPAP machine, and patients won't have to deal with cumbersome, uncomfortable masks.
 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Another reason patients give up on the traditional CPAP masks is that they get dirty and need to be cleaned regularly. Not so with Airing. Each Airing device is designed for one night’s use only and is recyclable. As a result, every night you get a clean device with no cleaning to do, ever. Airing also liberates you from the “mess” of uncomfortable straps and the noisy hum that both come with other CPAP machines. 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Airing’s design is a combination of several inventions, chief of which are the micro-blowers originally intended for heat regulation for chips in computers. These micro-blowers are entirely contained within the Airing device, so there is no need for external air hoses. Each Airing device is battery operated, so no need for any power wires. Just “plug” the comfortable buds into your nostrils and breathe all night long.
 

 

 

CPAP masks have a hard time maintaining a perfect seal onto your face as you move during sleep. The sound of rushing air will wake up not only you but also your partner. The hoses used by CPAP masks drag on the end table and on the bed, causing sleep disruptions. But Airing creates a tight fit inside your nostrils with no hoses to catch on anything. Better yet, snoring is eliminated.
 

Think about how liberated you could be with not just one good night's sleep, but hundreds of them. Think about health problems you will avoid. Think about the energy you will have. Think about how much more productive you will be at work, the potential car accidents you’ll avoid, even your golf handicap decreasing by 3 shots. In short, think about how liberated you will be when you start using Airing to manage your sleep apnea.
 

 


 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The timing of the development of complex and innovative technologies is difficult to predict precisely. Delay in achieving one milestone affects the remaining development process.

 

 
If you are interested in writing about Airing, feel free to contact us at  contact@fundairing.com
 
 

 

 

Airing will use your money to accelerate the execution of our development plan. We will be able to expand our technical staff and get access to the equipment and materials critical to building a working prototype of our micro-blowers, which we can then test. The more we raise, the more resources we can deploy to speed this technology into the hands of the people who need it.

 

Technical Update 3/14/15: 

 

We are very close to having the first fully-constructed micro-blower subassemblies completed. Once we have them, we will begin testing their functionality.

 

To prepare for this testing, we have just completed a key, customized component of our test system. This component, called a device under test (DUT) test fixture, will eventually allow us to test the operational performance of the micro-blower technology we have been building.  Click to read more

 

 

 

We love the idea of involving the people directly and indirectly impacted by sleep apnea in a communal effort to bring about this revolutionary product. We know what we need to do, and we need your support to do it. This is your chance to contribute directly to dealing with a major health issue that affects tens of millions of people. But you have to exercise your vote to change the world of sleep apnea. One at a time, collectively your contributions can be a powerful force in enabling us to realize the awesome potential of this technology.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you don't have the funds to contribute, you can still help us!

 

  1. 'Like' us on Facebook/ Follow us on Twitter!
  2. Share our campaign with your friends on social media!
 

Here is a video from our Chairman explaining why we chose crowdfunding to do this important job:
 


 

 


 


 

How much will Airing cost? 
The short answer is $3 per Airing device, or $0.60 after insurance reimbursement. But it's important to understand the technology behind Airing to appreciate how we plan to produce the device at such a low cost per unit. Click for full FAQ page >

 

 

Will Airing be comfortable and stay in my nose? 
A key component of Airing’s micro-CPAP device is what we call the "nasal interface," a fancy way of saying nose buds. We have designed, built and tested this component while integrated to a test housing. This test housing allowed for normal breathing straight through with no micro-blowers and allowed us to simulate the size and weight of the proposed completed device. Various nose bud designs were evaluated. Click for full FAQ page >

 

Can Airing produce as much air pressure as a typical CPAP machine? 
The pressure generated by the typical CPAP machine ranges from 1 to 20 centimeters of water (cmH20), known as the treatment number. A doctor or sleep technician tests the patient to determine the appropriate treatment number. The Airing device has been designed to generate the full range of treatment pressures up to and in excess of a treatment number of 20. Click for full FAQ page >

 

 

Will Airing require additional humidification?
The Airing device has been designed so as not to require active humidification. The human nose has evolved to filter the air it breathes in through a pathway with tiny hairs and to humidify this pathway with every exhalation. Click for full FAQ page >

How will Airing deal with mouth breathers?
Nature’s design of the nose is outstanding. In normal circumstances, the default position of the mouth is closed. When nose breathing is diminished or obstructed, nature provides a backup: mouth breathing. Click for full FAQ page >

Is the Airing device FDA approved? 
No, not yet. However, we do believe the process of getting FDA clearance may be abbreviated. Here's why. The Airing device does not provide a new treatment. The Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) treatment has been around and used with FDA clearance for years. The Airing device merely miniaturizes existing machinery into a portable and comfortable format. We hope, although we obviously cannot guarantee, that the FDA would agree that the device is a constructive modification of an already cleared treatment and be willing to approve its use on a timely basis.

Sale of the Airing micro-CPAP is subject to FDA clearance. Airing will review FDA requirements as part of the development process. The following content is Airing’s vision of the final design of the device. As a contributor to this Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign, you are supporting Airing’s intent to develop the world's first micro-CPAP device.  Click for full FAQ page >

Is Airing available internationally? 

It is our intention make Airing available worldwide. As with all medical devices, Airing will be subject to local regulation and requirements. 

 

 

What is your Refund Policy?

 

Indiegogo recently updated their refund policy.  The Indiegogo policy states:

Effective Tuesday, September 1, 2015, contributors may request a refund from Indiegogo, before the end of a fixed or flexible funding campaign they have contributed to. For campaigns that have entered the InDemand program, contributors may request a refund from Indiegogo within 10 days of the contribution.

Contributions are eligible for a refund by Indiegogo, unless:

 (a) the contribution funds have already been transferred to the Campaign Owner,

(b) the Perk associated with the contribution has been fulfilled, or

(c) Indiegogo determines that there has been an abuse of these Terms of Use, or the refund policy.

To request a refund, please contact the Customer Happiness team, and they will process your request within one business day. Refunds will be issued based on the payment method used to make the contribution, and may take three to five business days to appear on your statement.

Please be advised that contributions to Airing are not refundable beyond the policy stated above (within 10 days of contribution). After this period, Indiegogo takes out their fees, the remaining funds are transferred to us (without your credit card/payment information), and we begin putting those funds to good use.  By making a contribution to this campaign, you acknowledge that you understand that you are contributing to fund the development of the Airing micro-CPAP device and not making a direct purchase. We appreciate your support, and we are hard at work developing the Airing prototype.

How can I contact Airing with questions?
Please email us any questions at contact@fundairing.com.
 


 



Thank you for your interest and, hopefully, support.

story:
Our Story

My name is Jean-Sébastien & that's me and my wife Sommer back when she could smile! Sommer has a very RARE Bone disease and she has been through so much in her young years. We are now in our early 30s and have been married for 12yrs...and she has spent 8 of our Anniversaries in the hospital. Sommer has had well over 25 major surgeries including hip replacements and spinal decompression surgeies, plus countless other medical procedures, and years of physical therapy. She is only 3ft 7 and as you can see I stand a bit taller at 6ft1! We try to live a normal life and don't ask for much nor do we need a lot to be happy. We are so blessed to have a home, which we work hard for and have been blessed to use our home to help others in need (Sommer is most happy when we are able to help others & when are able to just enjoy each other's company). We also have loving friends and family who are helping us to get the word out. In the past few years Sommer is just now at a point where she is not in so much pain from her back and hip replacements. She works hard to exercise her muscles & has learned to walk all over again! She is learning to enjoy herself & live a better life! However, there is one surgery left to be done before we can start our family. Sommer's bone disease has attacked her jaw bones and is rapidly wearing them away. The bones in her Jaw and Mouth need to be stabilized as well as permanent dentures placed in her mouth as it has also worn away her teeth immensely. It's not just a cosmetic problem, all the nerves in her teeth are exposed and she has constant pain, headaches, problems eating, and a severe bone infection...because of the infection she cannot fight off any other germs that come her way and she stays sick constantly. We, along with her doctors, have tried for the last year and a half to get our medical insurance to cover the surgery but they will not do so because our insurance company does not possess the proper codes & processing manner to process the surgery as anything other than a "Dental surgery" and they do not intend to implement a process to help us or anyone else. Even though Sommer stays constantly sick and under doctor's care because of the damage to her bone and teeth, and it is obvious it is caused by her Bone disease, they will not reconsider. She has lost a lot of teeth and is embarrassed to go out in public although she tries to put on a brave face and positive attitude. I have watched her go from my once outgoing wife to shy, sickly, and timid. We are still paying medical bills from previous surgeries and the dentists do not offer payment plans. We get barely get by every month with all of her medical bills and it would take years and years to save for what we need...years she does not have. If you can help in any way it would be greatly appreciated!

 

The Impact

If this happens for her, I will see my sickly, weak, timid wife who doesn't go out anymore, go back to her wonderful, beautiful, outgoing self! She she can get back in action making people smile and helping others! She also sings, does a lot for the church,  and makes awesome sculptures..so she will be able to do that again and contribute to the world her talent! She had a beautiful smile...I can't wait to see her smile again! We will also be able to finally start a family since this will be one of the last surgeries she requires! If this does not happen, the bones will continue to deteriorate and she will stay constantly sick, eventually lose her ability to have any kind of implants, lose the ability to chew, or even speak. Sommer will still find a way to smile and make me smile but she will it will be hard living with constant medical problems and not being able to have a family...something we would love so dearly.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The longer we wait, the worse the condition and the more expensive it gets to fix. It is already become worse while waiting on the insurance. Right now the surgeons want half of the surgical amount of $20,000 which is of course $10,000. Then the prosthetic denture has an added cost of $25,000 and we are not sure yet about what our payment options for the prosthetic will be, if any at all. If we are able to raise the money we need, we will blog our process, take pics and inform you of every step of her journey! With your help, I can bring so much joy and life back to my beautiful wife!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this along to anyone you think could spare even a dollar! You can really change her life! You have no idea how much joy and happiness you will bring to her, her family, and me! You can always offer words of encouragement to her as well in the comment section because that in itself means a lot! Thank you so much!

Other Ways You Can Help
Please pass this along to anyone you think could spare even a dollar! You can really change her life! You have no idea how much joy and happiness you will bring to her, her family, and me! You can always offer words of encouragement to her as well in the comment section because that in itself means a lot! Thank you so much!

story:
Spread your legs and spread the word

- so we can stop the spread of cancer. 

Get #SpreadYourLegs trending so we can get the age of cervical screening down to 18!

"Everyone assumes that hearing you’ve got cancer will be the worst moment of your life. You’ve seen the adverts where there’s a load of sad people staring into the camera with tears in their eyes and sad expressions on their faces like they’ve realized that unicorns don’t actually exist. And they get chucked into breaks when you’re trying to relax with a few biscuits of an evening making you listen to how one in three people have this horrible disease. That’s enough to ruin anyone’s Emmedale"

Cancer is a mother bitch and if you have it, you don’t really know what to do with yourself. I want to show people the reality of cancer and how it affects or will affect them, their family, their friends, their cat and their unicorn.

My name is Effi Mai and I have a company called ForrReal. After being diagnosed with Cancer at seventeen I decided to do something for others. So five years later I told people I have the disease and here I am. I’ve had two types of the shitty thing myself, breast and cervical, which I’m sure is the universe’s way of telling me to stop having sex. If I get mouth cancer, I’ll really know. So what was I saying? Yes so still have the cervical stuff currently so now it’s time to share the knowledge and love and possibly prevent other girls from going through this.

So this is how we do it.


ForrReal is a few things.  First, it is an advice website for every woman. When I came out of the cancer closet my inbox started to fill with questions, inquiries, pictures of inspiring cats and all other fancy bits. I try and answer every email in detail, with dialogue, with humour (if sometimes a tad inappropriate) and all the positive princess love I can give.  Anything from what to eat to stop feeling nauseous to what wig is best to French braid. These questions and answers will all go public on the brand spanking new website.

Secondly, it is to let everyone know the real stuff about cancer. The effects of everything from beginning to end, the things that doctors don’t have the time to tell you and the stuff that will happen. How to check your breasts, how a lump feels, how not to panic and how to cope with having to tell your loved ones are just tiny examples.

If you start having chemo you might expect to feel sick, but you probably won’t expect to have a nosebleed while you’re wearing a white dress. If you’re put on pills to stop the hair loss you won’t expect to feel high and want to tell strangers on the tube that you love them. All in a cancer day. I want to put all the articles I have written into a book in due course once the company grows.

Thirdly, which is my biggest challenge, is that I want to get the age of which a woman has a cervical screening test down to the age of eighteen and to have a smear every two years. Living in Wales at the time, I was lucky enough to get a screening done at twenty years old and they caught it at stage two. Currently in England you have to be twenty-five before you even get a letter telling you should possibly maybe slightly think about going to get a smear test. And then you have to wait five years before you get another one. Cervical cancer can be cured if it is caught early and this just isn’t happening in the UK.  

**The LESBIAN add on to part three. If you are a lesbian, you can get cervical cancer. You don’t have to sleep with a penis to get it. You don’t have to do rude things in the back of mini with that penis either. You can get cervical cancer, gay or straight. Look at me for example, gold star lesbian, never slept with said penis and bam! It got me in the vagina.

Spread your legs and spread the word

It’s a company where there’s a community and there’s women and girls who can join together each knowing what the others are going through.

What we need from you princess faces

What I need for you is money for funding of the actual company ForrReal, and money for Effi and team to live on while we do it. Effi likes talking about herself in the third person and should do it more often.

I work from home on a magazine and newspaper that I plan to connect this company to. Also, when you're throwing up throughout the day it's difficult to maintain a proffessional outlook in an office environment.  I work on this every spare minute I have. I’ll even miss Pretty Little Liars in order to work on it. That’s dedication of the highest order in my world.

I also have a small team working with me so we can run the campaign and run the website smoothly, and they don’t really ask for much for working their bums off for this company. Just a slice of pizza and a shot of tequila now and then.

We need your help to keep things running, especially through the next few crucial months of our growth. We have made it this far with the support of everyone around us, and we believe that by putting all of our energy, commitment and unicorn love toward these efforts we will soon be able to support ourselves while continuing to fight cancer and help the people with this horrible disease every day. Let’s fuck cancer up the arse. With a cactus.

We are campaigning to raise £30,000 to help us as we become a full-fledged and self-sustaining business.  Any amount would help us greatly to reach our goal and get the website, campaign, and everything else we can give out there.

Why we need the big amount of money with a lot of zeros behind it.

So our old website was about as useful as a cordless tampon.

It got too full of hits and people on it and other people asking questions and basically exploded all over the show leaving with us with an empty shell of nothingness. Might be a tad dramatic but basically it’s what happened.

Like all of us here, our web developer had been learning the ropes as she went along, and she also works full time and has one of 'child' things too that needs looking after. I want to take her on full time to run the website and maintain everything cool that happens there. Our theme for the last one was a free floral one from wordpress and once we hit around 30,000 hits a day it stopped working. We want to include so much more with forums, webchats ,vlogs, advice columns, reader’s stories, health talks,  artwork that makes it look fancy and of course the cat videos to keep you entertained.

The website needs –

Designing
- Building
- Maintenance
- Phone support 
- Advertising and sponsorship agents so we can be self-sufficient

Campaign stuff

For people to pay attention, we need to make it happen. We want to create a team that can take our work out of my little purple living room where we always disturb the cat and out in to the world. We want to eventually go around the youth groups, schools and very importantly LGBT groups and talk to them about getting checked and just how preventable cancer can be. We don’t want to be another boring talk either, we want to make women laugh and we want to tell them everything they need to know.

- Flyers and brochures designed, printed out and spread around the place
- Money to travel on the trains to get to places to talk
- Advertising in magazines, on websites and on posters to raise as much awareness as possible and to help us with our campaign to take it to the government.

Until we broke everything down we didn't realize how much this would cost us. The campaign and the support of women is most important to me and we really need the money to do this. Any funds left over from the fundraising goal will go towards supporting the rest of the business and paying the team what they deserve. If we get a tridilillion pounds we’l go on a unicorn hunt too.

Even if you can’t give us moneies please help us by spreading the word, sharing on here, shouting it out from some sort of rooftop or writing a very clever tweet on face-tigram-trest. We've just got the hang of the whole social media thing so we're up and running now.

 Put #SpreadYourlegs in your tweets and lets get it trending so people actually pay attention.  

Without any of the jokes, this campaign could not be more important to me. Struggling with cancer these past five years has been the hardest part of my life. And yes, this probably sounds like an Xfactor sob story so I can win more votes because my rendition of Purple Rain didn’t quite move people enough but I would really love your help with this. The unicorns will thank you. Love.

story:
Short Summary

THANKS TO ALL WHO CONTRIBUTED DURING MY LAST CAMPAIGN!!
PLEASE READ THE UPDATE


 

UPDATE: A date for the surgery has been set for June 17, 2014!!! I have made a few adjustments to better accommodate my budget. We are driving instead of flying as it will better accommodate my family during the trip. Please review the financial breakdown for adjustments from the last campaign.


 

Thanks for visiting my campaign! I am a mother of two, a
wife to one, and teacher to many. I have a genetic disorder called
Neurofibromatosis type 1(NF 1) (http://www.nfnetwork.org/understanding-nf/what-is-nf/nf-1) which causes tumors to grow on the nerve endings. I was born with this
condition and have endured many obstacles in my lifetime. The tumors on my left
eye developed when I was 3 years old. After numerous surgeries and the
reoccurrence of the tumors my eye was left permanently close at the age of 15
impacting my self-esteem and vision. Finding employment has been difficult.
Once I went on a job assignment through an employment agency. After two hours
of work, the supervisor of the company wanted to meet me after hearing what a
great job I was doing. After inquiring about my eye he asked me to leave
stating "Our Company has a certain standard and look that you do not
have." Finding appropriate childcare for my children has also been a challenge. I have taken my children to interview at daycare upon meeting us the director asked "What is wrong with your eye and why do you have all those bumps (tumors) on you and is it contagious" I attempted to explain to her it was a genetic disorder. After a brief discussion she told me she was uncomfortable watching my children and we left. During my pregnancy with my son the condition worsen causing massive tumors to grow rapidly on my face and eye. I have been wearing an eye patch since 2011, due to the massive size of the tumor on my left eye. I am in desperate need of a surgery for removal of the abnormality. The expert Doctor performing the surgery reside and practice  in Chicago, my family and I will travel to Chicago for surgery and recovery.


The Best Things in Life are Not Things:)

The recovery time in hospital is going to depend on how my
body responds to the  procedure. I estimate the surgery and recovery process will take two weeks; this time frame will include the one week stay in the hospital at St. Joseph’s Hospital, one week recovery outside the hospital as well as the follow
up visit with the doctor one week after the procedure. Your contributions will
encompass the cost of the following needs:

7,000.00 Medical Expenses not covered by Insurance.

1600.00 Lodging Before, during, and after surgery for two weeks

1122.00 Transportation (Rental Mini-Van) While in Chicago

500.00 Fuel for Rental Van

The impact of your kind contributions will be stronger and
greater than any THING we can offer you in return for your kindness. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We appreciate everyone visiting the campaign. Monetary contributions are not the only way you can help; you may offer prayers, encouragement, as well as any of your medical experiences.

story:
This is HealthID

 

HealthID is changing the way medical information is managed and communicated. Currently consumers that take prescription medications, have a chronic illness (i.e. diabetes) or general medical conditions have no simple mobile solution with management capabilities, medication reminders, ability to share information with doctors or others and then have that critical up-to-date information available for a first responder in a medical emergency; and we use NFC technology as a simple and cost effective solution for immediate management and communication. NO SPECIAL APP needed to view the medical emergency summary, just a tap from a NFC smartphone. Users of our products can download our app to quickly access their HealthID Profile and manage any/all aspects of their medical situation (ex. Change/update medication(s), enter a glucose level or insulin dosage or change a phone number to an emergency contact)...ALL UPDATES OR CHANGES WILL BE IMMEDIATELY VIEWABLE FROM THE HEALTHID BAND OR CARD! 

 

HIP Products

 

About Our Charities

Black Band - Wounded Warrior Project

Blue Band - JDRF

Pink Band - AVON & Gloria Gemma

Red Band - American Heart Association

HIP Card - American Cancer Society

 

Emergency Communication

A first responder can immediately view your up-to-date medical information in a medical emergency with a simple “tap” from an NFC Smartphone. Your information can be communicated in seconds...and every second counts can help save lives!


Medication Adherence

Quickly add your prescription medication(s) to your HealthID profile. Then set-up reminders by text, email or mobile app to take them! This will help assure that you take your medication as prescribed.


Medical Condition & Chronic Disease Management

Any medical condition can be managed from our Mobile App; or access your profile from any pc or laptop. Update basic profile information, any medical condition, medications, emergency contacts that can be quickly dialed from the emergency summary screen, to managing chronic illness such as diabetes with glucose entry and trend charting. MRI’s, EKG’s, X-Rays and lab results can also be uploaded and stored in your profile. All information is stored securely on our cloud based platform and allows for easy access to your account to manage or share any aspect of your personal healthcare.

 

Ability to Share

A simple way to share your information with your doctors, family or support community, all while on the go with our mobile application. 

 

No NFC? No Problem

Your critical information can still be accessed in seconds without an NFC smartphone. Simply enter the wearers unique HIP Code (located on each of our products) at healthid.com from ANY INTERNET CONNECTED DEVICE whether a PC, laptop, tablet or smartphone.

 

 

  

How it works

 

HealthID’s technology activates with a simple tap from an NFC smartphone. Your information is stored securely in our cloud-based servers. None of your information is stored on our products locally, so when an NFC smartphone taps your band or card it gives the instruction to retrieve your specific information from the cloud and display it on the smartphone’s screen so it can be quickly viewed.


 

Manage Multiple HIP Products

We have designed HealthID so that you can add and remove multiple products to your profile...all from the mobile app or web based application. If you lose one, you can simply remove that product (HIP Code) from your profile for security. So add all the HealthID Band colors and the HealthID Card to your profile, then have ability to add any future HealthID products...because we are always thinking of new things!

 

Product Specifications

 

HealthID Bands

  • Adjustable – Fits wrists from 6 – 8.5 inches
  • Waterproof
  • Durable
  • No battery or charging necessary

HealthID Cards

  • Conveniently fits in your wallet or purse
  • Waterproof
  • No battery or charging necessary

 

Current List of Available NFC Smartphones

http://www.nfcworld.com/nfc-phones-list/

 

 

 

HealthID in the media

story:
Hair Couture & Co. is doing a Hair giveaway!! We will be giving away 3 bundles of our virgin hair to one lucky winner. However in order to enter in the contest we are asking all contestants to donate the minimum of one dollar to our cancer foundation "Missy's". Proceeds will go to the beautiful sweet baby girl Teyana posted in the picture above. Money will be used for her medical expenses. Teyanna suffers from mass in her stomach that has spread to her lungs. She has to do 6 to 8 weeks of chemo. If chemo reduces the tumor, doctors can then go in and remove it.

Each dollar donated will give you one entry into the contest. For example if you donate $20, you will be entered into the drawing 20 times. 

Hair couture will reveal the winner 2 weeks from today which is Wednesday October 1. EVERYONE is welcome to donate, even if you would not like to be entered into the contest. If you are entering into the contest please make sure you include your name and instagram or facebook name as well on your donation post. 

Entry Requirements: 

Once you donate you will then need to post a picture on your page of your donation(instagram or facebook). Your caption under the picture should state "Here is my donation to Teyana! I am now entered into the drawing to win 3 bundles of virgin hair from www.haircouture-co.com." Please then tag 3 other ladies you know on this post that also wears hair extensions!

Our goal is to raise 2000.00 in two weeks! I know that we can do this :) C'mon everyone....Lets start donating!!

If you are entering into the contest please make sure you include your name and instagram or facebook name as well on your donation post. Entry Requirements: Once you donate you will then need to post a picture on your page of your donation(instagram or facebook). Your caption under the picture should state "Here is my donation to Teyana! I am now entered into the drawing to win 3 bundles of virgin hair from www.haircouture-co.com." Please then tag 3 other ladies you know on this post that also wears hair extensions!Our goal is to raise 2000.00 in two weeks! I know that we can do this :) C'mon everyone....Lets start donating!!

story:
Millions of people move abroad every year in search of work to support their families. Each year, they send billions of dollars across borders back to loved ones in their home countries.

Salud2 enables those sending money for health expenses to be confident that their family is financially supported and cared for.

MEET OUR TEAM (photo: left to right)

Maria Kovell Health Innovations
Maria has promoted public health since 2006 with organizations such as Save the Children, Partners in Health, the American Health Information Management Association, and as a Peace Corps volunteer in Moldova.

Amitay Flores Latin American Migration Policy
Amitay has studied and worked in five countries, and has an MA in International Policy, specializing in US-Mexico migration.

Amanda Boyek Research and Partnerships
Amanda has an MA in International Policy and has worked with several humanitarian agencies, including Mercy Corps and the American Red Cross.

Natalie Cox Project Management
Natalie has worked with a business incubator and investment fund in India, and has five years of experience in education, philanthropy, and government innovations. 

Amy Ross Communications and Innovation
Amy first saw the impact of remittances as a Peace Corps volunteer in Paraguay, and has since worked in social enterprise and education.

Collectively, we have 20 years of experience working in economic development and social change in 15 countries.


THE OPPORTUNITY

  • Nearly 250 million people live and work outside of their home countries, sending $529 billion a year across borders to care for their families and friends at home.

  • Though money sent home is often intended (by family members on both ends) to be used for health, prioritizing health spending is a challenge for all of us. We're making it easier for patients and their families to access and pay for health services

WHERE SALUD2 FITS IN

  • We’re streamlining health-bound money transfers for senders to better connect them with their loved ones’ health, and support (and celebrate!) improved health outcomes.

  • Salud2 ensures more money gets spent on its intended use, and less is lost to high transfer fees.
  • Salud2 delivers peace of mind for families who send money for health by ensuring money is spent efficiently and transparently on improving health outcomes.

OUR NEXT STEPS

We have heard from many corporate and academic supporters that this model will work. We have the unique cultural competencies to ensure that it does, and we’re ready to move forward with a pilot program.

Our two-step plan includes:

    1. Field market research in Mexico City. We are using design guidance from our partners at IDEO to help us profoundly understand our customers' needs in terms of a) remittance services and b) quality health provision. We’ll meet local health providers, form initial partnerships under the Salud2 umbrella, and develop a prototype for an interactive website connecting families with their loved ones’ health. We also know that some of the most urgent need is not from the internet-savvy. We’re developing paper-based communication tools for an inclusive system.

    2. Then, we’re going to Boston to participate in the Hult Prize business accelerator. We finished in the Top 4 at the Hult Prize Regional Finals in SF this March, co-launched with the Clinton Global Initiative.  We are invited to attend business model design workshops July through mid-August. We can’t wait to refine our model and learn from our peer teams.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We’re raising $7,500 to fuel Steps 1 and 2, and pilot our health-bound money transfer instrument and platform.

Funds raised at this stage will be spent on:

  • Market research in Mexico City, and Monterey County in CA

  • Initial design and prototype of a money transfer model and web platform


WHAT YOU’LL GET

We are so grateful for your support.

And to prove it, we’ve put our heads (and social networks) together and designed a list of wellness-oriented perks like you’ve never seen!

IMPACT

Your contribution will help connect families separated by oceans and national boundaries to improve their own health and the health of their loved ones. Most people in today’s world have at least one family member living in another country. By giving to Salud2, you will be a part of creating a tool allowing families to transcend borders and better care for each other.

story:
This is our brother, Marvin, and he's been battling colon cancer that was diagnosed back in July 2011, and has since spread.  My sister and her husband, my awesome Brother-in-Law, took Marvin in to care for him from day one, and to make Marvin a part of their loving home.  If you knew Marvin and what a wonderful person he is you'd understand why someone would so readily welcome him in to their home. He's a humble guy, incredibly smart, funny, and would give anyone in need the shirt off his back. He's a lot like how our Mom and Dad were when they were alive. Always giving, never taking.  But Marvin was suddenly in a position needing help, and since then, despite he's had several close-calls with the cancer, he's managed to bounce back. The Energizer Bunny doesn't have nuthin on good ole Marvin! But  it's not been easy, especially on my Sister who is closer to the emotional ups and downs this cancer brings. She's right there with him when Marvin's cancer turns for the worst, and I get choked up with tears just thinking of each time she phoned or messaged with grim news. But my brother keeps bouncing back each time. A lot of it is due to the amazing doctors and nurses who are tough yet caring with Marvin, and a whole whole lot is due to the love and care of friends and family who have stepped up to be there (especially my Sister and Brother-in-Law!).  Cousins helping my Sister take Marvin to his treatments, Friends and Coworkers doing the same so my Sister and her Husband could work their demanding full time jobs whilst my Sister also completed her college courses. And then also is our amazing Aunt who invites Marvin to come live with her at times so she could enjoy his company.

There have been a lot of hospital emergencies, chemotherapies, urgent surgeries, and loads of prescriptions as well as medical supplies.

Marvin has absolutely no medical insurance to cover any of the costs. He had COBRA for awhile after having to leave his much-loved job due to his condition, and we're told Medicare will kick in starting January 2015 (in 2 years!).  Marvin is an Army Veteran, but, unfortunately, he was enlisted during the years Veterans were not given benefits. My Sister and her Husband have been footing the bill these years, paying out of pocket this entire time and not asking for any help other than trying to get Marvin the benefits he should have, but battling paperwork and red tape to get.  But now it's gotten really rough with more prescriptions needed after a recent urgent surgery to remove some of the cancer, that, thankfully, Marvin has bounced back yet again from. 
Today my Sister sent an SOS and our family huddled together to all chip in what little we can to cover the immediate prescriptions and bills for this month. Now we're trying to sort out how to pay for Marvin's next procedure coming up in a weeks time!  As well his monthly oncology visit is in a months time, but the finance office put a block on Marvin at the check in desk saying the visit has to be paid in cash for him to be seen.

I put this donation page together hoping to reach everyone who knew and knows Marvin, because if you met him once, he's such a nice guy you don't forget him.  I was blessed to have recently stayed a week with him after living out of the country for the past 6 years, and it was one of the best weeks I'll always remember, as will my kids. They managed to pick up their Uncle Marvin's dry sense of humor so I'm reminded often of him when my children crack the same jokes :)  

If you know Marvin or happen to read this and can feel for his situation, please know that his entire Family thank you already with the biggest hugs.  Comeraderie and Compassion mean more than anything in any dire situation, especially Marvin's. If you would like to donate to help with the medical bills, please know it's greatly needed and so much appreciated.  Hopefully when Medicare kicks in it will ease this burden.

Take a look at what you get for your donation as well. We don't have money but we can give in return with creativity and talent you can appreciate.  The perks offered cannot be purchased anywhere. They are only offered as part of this campaign to help Marvin.

Thank you for caring.

story:
Welcome to "The Amplio Vita Project"

The words amplio vita are simply latin for "improve life". The surest way to improve life is to improve your health and fitness. This Project is designed to offer an alternative for anyone who doesn't want to experience the scrutinizing and intimidating nature of a "gym" environment. All you need is a mat, a stability ball and a set of dumbells. Our alternative approach is an online interactive fitness/health website providing 3 original/new  (professionally designed & expertly instructed)  1 hour videos  (split into 2 segments: 1-the workout 2-video meal prep/health info)  per week for a monthly membership fee of just $11.99. No contracts, no obligations or hidden fees.

I'm Michael Burke the founder of "The Amplio Vita Project". I've been a professional personal trainer for over 25 years and I believe anyone can see that there is a large part of our population who find it difficult, if not near impossible, to actually set foot inside any public fitness facility. There are  plenty of reasons, I believe these are the primary ones.

  1.) cost  2.) "gym" environment  (mentioned above)   3.) many are very sensitive and self-conscious of their physical appearance  4.) they have already had a less than positive experience.

This Projects focus is to reach out to this special group of people. I want to remove all the obstacles  (convenience-cost-sensitivity)  that may prevent anyone from starting to improve their life. I want to share all my experience and knowledge with all who may desire to improve.

The interactive fitness/health website I've designed  will offer 3 original new 1 hour videos per week  (12-14 per month)  that have 2 segments, the workout and a video meal prep/ health info.

1.) The Workout :  30-35 minutes in length. I've taken all the most effective exercises from all the classes and individuals I've trained and made a safe, comprehensive and challenging (yet on the surface appear simple and doable) routine I call "unified flow". Transitioning through all 6 modalities of a healthy fitness routine  (strength/cardio-respiratory improvement/core strength/balance/flexibility/coordination)  during the workout, in a seamless manner and with heavy emphasis on breathing and form.

2.) The video meal prep/health info:  25-30 minutes in length. We're doing something different. We are taking people step by step in video form, from cutting board to oven, and showing them how to make meals that are healthy, simple, delicious and easy/ quick. Describing the beneficial facts of good nutrition and including info that's fundamental, practical and relevant to attaining better health. As an example the incredible benefits of coconut and sesame oils.

Everyone should have an equal opportunity to improve their health and fitness no matter what station your at in life. It shouldn't depend upon your income or confidence level. Personal training has become vastly overpriced. In a mercenary type of way, "I'll share my expertise" = "if you pay me the fee", the industry has neglected and priced themselves above the largest part of the populations ability to pay. The very people who could benefit the most aren't able to access this source of direction.  

We can help change this situation.


But we can't even begin to start this "project" without your help and support.

Our initial costs of operation and start up are detailed here.

1.) Website:       $8,000  construction, development, hosting, video storage, video media player, sponsoring and all the other details that go into running a website.

2.) Equipment:  $6,800  digital camcorders, lighting, sound, studio, dedicated computer, software.

3.) Consultants: $2,800  legal,financial, video and IT

4.) Marketing:     $4,000  the most important aspect, we must let people know we're there. Of course we are going to use social media to its fullest extent, but we may need to initially invest in some paid advertising until the momentum of the project gets started.

*** Any experts or mavens of the above expenses who could reduce our costs, please feel free to contact us on our facebook page.

We have offered at our various levels of contributions, our perks which can all be gifted or transferred to whomever you like. We have also offered a free ad for your business/company on our website and facebook page with a larger donation. We've tried to give above the actual value of the donation in the perk because we want to always give more than what people expect.


Lets get started and lets make a difference

With your help we can make a huge difference in a tremendous amount of lives. The most gratifying feeling I've ever experienced, is the moment someone tells you that YOU have made a difference in their life. I want this to be a throwback to my fathers generation, when artisans and workers gave you MORE than what you had bargained and paid for. What a mind bending thing that would be for todays consumers.

Thank you so much for checking out our "Project". Even if you cannot make a donation, you can still help us. By giving us a like and spreading the word and telling your friends not only of this campaign but of the website in the very near future, tweeting and facebook will all help us make a difference.

story:
From a very young age Chloe demonstrated that she had a natural skating ability coupled with a passion for skating. Her devotion to figure skating,work ethic and determination to succeed, have enabled her to reach her goals this season. During the 2011-2012 skating season she competed at the Pre-Preliminary and Preliminary level. In 2012-2013, Chloe moved into the competitive ranks and competed at the Pre-Juvenile then Juvenile level. Chloe earned a silver medal at the 2014 Skate Canada Eastern Ontario Sectionals and has earned a spot to compete at the provincial level at this years Ontario Winter Games February 28th - March 2nd 2014.

She was also recently selected for the Skate Ontario Hot Shot team. This talent identification team was selected through a competitive process. Athletes named to the team are provided development training sessions and are monitored by Skate Ontario. Over 100 skaters from across the Province of Ontario attended a selection seminar with 33 being named to the provincial team.

Figure Skating is as very expensive support and we are fundraising to help with ice and coaching fees. Chloe currently trains 10 hours a week. When she is not on the ice she enjoys ballet and modern dance and hanging out with her friends.

The lobbyist firm needs $50,000

For a commited two year campaign to succeed in winning mandated coverage in Connecticut for acupuncture. Other states will follow our lead. We want patient support to fund the lobby campaign. Help!! Insurance companies will save money if they cover acupuncture. ( prevents more expensive procedures)

story:
Our Story

My name is Heather Scott and I’m the founder of Purple Plant Smoothies. I started this company in San Francisco in the spring of 2011 as a way to help educate people on the benefits of eating fresh, local whole foods. I recently started to see a trend where way too many people aren’t eating their greens and fresh fruits regularly. This is usually what leads to snacking on not so healthy foods and sweets during the day and late into the night.

That said, I decided to create an affordable, tasty and convenient way to help people eat healthier.  In doing so, I made a commitment to Purple Plant Smoothie drinkers that our smoothies are 100% pesticide free and are made with nothing more than 100% pure fruits, veggies and roots.

As a former Division I Cross Country and Track runner, I've had a strong passion for good health throughout my life. I became an NASM CPT in 2010, in order to start helping people on their paths to becoming healthier through exercise. However, I quickly realized that exercise alone doesn’t make someone healthier overall. Proper nutrition is a necessary component. 

I had THOUGHT I was really healthy, since I would run a lot and work out every day. I was also eating pretty healthy...or so I thought... Interestingly, even as health conscious as I was, I still wasn’t eating greens (spinach, kale, chard), whole fruits (berries, oranges, bananas and apples) and roots (ginger and beets) regularly.

Eating greens regularly has really improved my quality of life. Drinking these smoothies every morning has made me more alive and full of energy, I feel stronger during my runs, my skin clears, I am not as sick as I used to be and I  maintain a healthy weight with moderate exercise.

I'm so excited to be able to make Purple Plant Smoothies for others as a way for them to also get the proper nutrition they need to be healthier, too!


The Impact

This campaign is very important to us, as we'd really love to grow and be able to reach even more people than we are currently. In the winter months it's tough to be out on the cart without any protective covering. We also need to be able to hire some more people to help, so we can increase the amount of farmer's markets we're in.


What We Need & What You Get

      $100 - hot water holder for our new hot smoothie drinks

      $250 - 1st month's storage rental fee for our cart items (signs, umbrellas, tarps, etc)

      $300 - 2 month supply of cold biodegradable cups

      $350 - 1 month's rent at the commissary kitchen (this is where we prepare of produce)

      $500 - larger signage so people can tell who we are what we're offering 

      $500 - marketing (running an online campaign)

   $1,500 - 1st month's salary for 2 more hires 

   $1,500 - protective covering for our cart  


Other Ways You Can Help

It will be helpful to have your support in any way possible! We'd really appreciate it if you could help share our campaign with your friends on Facebook or Twitter pages, as this is a great way to spread the word. :)

I recently started to see a trend where way too many people aren’t eating their greens and fresh fruits regularly. This is usually what leads to snacking on not so healthy foods and sweets during the day and late into the night.
That said, I decided to create an affordable, tasty and convenient way to help people eat healthier.  In doing so, I made a commitment to Purple Plant Smoothie drinkers that our smoothies are 100% pesticide free and are made with nothing more than 100% pure fruits, veggies and roots.
As a former Division I Cross Country and Track runner, I've had a strong passion for good health throughout my life. I became an NASM CPT in 2010, in order to start helping people on their paths to becoming healthier through exercise. However, I quickly realized that exercise alone doesn’t make someone healthier overall. Proper nutrition is a necessary component. 

I had THOUGHT I was really healthy, since I would run a lot and work out every day. I was also eating pretty healthy...or so I thought... Interestingly, even as health conscious as I was, I still wasn’t eating greens (spinach, kale, chard), whole fruits (berries, oranges, bananas and apples) and roots (ginger and beets) regularly.
Eating greens regularly has really improved my quality of life. Drinking these smoothies every morning has made me more alive and full of energy, I feel stronger during my runs, my skin clears, I am not as sick as I used to be and I  maintain a healthy weight with moderate exercise.
I'm so excited to be able to make Purple Plant Smoothies for others as a way for them to also get the proper nutrition they need to be healthier, too!


The Impact

This campaign is very important to us, as we'd really love to grow and be able to reach even more people than we are currently. In the winter months it's tough to be out on the cart without any protective covering. We also need to be able to hire some more people to help, so we can increase the amount of farmer's markets we're in.


What We Need & What You Get
      $100 - hot water holder for our new hot smoothie drinks
      $250 - 1st month's storage rental fee for our cart items (signs, umbrellas, tarps, etc)
      $300 - 2 month supply of cold biodegradable cups
      $350 - 1 month's rent at the commissary kitchen (this is where we prepare of produce)

      $500 - larger signage so people can tell who we are what we're offering 
      $500 - marketing (running an online campaign)

   $1,500 - 1st month's salary for 2 more hires 
   $1,500 - protective covering for our cart  


Other Ways You Can Help
It will be helpful to have your support in any way possible! We'd really appreciate it if you could help share our campaign with your friends on Facebook or Twitter pages, as this is a great way to spread the word. :)

story:
A sample of videos that showcase our work:
See what we're up to: www.thinkersmith.org/facility

Short and Sweet

Thinkersmith believes that computer science should be taught early and with responsibility!  We are fighting to get *appropriate* computer science education into every community...knowing that sometimes that requires teaching the foundations without using *any* technology.

We specialize in "unplugged" lessons, like teaching programming using plastic cups, or teaching functions and variables by making keychains. Help us fund a home base where we can safely and responsibly introduce computer science to thousands of children (and their parents) every year!


What Are You Doing?

We want to open a facility where we can host regular and reliable programs during business hours, after school, on weekends, and over the summer.  Malcolm Gladwell says that it takes nearly 10,000 hours to become truly good at anything.  What is it going to take to get your child that kind of practice before the self-doubt of adolescence hits?  Thinkersmith can help!

The Perks

At the $5 level, you can vote for where we end up next!
$10 gets you a "You should learn binary" bumper sticker, or one of our most purchased lessons.

Click here to see a large image of our current perks

 


The Plan

Our ultimate goal at Thinkersmith is to support a series of facilities all across the nation, where anyone can go to learn about (and play with) technology.  

Click here to read about stretch goals.

*Our initial goal of $100,000 will support leasing a space where we can immediately begin:

  • providing professional developments for teachers of grades K-12
  • hosting weekend, summer, after school, and after work classes for all ages
  • proving that communities find benefit in physical computer science locations
  • arranging groups especially for research, allowing us to use surveys, pictures, video and assessments to gain useful data

If, for some reason, the initial $100,000 is not reached, all money donated will go toward the creation of additional curriculum and videos to allow volunteers to teach computer science in a fun and engaging way within their own communities.


What Does it Mean??

Our campaign will not only help Thinkersmith reach nearly 3,000 local students a year, it will provide effective curriculum to continue our global reach of nearly 1.5 million student activities annually. 

Beyond reaching out to students directly, our facility will:

  • Ignite valuable research on how computational thinking can improve grades for  students all over the world in many other subjects
  • Provide a scalable model for all communities around the nation
  • Reach out to adults who may have already dismissed their technical abilities
  • Create videos to ignite and inspire community outreach through their own clubs, camps, workshops, and classes
We have been privileged to work alongside Code.org over the last year and a half, creating the Code.org unplugged lessons for Code Studio and helping to assess activities for the Hour of Code over CSEd Week.  We plan to continue to form powerful and meaningful bonds like those and grow the resources for computer science education everywhere!


If You Love Us, But Can't Afford Us

Money can be tight.  If you want to consider yourself a glowing supporter, please post this campaign on all of your social media outlets.  If you can get twenty other people to donate in your stead, you will get a personal "Thank You" gift from our founder, Kiki Prottsman. 

  • Click here to find out how to help us spread the word!
Together, we can support CS throughout the nation for people of ALL ages!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chainey. About a year and a half ago my gums got infected, and due to lack of healthcare and rising costs it went untreated and turned into gum disease, which exponentially brakes down my teeth causing them to break and fall off, along with very powerful pain. I haven't been able to chew in about six months, limited to very soft or liquid food. The procedure to cut out the remaining roots and extract the remaining teeth along with replacing them with new teeth costs roughly $7,000. But, since I'm a 21 year old female with hardly any teeth, it's very hard to find work. 

What I Need & What You Get

$7,000

 

The goal I've set covers the cost of everything I need for these dental precedures.

I can't really offer any reward for contributing, other than to promise that once the sergeries are over and I am back on my feet, I will donate every extra penny I have back to Indiegog fundraisers like this one to other people who need medical precedures until I have at least matched every dime that was given to me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not having money doesn't mean you can't help. Share the story, tweet the link, tell your friends. Word of mouth and social media are very powerful tools.
