story:
Managing our stress, and our anxiety, from the ground up! Holistically! Here's how...

This handbook, "Blueprints for Balanced Peace," pursues answers to the following questions: Is a juggled life, full of multi-tasking, truly a balanced life? What is "inner peace," really? Can I find relief from my stress, regardless of the cause, through holistic healing and lifestyle changes? What can I do to reduce my stress in parenting?

"Holistically," in this sense, means taking into account all aspects of the human condition: Body, Mind, Spirit, and Heart (Emotion). If we "live in our heads" most of the time, it follows that our body, our spirit, and our emotions could become negatively affected, and we can't access parts of ourselves that could help us bounce back from stressors. I have been a holistic healing practitioner and meditation coach since the early 1990's. I've organized several international workshops and a conference on children's health--led by myself and other presenters. You can read more about these as you scroll down. 

 The goal of this campaign is to secure the funds necessary to self-publish the handbook's first printing, to gain a wider audience to share what I have learned in the past twenty years, with a wider audience. I thought that crowdfunding, accumulating small donations of $5 to $10, would be a great way to accomplish this. 

If this is the first time you have landed on this campaign, please check the updates! There are testimonials if you click on "See More".I have a video clip there which has some great information of interest to parents with kids on the autism spectrum.

The book is all about offering strategies many people may not yet know about, to navigate our lives with more ease and grace.  It is all the more important for parents. Parents can feel at times like they have the  toughest job in the world ( “a handful and a heartful,” as the saying goes.) The 21st century has its own set of challenges, not the least of which is the extent to which electronics have taken over our lives, and that daily life does not have the rhythm it once had with everything being “on,” 24/7. For instance, does anyone know the long-term side effects, when a parent or a nanny gives a toddler in a stroller an I-pad to play with, for short-term amusement, rather than engaging with the child one-on-one?

The harmful side effects of the electromagnetic radiation from screens for children's developing brains  is now well-documented. But are today's kids missing out on something we used to take for granted?

If any funds are left over after the $1600 goal is reached (or equivalent in euros, Swiss francs, etc) they will be used for additional promotion, through the publisher or for expenses related to providing the perks to my Indiegogo contributors.

If the goal is not reached within the 40 days, the amount we do raise will go toward a payment plan with the publisher, Balboa Press.

If you would share on your own social networks, that would be  great. Thank you so much in advance!  And--please "like" my Facebook page of the same name, and help me reach 100 "likes" or more!
I decided that this book had to be written, because I wasn’t able to find a handbook that  addressed these subjects in an easy- to -use format, to refer to while on the go. Many of my holistic practice clients were looking for answers. Other holistic practitioners may already know a lot of these strategies, but my feeling is that even they will find out something new here!
I don’t enjoy prolonged time on the computer wading through articles. I figured there were hundreds of people who probably felt the same way. I’ve done the legwork here, so you don’t have to! It is gleaned  largely from my own personal experience, trainings, and professional holistic practice of twenty-one years and counting.
There has been an explosion in the wellness industry, but not all internet information is reliable. I was also talking to people, even to 20-somethings, who did not even know that there were alternatives to antidepressants, which are particularly in widespread use in America. Similarly, there are people worldwide who do not understand why so many American school personnel choose to drug their students (in the millions) who exhibit behavior challenges without getting to the root cause!
I have treated clients from the age of 17 months to 86 years. I have also been an art teacher, in several venues, and privately, working with children and teens of all ages. I have learned a lot about child development as a result. As a support person in the special needs departments of  public schools-- for children with behavior and attention challenges (many of whom were refugees), I saw first hand what was lacking in some cases, and what was working in others. Children suffer from stress-related circumstances, just as adults do. I had the great opportunity to work in  two pioneering magnet schools in Burlington, Vermont: The Sustainability Academy at Lawrence Barnes, and the Integrated Arts Academy (the IAA, formerly Wheeler Elementary).
The first content contained in the  book was originally written with a focus on finding natural, non-pharmaceutical solutions for challenges faced by parents of children and teens who were labeled with ADD/ADHD and autism. Later, new sections were added to assist anybody, of any age, to manage their stress, through body/mind/spirit/heart-centered strategies and therapies of all kinds,for parents and non-parents alike.
I’ve written several articles for each of these American publications:"South Burlington Life," "EverChanging" (both in the State of Vermont) and "Sedona Journal of Emergence" from Arizona. The latter is a well-respected monthly magazine containing articles on human potential and spiritual growth.
In 1995, I founded the Waterfront Holistic Healing Center in Burlington, Vermont with a colleague.I went on to manage it for seven years, and I worked with a total of 17 other practitioners. I had the idea to start a local television talk show, with interviews with professional, established practitioners, both from inside and outside the Center,  to get the word out to more people. It started out as “Earth Healing Outreach” on Adelphia Cable 15 in the late 1990’s. It  later evolved into “Holistically Speaking TV” in March 2012 at VCAM (Vermont Community Access Media) . I originally produced it, and Lisa Bridge interviewed. Now, both functions have been taken over by Morella Devost, and she has done a stellar job. We have produced more than 100 episodes, and several of them are viewable on our YouTube channel, “holisticallyspeakingtv.”I have links throughout the book to some of these.
Balboa Press (www.balboapress.com) is  the self-publishing arm of Hay House (www.hayhouse.com), one of the biggest publishers in the world of holistic, self-help books. Maybe some of you have read Louise Hay’s book, “You Can Heal Your Life,” or attended one of the webinars by the many well-known figures in the world of alternative medicine and wellness. Balboa, with the publishing package, will do the editing, layout, promotion, and on-demand printing for me. The book will be available through Amazon and www.barnesandnoble.com, most probably in January 2016. It takes four months from my submission of the manuscript.
Again, thanks in advance for any  contribution, no matter how small, and I hope together that we can create a great community in the process!

story:
Who am I?

My name is Megan. I'm a 22 year old part time college student and full time employee at high stress job that pays minim wage. (For Michigan that is $7.45 an hour) I have working for this company for five years while attending school. (I have not been without a job since I graduated High School)

I live with my Mother, Father and little Brother. My Mother is a waitress who works 6 days on average. My Father is unemployed. Neither my Mother or I am offered insurance with our occupation and I have been denied by Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan because of the fact that I'm living with my parents. 

As a hobby I actively participate in the Cosplay Community: A Community which prides itself on using creativity to recreate many fictional characters ranging from Batman and Robin to Mario and Luigi and everywhere in between. 




Why am I starting this Campaign?


On August 12th I woke feeling strange. Whenever I tried to sit up it felt like my head was made of lead and that the world was spinning, it took several attempts before I was able to get out of bed. I assumed I was just overly tired from staying up late and told myself to stop being dramatic and go to work. I drank a glass of milk to settle my queezey stomach and walked to work. Upon reaching work I spoke to my manager about finding someone else to work for me and that if we could reach someone I would head home when they arrived. She agreed and I turned to go clock in and immediately found myself on the ground with a coworker standing above me. He drove me home and that day I went to the emergency clinic where they tested my blood sugar levels. 

I was sitting at a 56. 

Now I had no idea what that meant and I'm assuming most people are like me and know little to nothing about what is normal for a human when it comes to blood sugar. The doctor informed me I should be anywhere from 80 to 110. Needless to say, I was very low. After bringing my blood sugar back up I still wasn't feeling well. I couldn't stand without help and couldn't move my head around without getting dizzy. I was diagnosed with a sinus infection and was told I was a hypoglycemic and possibly anemic. 

He wanted follow up his assumption with blood work...but given the clinic visit itself was $75 and that I had lost at least one days wage I could not afford the $200 it would be for blood work. He understood, gave my a prescription to fight off my infection ($85 worth of medication) and sent me on my way. He did not give me any information to fight off the hypoglycemia he had unofficially diagnosed me with. 

I ended up bed ridden and could not return to work for a week.

Flashforward to now. (TL;DR)

I've been living my life under the assumption that I am, indeed a hypoglycemic. All of the reading I've done (from various sources on the internet and E-Books) I seem to have all of the correct symtopms. I've been adjusting my diet accordingly....but the problem is:

I'm not getting better.


I seem to slowly be getting worse. I've had to loose several shifts at work because I simply cannot walk in a straight line let alone preform the job I'm being payed for. 

I am now begining to susspect that I cannot carry on the way I am. I obviously have no idea what is wrong with me or, if I am a hypoglycemic, I am completely unequip with the knowledge of how to live my life as one. 


Why wait until now?



The simple answer is what is always is: MONEY.


My Father was supposed to be receiving insurance in a few months and I was going to push through and just wait it out until then. But now my Father has returned to being unemployed and I have no hope for health insurance in sight, nor do I feel as though I can ask my parents for help given that my mother struggles to feed four people on her wage. 

I had also just payed for my school tuition without any help from grants or finical aid. I'm now left sitting here wondering if I should take another year off of school and drop out of my classes so I could use the refunded money for medical bills. 

What is Hypoglycemia and how does it effect a person's life?

According to Wikipedia:
"Hypoglycemia (...) is a medical emergency that involves an abnormally diminished content of glucose in the blood. The term literally means "low blood sugar"  It can produce a variety of symptoms and effects but the principal problems arise from an inadequate supply of glucose to the brain, resulting in impairment of function (neuroglycopenia). Effects can range from mild dysphoria to more serious issues such as seizures, unconsciousness, and (rarely) permanent brain damage or death."
As I understand it:
My body is no longer able to accept the intake of sugars because when I introduce sugar into my body, say 39 grams which is found in a can of Coca-Cola. My body then produces enough insulin to take out 39 grams of sugar and THEN some, which ends up lowing the natural levels of sugar my blood is supposed to have.

This leaves me crashing and my most common symtomps are currently:
  • Dizziness
  • Trouble Speaking
  • Trouble concentrating
  • Irritability
  • Heart palpitations
  • Shakiness
  • Heavy sweating
  • Numbness in my legs and feet
  • Stomach pains
  • Depression,
  • Sudden crying
  • Memory loss
  • Loss of strength

    To try and fight this I eat every two hours to try and keep my blood sugar levels up without introducing too much sugar into my system. How much is too much? Well, without the help of a doctor I have no idea. I am currently just keeping a food journal and trying to see how my body reacts to different foods. All the books I've read on the subject say it's completely variant on the person so I've been trying to cut any sugar ('good' or 'bad', my body doesn't care) almost completely out of my diet. I am also no longer able to consume alcohol or caffeine.

What is this money going towards exactly?


My first focus is going to get blood work done to find out exactly what is wrong with me. No more guessing and self diagnosing. $275 is the estimated cost of a doctors visit and blood work. I have no idea if that is per vial or per test...as I stated before, this doctor was not exactly the most open with information. I have no idea how much this will actually end up running me, but I know the minimum I need is $275.

Any money I receive past that will ONLY be used towards additional doctors visits/testing. I would love to be able to visit a nutritionist to help ease my way into life as a hypoglycemic if that ends up being my only problem. 

Other items this campaign would fund:

  • Blood sugar monitor
  • Hypoglycemic cook books/informational texts.
  • "Special Needs" food.
  • Further Doctor's visits. 

NONE OF THIS MONEY WILL GO TOWARDS MY HOBBY. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand many people are without money just like me, but there are other ways you can help!

  • Spread the word! Like, Tweet, Email! Do whatever you can to spread the word. The more people who see this the more likely I am to receive some help.
  • I currently have a RedBubble account where people can buy designs and part of the proceeds go to me.
  • If you're also a cosplayer or into nerdy things you can keep an eye on my Facebook page where I'll be putting costumes things up for sale!
story_txt:
Who am I?
My name is Megan. I'm a 22 year old part time college student and full time employee at high stress job that pays minim wage. (For Michigan that is $7.45 an hour) I have working for this company for five years while attending school. (I have not been without a job since I graduated High School)I live with my Mother, Father and little Brother. My Mother is a waitress who works 6 days on average. My Father is unemployed. Neither my Mother or I am offered insurance with our occupation and I have been denied by Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan because of the fact that I'm living with my parents. As a hobby I actively participate in the Cosplay Community: A Community which prides itself on using creativity to recreate many fictional characters ranging from Batman and Robin to Mario and Luigi and everywhere in between. 

Why am I starting this Campaign?


On August 12th I woke feeling strange. Whenever I tried to sit up it felt like my head was made of lead and that the world was spinning, it took several attempts before I was able to get out of bed. I assumed I was just overly tired from staying up late and told myself to stop being dramatic and go to work. I drank a glass of milk to settle my queezey stomach and walked to work. Upon reaching work I spoke to my manager about finding someone else to work for me and that if we could reach someone I would head home when they arrived. She agreed and I turned to go clock in and immediately found myself on the ground with a coworker standing above me. He drove me home and that day I went to the emergency clinic where they tested my blood sugar levels. I was sitting at a 56. Now I had no idea what that meant and I'm assuming most people are like me and know little to nothing about what is normal for a human when it comes to blood sugar. The doctor informed me I should be anywhere from 80 to 110. Needless to say, I was very low. After bringing my blood sugar back up I still wasn't feeling well. I couldn't stand without help and couldn't move my head around without getting dizzy. I was diagnosed with a sinus infection and was told I was a hypoglycemic and possibly anemic. He wanted follow up his assumption with blood work...but given the clinic visit itself was $75 and that I had lost at least one days wage I could not afford the $200 it would be for blood work. He understood, gave my a prescription to fight off my infection ($85 worth of medication) and sent me on my way. He did not give me any information to fight off the hypoglycemia he had unofficially diagnosed me with. I ended up bed ridden and could not return to work for a week.Flashforward to now. (TL;DR)I've been living my life under the assumption that I am, indeed a hypoglycemic. All of the reading I've done (from various sources on the internet and E-Books) I seem to have all of the correct symtopms. I've been adjusting my diet accordingly....but the problem is:
I'm not getting better.
I seem to slowly be getting worse. I've had to loose several shifts at work because I simply cannot walk in a straight line let alone preform the job I'm being payed for. I am now begining to susspect that I cannot carry on the way I am. I obviously have no idea what is wrong with me or, if I am a hypoglycemic, I am completely unequip with the knowledge of how to live my life as one. 
Why wait until now?

The simple answer is what is always is: MONEY.


My Father was supposed to be receiving insurance in a few months and I was going to push through and just wait it out until then. But now my Father has returned to being unemployed and I have no hope for health insurance in sight, nor do I feel as though I can ask my parents for help given that my mother struggles to feed four people on her wage. I had also just payed for my school tuition without any help from grants or finical aid. I'm now left sitting here wondering if I should take another year off of school and drop out of my classes so I could use the refunded money for medical bills. What is Hypoglycemia and how does it effect a person's life?
According to Wikipedia: "Hypoglycemia (...) is a medical emergency that involves an abnormally diminished content of glucose in the blood. The term literally means "low blood sugar"  It can produce a variety of symptoms and effects but the principal problems arise from an inadequate supply of glucose to the brain, resulting in impairment of function (neuroglycopenia). Effects can range from mild dysphoria to more serious issues such as seizures, unconsciousness, and (rarely) permanent brain damage or death."
As I understand it:My body is no longer able to accept the intake of sugars because when I introduce sugar into my body, say 39 grams which is found in a can of Coca-Cola. My body then produces enough insulin to take out 39 grams of sugar and THEN some, which ends up lowing the natural levels of sugar my blood is supposed to have. 
This leaves me crashing and my most common symtomps are currently:
Dizziness
Trouble Speaking

Trouble concentrating

Irritability

Heart palpitations

Shakiness
Heavy sweating
Numbness in my legs and feet
Stomach pains
Depression,
Sudden crying

Memory loss

Loss of strengthTo try and fight this I eat every two hours to try and keep my blood sugar levels up without introducing too much sugar into my system. How much is too much? Well, without the help of a doctor I have no idea. I am currently just keeping a food journal and trying to see how my body reacts to different foods. All the books I've read on the subject say it's completely variant on the person so I've been trying to cut any sugar ('good' or 'bad', my body doesn't care) almost completely out of my diet. I am also no longer able to consume alcohol or caffeine.








What is this money going towards exactly?

My first focus is going to get blood work done to find out exactly what is wrong with me. No more guessing and self diagnosing. $275 is the estimated cost of a doctors visit and blood work. I have no idea if that is per vial or per test...as I stated before, this doctor was not exactly the most open with information. I have no idea how much this will actually end up running me, but I know the minimum I need is $275.Any money I receive past that will ONLY be used towards additional doctors visits/testing. I would love to be able to visit a nutritionist to help ease my way into life as a hypoglycemic if that ends up being my only problem. Other items this campaign would fund:

Blood sugar monitor

Hypoglycemic cook books/informational texts.
"Special Needs" food.
Further Doctor's visits. 


NONE OF THIS MONEY WILL GO TOWARDS MY HOBBY. 



Other Ways You Can Help
I understand many people are without money just like me, but there are other ways you can help!

Spread the word! Like, Tweet, Email! Do whatever you can to spread the word. The more people who see this the more likely I am to receive some help.
I currently have a RedBubble account where people can buy designs and part of the proceeds go to me.

If you're also a cosplayer or into nerdy things you can keep an eye on my Facebook page where I'll be putting costumes things up for sale!

story:
“This is my wish for you: Comfort on difficult days, smiles when sadness intrudes, rainbows to follow the clouds, laughter to kiss your lips, sunsets to warm your heart, hugs when spirits sag, beauty for your eyes to see, friendships to brighten your being, faith so that you can believe, confidence for when you doubt, courage to know yourself, patience to accept the truth, Love to complete your life.” ~ Leo F. Buscaglia

 Aging in place allows our elderly loved ones to maintain a healthy and comfortable lifestyle while remaining in their own homes or communities. It provides them with a sense of security, warmth, independence, and freedom as well as the comfort of remaining in familiar surroundings.  The elderly; our mothers, our fathers, our grandparents - they raised us and deserve to be cared and comforted for in their "Golden Years" while in their own homes if they wish.   

WHO WE ARE:

Our company "At Home Companion Care, LLC" is an independent, licensed Health Care Service Firm in the state of New Jersey. We provide companions, CNA's and Certified Home Health Aids to assist the elderly with personal care, light housekeeping, and companionship in their private home or a facility.  We also provide nursing care if needed. We are bonded, insured, and all of our caregivers must pass and extensive background check before being employed by us.

WHAT WE NEED & HOW WE WILL USE IT:

To obtain this "Accreditation", At Home Companion Care is requesting contributions from our strongest supporters in order to achieve our ultimate goal. We need approximately $100,000.00. This will provide the funds necessary to:

                     Hire a consultant                15,000                                                                       Office requirements             14,000                                                                         Staff salary (1 year)             60,000                                                                       Marketing materials               5,000                                                                       Accreditation Firm Cost        6,000

The accreditation process could take up a year to complete, with inspections, paperwork going back and forth and the times available for the firm's voting times. It  also involves their staff visiting our facility and thoroughly examining all of our paperwork, policies, bookkeeping, payroll, records, etc. 

*Funds not needed for this process will be donated to charity.

                

WHY WE ARE ASKING:

The cost of home care varies but is ultimately less than the cost of a nursing home or assisted living facility. There are several ways one can pay for home care - cash, insurance, and Medicaid.  Unfortunately with the state of the economy, most families simply cannot afford to pay cash for home care and oftentimes have to rely on Medicaid. In southern New Jersey there are only a few Health Care Service Firms that can accept Medicaid for payment because most of them are not accredited. This is where we need your help! Medicaid has certain guidelines for Home Care companies to be able to collect from them for the care provided by our caregivers. One of those guidelines requires that the Home Care Company be Accredited. This is a fairly expensive process and our company simply does not have the funds to accomplish this. The process of becoming accredited involves the Home Care company being checked to make sure they have crossed all their t's and dotted all their i's.  All national and state regulations must be in order. Our company must have cared for a certain amount of clients.  All paper work such as financial and human resources must be in order, as well as any additional requirements by the accrediting firm.

For additional information about Aging or Aging In Place please visit any of the following sites:

Met Life:

https://www.metlife.com/assets/cao/mmi/publications/studies/2010/mmi-aging-place-study.pdf

National Association of Area Agencies on Aging (n4a):                         www.n4a.org       

Star News Online article:          http://www.starnewsonline.com/article/20140103/COLUMNIST/140109900/1177?Title=Here-Now-Aging-in-Place-helps-seniors-stay-in-their-home#gsc.tab=0     

NCBI Resources:                                      http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17804352

             



Whether you are able to donate or not, Please share this campaign on your Facebook timeline and Tweet about it.

Whether you are able to donate or not, Please share this campaign on your Facebook timeline and Tweet about it.

story:
Hey,

My name is Paul Gallagher, and one of my favorite things to do is come up with new inventions. My most popular by far is the "snowboard hook up." A simple device that holds the weight of a snowboard while on the chair lift.


After making one for myself a bunch of my friends wanted them too, so I figured I could make a business out of them. The first, crude version, sold so well at expos and online that I decided to professionally design the product, upgrade it, and bring it to the snow industry as a finished product. 
Check it out!


This campaign will help me bring the "Snowboard hook up"  to a major ski/snow industry event and display my product in such a way that I can begin the move to retail sales. 
If I can successfully display my product and get orders from retailers then I can start ordering larger quantities, bring down the price, and begin my relationship with retail outlets.  
What I Need & What You Get
If I am to be able to pay for the entire entry fee to SIA from indiegogo, then I would need to raise all $3,000. This event is so important that I am pursing all fundraising possibilities as well as saving and contributing money from my day job.
The event itself cost far more then $3,000. That is just for the entry fee. I also must put together a presentation in my booth space, pay for travel and lodging, as well as other expenses.  
When you contribute just a few bucks, you will receive a personal thank you as well as an invitation to come skiing/snowboarding with me and my friends any time I go for the next 2 seasons. 
If you go all the way and want one of my "Snowboard Hook Ups" for yourself I will personally send you one from the first batch arriving any day now from the factory. You will save $5 off the retail price plus get free shipping! An awesome deal. Once you use the product you will never want to ride the chair lift with out one again. 
The Impact Of Your Dollar
While in the start up phase every dollar counts enormously! By throwing your support behind my invention you not only directly aid its existence but cast a vote as a consumer that this product is valuable and others should be able to benefit from its value. The more people who know about it the faster we can all ride a little bit better on the mountain, so please consider promoting it on your own social media empire, after all that's what indiegogo is all about!  
Check out my website www.hookedupsb.com for more pictures video and information.  
Thanks!

story:
OFFICIAL BIKE FOR JESS HQ UPDATE

1. As predicted, Jess is embarrassed and mortified that you are all buying her bike. Awesome!

2. We've reached the $500 minimum fundraising goal obvs. In record time of like one hour. The bike was a little bit more than $500, so that's great. Jess's ride is on its way to being totally friend funded. 

3. Keep donating! We'll donate extra money raised to Chicago cyclist Jana Kinsman, who was attacked in Logan Square by men in an SUV. (Here's the story)

Here's Da Deal

While Jess was doing what Jess does best — making sure drunk kids can party on in this game called life — someone stole the only worldly possession that she cares about. No, not the shuffleboard table. The other only worldly possession she cares about. Her bike.

Since Jess cannot live bikeless and had to compete in a triathlon, a replacement bike has already been purchased. But she could really use your help paying it off. It cost a lot of dollars.

Hence, this auction. Please consider making a donation for one of these priceless prizes.

6 Reasons Why You Should Participate

  1. Jess would do the same for you.
  2. If you've ever gotten married, had a birthday, or given birth to a child while at the same time being a Friend of Jess, just remember all the awesome things she did for that occassion and how you felt like you could never thank her. This is how.
  3. Jess doesn't have a driver's license.
  4. Bike is how Jess gets to work. And to skee. And to Stanley's. And to where you are whenever you both hang out.
  5. You have been to a really awesome party at Jess's house at least once or ten times, and you have probably consumed beer she purchased. So this would be a nice way to pay her back.
  6. Bike thieves make Jess very sad and a sad Jess is just a sad thing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have a few bucks to throw in right now, that's totally fine. You can help by sharing this on your Facebook wall. That's just as helpful because it's likely you and Jess have at least 70 friends in common.

P.S. Important Information

Jess did not in any way facilitate, ideate, encourage, or organize this campaign. We did. In fact, she will probably hate us for doing so. Which is all the more reason you should donate.

story:
Update:........................

ITHACA— The Ithaca police officer shot in the line of duty late Thursday remained in intensive care Sunday evening at an out-of-county hospital.

Officer Anthony Augustine suffered a minor stroke sometime after the shooting on the 600 block of Chestnut Street, according to Deputy Chief John Barber.

The stroke has left Augustine with impaired vision, and his left arm and hand are not fully functioning, Barber said. He said the movement of his arm and hand is tentative and that he may not regain full mobility.

Augustine suffered a collapsed lung and has a chest tube in place. Augustine’s wife asked that community members keep her husband in their prayers, Barber said.

 

Short Summary

Just after 11 p.m. Thursday, Officer Anthony Augustine pulled over a driver who police say was driving a stolen car in the West Hill area of the city, according to Ithaca's public information officer.

Upon being pulled over, the driver jumped out of the car, and Augustine gave chase. He was shot in the shoulder during the foot pursuit.

Augustine was conscious and alert when police officers arrived on scene. He was flown to the hospital and had to undergo surgery. There was no update on his condition as of 10:30 a.m. Friday.

Augustine is a five-year veteran of the Ithaca Police Department.

The suspect was apprehended at 4:50 a.m. Friday by the Ithaca SWAT Team following a search that included multiple departments and at least two helicopters.

What We Need & What You Get

All money will be given to Officer Augustine and his family to help offset any financial hardships they may face while recovering from his inury. And also a huge welcome back to work party once he is cleared to return to patrol.

I have set the goal low, but lets give this man all the support we can!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Lets all also come together and thank Officer Augustine for his service. You can do so by sending an email to RhondaBullard@ymail.com.

story:
Versão em Português (click here for the Portuguese Version) 

_______________________________________________________________________

The Story

My name is Hicham and I am a passionate runner who has both run marathons and volunteered at water stops. I started Water Baton in 2013 to design a unique concept to satisfy the hydration needs of runners and other athletes.


The Purpose

WATER BATON™ was created to solve a problem that millions of runners and I experience in this sport. We runners are not able to effectively and quickly hydrate at water stops.

We get splashed in the face, sometimes gag and are left with little to drink out of cups distributed at the water stops. Sometimes runners have to completely stop to be able to grab a cup and drink. We not only lose precious seconds attempting to get the water cups but we are also not able to just grab them and go: water spills out of the cups.  What a waste of time and water! 

In an effort to correct this, I've conceived the idea of a WATER BATON™.

        

                                 Image 1 - Example of a Water Baton with a Sponsor Ad


What is WATER BATON™?

In the format of a relay baton, WATER BATON™ is a light, recyclable beverage container, with an EASY GRIP to grab and go, filled with just enough water to quench the thirst of an athlete.

A water bottle is too heavy and bulky; water cups are not practical to handle and hold while running, so WATER BATON™ comes in handy to runners. Made of PP plastic, the container is BPA-free and can be reused if not damaged or broken.

It can be used by runners, triathlon competitors, swimmers, walkers and other athletes.


Why is WATER BATON™ different than any other water bottle?

WATER BATON™ was designed especially for water stops, races and athletes who do not like to carry too much water but would like to have enough water to hydrate. The container holds approximately 4 fl oz and is easy to secure in any running belt, waist band, arm band, or simply in ones hands.


Benefits of Using Water Baton

1.  Runners and other athletes can

  • Hydrate more effectively,
  • Spend less time at water stops,
  • Reuse or keep a WATER BATON™ as a SOUVENIR and trophy
  • Run VERY light and still have enough water


                                

                                           Image 2 - AD Label Example


2.  Event directors and Sponsors have:

  • Less work at water stops as the WATER BATON™ can be prefilled with a drink of choice.
  • The opportunity for their WATER BATON™ to be sponsored by third parties who want to promote the event.  Ads can be printed onto the WATER BATON™ labels (see figure below).
  • Promote or raise awareness of their events to a niche market (e.g. Special Olympics, Pancreatic Cancer Walk, etc.). 

Image 3 - Water Baton labels with different Sponsors


There are MILLIONS of runners and at least 50,000 major races in the USA per year. This is without counting other events such as triathlons, swimming, walks, biking, etc. Thus, we feel strongly that there is a market demand for Water Baton.


Where Do You Come In?

Based on the great feedback on the concept we got from runners and race directors, we decided to pursue this dream. We have consulted with our local chamber of commerce, we have trademarked the name, the patent is pending and we can’t wait to start our testing phase.

Currently, we have some prototypes and started fundraising monies for the product development phase. We are ready to go to races, walks, triathlons and other sporting events to test our product but we need your help in order to make it a reality.


What Do We Need?

This $ 10,000 will be used towards operation, marketing and product development.

  • Approximately $5,000 for the molds (tooling) used to manufacture the tubes and caps
  • Approximately $2,000 for the manufacturing of 2,500 containers for testing and adjustments
  • Approximately $500 for shipping Water Baton to event directors
  • Approximately $1,500 for showing the concept in sport trade shows
  • Approximately $300 for the vinyl weatherproof ad labels
  • Approximately $450 for packaging design
  • Approximately $750 for promotional material and marketing

What Do You Get?

You will get a special place in our hearts and live in our memories as the "Heart Founders" of Water Baton™. We will always be thankful and grateful for that.

Also, besides getting one of our Water Batons™, your name will be permanently listed on our website and in the label that comes on the first Water Baton™ batch (see figure below). See perks for more details.


Image 4 - Label where name of Heart Founders will appear


Risks and Challenges

The direct selling of beverage containers to event directors is more costly than their business as usual way of supplying water stops. Unless we have a very large demand that drops price significantly, this way of doing business is unfeasible. However, some race directors who were interviewed said that they would buy WATER BATONS™ regardless of price to use them as a premium product (e.g. put in a bib package, use at the last water stop).

That said, the primary business model will revolve around advertisement by selling ad spaces (labels) to sponsors in the WATER BATONS™.  Yet, there has been great feedback from individual runners who said that they would buy WATER BATON™ from sport stores if price and quality expectations match. 

Another challenge concerns the design and material of this product. WATER BATON™ is striving to produce a container that is not a tripping or slipping hazard once discarded on the ground by runners at water stops. This is a challenge that we hope to address during the testing phase.



What If We Don’t Reach Our Goal?

We’d really rather not think of that! To respect the transparency of our relationship, we will use monies raised to design the packaging, show the concept on sports trade fairs and save some until we have enough to do the molds. DISCLOSURE: WE WILL NOT BE ABLE TO SEND YOU ANY WATER BATONS BY THE DUE DATE UNLESS WE REACH AT LEAST 75% OF OUR QUOTA.


Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit counts. If you can’t donate, please assist us by sharing this message on every sports event and social media platform you can. Share our Facebook page as well:


_______________________________________________________________________

Versão em Português  (Portuguese Version)


Estória

Meu nome é Hicham e sou um corredor ávido que já correu maratonas e voluntariou em diversas paradas de água para corredores. Eu criei WATER BATON™ em 2013 para satisfazer as necessidades de hidratação de corredores e outros atletas.


Propósito

WATER BATON™ foi criado para resolver um problema que eu e milhares de outros corredores experienciam constantemente nesse esporte. Nós corredores não conseguimos nos hidratar rapidamente e eficientemente nas paradas de água.

Quando tentamos beber dos copos oferecidos nas paradas de água, nosso rosto molha facilmente, engasgamos, sobrando muito pouco no final para beber. Na maioria das vezes os corredores têm que parar completamente para poder segurar o copo e bebê-lo. Não somente perdemos segundos preciosos tentando pegar água mas também não conseguimos correr com o copo na mão: a água derrama do copo. Que perda de tempo e água!

Por esta razão, eu criei WATER BATON™.


O Que é WATER BATON™?

No formato de um bastão de corrida, WATER BATON™ é um recipiente leve, reciclável e fácil de segurar, com água suficiente para saciar a sede de um atleta.

Uma garrafa de água é muito pesada e grande para carregar; copos de água não são práticos para segurar e sair correndo. WATER BATON™ atende a esse problema. Feito de polipropileno, o recepiente não contém BPA e pode ser reutilizado se não estiver danificado ou quebrado.

Triatletas, nadadores e outros atletas também podem se beneficiar.


Por que WATER BATON™ é diferente de qualquer outra garrafa d’agua?

WATER BATON™ foi projetado em especial para paradas de água, corridas e para atletas que não querem carregar muitos líquidos mas que gostariam de ter água suficiente para se hidratarem. O container contém aproximadamente 120 ml de água e pode ser preso ao seu cinto de corrida, ao braço ou pode ser facilmente levado na mão.


Benefícios do Water Baton

1.  Corredores e outros atletas podem:

1.1.Hidratar-se mais eficientemente

1.2.Gastar menos tempo nas paradas de água

1.3.Reutilizar ou guardar o Water Baton como lembrança da corrida

1.4.Correr mais leve e ainda ter água suficiente



2.  Diretores de Eventos e Patrocinadores terão:

2.1.Menos trabalhos nas paradas de água uma vez que o produto pode vir já pronto para usar.

2.2.A oportunidade para o WATER BATON™ ser patrocinado por uma companhia com divulgação da marca e logo.

2.3. Promoção de campanhas de conscientização com o nome de sua causa ou produto.


Como Você Pode Ajudar

Por causa do excelente feedback que tivemos de corredores e outros atletas, resolvemos levar a ideia a diante. Estamos atualmente com protótipos e começamos esta campanha para arrecadar fundos para trazer o produto ao mercado. Precisamos da sua ajuda para transformá-lo em realidade.


De Quanto Precisamos?

Estes $10,000 dólares vão ser usados para operação, marketing e desenvolvimento de produto.

·  Aproximadamente $5,000 dólares serão usados para fabricar o maquinario que vai produzir o tubo e a tampa.

·  Aproximadamente $2,000 dólares serão usados para fabricar 2,500 tubos para testes e ajustes

·  Aproximadamente $500 dólares serão usados para enviar Water Batons para diretores de eventos

·  Aproximadamente $1500 para mostrar o conceito em feiras de esportes

·  Aproximadamente $300 para fabricar as etiquetas a prova d’água

·  Aproximadamente $450 para o design da embalagem

·  Aproximadamente $750 para marketing e material promocional


O Que Você Ganha?

Voce vai ter um lugar especial no nosso coração e na memória como um dos fundadores especiais (“Heart Founders”) do Water Baton™. Nós seremos sempre gratos por isto.

Além de ganhar um ou mais Water Batons™, seu name sera permanentemente listado no nosso site e na etiqueta dos primeiros tubos. Veja os ‘PERKS” para mais detalhes.


Outras Maneiras para Ajudar

Se você não puder contribuir, ajude-nos compartilhando a campanha com amigos e familiares em todas as midias sociais e outros meios.

_______________________________________________________________________
The Story
My
name is Hicham and I am a passionate runner who has both run marathons and
volunteered at water stops. I started Water Baton in 2013 to design a unique
concept to satisfy the hydration needs of runners and other athletes. 

The
Purpose
WATER
BATON™ was created to solve a problem that millions of runners and I experience
in this sport. We runners are not able to effectively and quickly hydrate at
water stops. 
We
get splashed in the face, sometimes gag and are left with little to
drink out of cups distributed at the water stops. Sometimes runners
have to completely stop to be able to grab a cup and drink. We not only
lose precious seconds attempting to get the water cups but we are also not able
to just grab them and go: water spills out of the cups.  What a waste of
time and water!  
In
an effort to correct this, I've conceived the idea of a WATER BATON™. 

        
                                 Image 1 - Example of a Water Baton with a Sponsor Ad


What
is WATER BATON™?
In
the format of a relay baton, WATER BATON™ is a light, recyclable beverage
container, with an EASY GRIP to grab and go, filled with just enough water
to quench the thirst of an athlete. 
A
water bottle is too heavy and bulky; water cups are not practical to handle and
hold while running, so WATER BATON™ comes in handy to runners. Made of PP
plastic, the container is BPA-free and can be reused if not damaged or broken.
It
can be used by runners, triathlon competitors, swimmers, walkers and other
athletes.

Why
is WATER BATON™ different than any other water bottle?

WATER
BATON™ was designed especially for water stops, races and athletes who do not
like to carry too much water but would like to have enough water to hydrate. The
container holds approximately 4 fl oz and is easy to secure in any running
belt, waist band, arm band, or simply in ones hands.

Benefits of Using Water Baton

1. 
Runners and other athletes can 



Hydrate more effectively,


Spend less time at water stops,


Reuse or keep a WATER BATON™ as a
SOUVENIR and trophy

Run VERY light and still have enough water




                                                                           Image 2 - AD Label Example

Event directors and Sponsors have:


Less work at water stops as the WATER BATON™
can be prefilled with a drink of choice.
The opportunity for their WATER BATON™ to be
sponsored by third parties who want to promote the event.  Ads can be printed onto the WATER BATON™
labels (see figure below).
Promote or raise awareness of their events to
a niche market (e.g. Special Olympics, Pancreatic Cancer Walk, etc.). 


Image 3 - Water Baton labels with different Sponsors






There
are MILLIONS of runners and at least 50,000 major races in the USA per year.
This is without counting other events such as triathlons, swimming, walks,
biking, etc. Thus, we feel strongly that there is a market demand for Water
Baton.

Where Do You Come In?
Based on the
great feedback on the concept we got from runners and race directors, we decided
to pursue this dream. We have consulted with our local chamber of commerce, we have trademarked the name, the patent is pending and we can’t wait to start our
testing phase. 
Currently, we
have some prototypes and started fundraising monies for the product development
phase. We are ready to go to races, walks, triathlons and other sporting events to
test our product but we need your help in order to make it a reality.

What Do We Need?
This
$ 10,000 will be used towards operation, marketing and product development.

Approximately $5,000 for the
     molds (tooling) used to manufacture the tubes and caps
Approximately $2,000 for the
     manufacturing of 2,500 containers for testing and adjustments
Approximately $500 for shipping
     Water Baton to event directors
Approximately $1,500 for showing
     the concept in sport trade shows
Approximately $300 for the vinyl
     weatherproof ad labels
Approximately $450 for packaging
     design
Approximately $750 for
     promotional material and marketing


What Do
You Get?
You will get a
special place in our hearts and live in our memories as the "Heart Founders" of
Water Baton™. We will always be thankful and grateful for that.
Also, besides
getting one of our Water Batons™, your name will be permanently listed on our
website and in the label that comes on the first Water Baton™ batch (see figure
below). See perks for more details.



Image 4 - Label where name of Heart Founders will appear

Risks and
Challenges
The direct selling
of beverage containers to event directors is more costly than their business as
usual way of supplying water stops. Unless we have a very large demand that
drops price significantly, this way of doing business is unfeasible. However,
some race directors who were interviewed said that they would buy WATER BATONS™ regardless of price to use them as a premium
product (e.g. put in a bib package, use at the last water stop).
That said, the
primary business model will revolve around advertisement by selling ad spaces
(labels) to sponsors in the WATER BATONS™.  Yet, there has
been great feedback from individual runners who said that they would buy WATER BATON™ from sport stores if price and quality
expectations match. 
Another challenge concerns the design and material of this product. WATER BATON™ is striving to produce a container that is not a tripping or slipping hazard once discarded on the ground by runners at water stops. This is a challenge that we hope to address during the testing phase.


What If We Don’t Reach Our Goal?

We’d really
rather not think of that! To respect the transparency of our relationship, we
will use monies raised to design the packaging, show the concept on sports
trade fairs and save some until we have enough to do the molds. DISCLOSURE: WE WILL NOT BE ABLE TO SEND YOU ANY WATER BATONS BY THE DUE DATE UNLESS WE REACH AT LEAST 75% OF OUR QUOTA.

Every bit
counts. If you can’t donate, please assist us by sharing this message on every
sports event and social media platform you can. Share our Facebook page as
well:

story:
Surefire Wellness' Vitality Greens Superfood is packed with 50 whole food ingredients scientifically proven to improve your health from the inside out!

With many extraordinary nutrients not commonly found in other green drinks today, our product sets itself apart. We have gone above and beyond to ensure a delicious and refreshing lemon-lime taste with absolutely NO artificial sweeteners/ingredients!

One scoop a day packs ingredients known to:

  • Help provide natural sustainable energy 
  • Help manage stress, anxiety and depression 
  • Reduce inflammation 
  • Provide anti-aging benefits 
  • Increase libido
  • Improve sleep
  • Provide anti-oxidants to help prevent illness and disease
  • Improve mental clarity and focus and so much more!

Surefire Wellness' Vitality Greens Superfood is your daily natural source of vitamins, proteins, minerals and nutrients! Packed with fruits, vegetables and superfoods, Surefire Wellness' Vitality Greens Superfood is the first green superfood of its kind packed with Collagen!

A FEW OF OUR 50 NUTRIENT DENSE INGREDIENTS

 
 - Collagen improves the health of skin and hair as we age as well as reduces cellulite, stretch marks and improves skin elasticity. Collagen helps to repair joints, strengthen teeth and nails, promotes deeper sleep and improves gut health helping you feel and look younger. Our drink is the FIRST green superfood drink packed with collagen!

 


 
- Spirulina is rich in vitamins A, B1, B2, B6, E and vitamin K. It is the highest concentration of protein known of any food at 60%. It contains extraordinary antioxidant and polypeptide properties to trigger production of stem cells. Spirulina also has amazing anti-viral, anti-cancer and anti-aging effects.

 

 
- Wheat Grass is rich in Chlorophyll which helps alkaline the body, purify the liver, regulate blood sugar levels, and boosts metabolism. Wheatgrass is also rich in antioxidants like flavonoids and phenolic acid, iron, magnesium, calcium and amino acids.

 

 

- Pomegranate improves heart health, lower blood pressure, helps stimulate natural anti-bacterial response in the body, has natural aphrodisiac properties and reduces arthritis and joint pain. Pomegranate has also been known to help improve memory and increase blood flow throughout the body.

 

 
- Maca Root is an adaptogen that has been consumed for thousands of years in the regions of the Andes mountains. It is well known to help hormone balance in both males and females while reducing anxiety and depression. Maca root is loaded with anti-oxidants and is also known to have positive effects on energy, stamina and mood.

 

 
- Chlorella Detoxifies heavy metals and toxins from the body, lowers blood sugar and cholesterol, boosts immune system and aids cognitive function. Chlorella also helps to relieve digestive problems such as bloating, cramps, and irregularity.

 

 
 - Turmeric Root helps boost cognitive abilities, detoxify the body, aids in reducing depression and stress and helps clear acne scars leaving the skin glowing. Turmeric’s main component curcumin is loaded with antioxidants, fights signs of aging like wrinkles and pigmentation while providing anti-inflammatory abilities. Turmeric can also help speed up metabolism rates leading to weight loss and lowered bad cholesterol levels.

Why you need Surefire Wellness' Vitality Greens Superfood


Let's be honest, we are not eating the daily recommended amount of fruits and vegetables; even if we are, we are missing out on so many "superfoods" with their incredible benefits! Many foods today are loaded with chemicals. Chemicals stemming from the soil and/or preservatives which aid the foods growth. These chemicals, processed sugar and other artificial sweeteners are very toxic and are highly acidic foods. High acidity levels inhibit our bodies from performing at optimum levels and make you feel more sluggish and more prone to disease! Our drink will help alkalize your body and remove toxins to increase nutrient absorption.

Ingesting whole foods is quite different than ingesting from isolated vitamin capsules. Our green drink, with all whole foods, has a synergistic effect, complementing and boosting how the body can effectively absorb and use the nutrients. 

Surefire Wellness' Vitality Greens Superfood will help the digestive system, nervous system, respiratory system, endocrine system, urinary system, musculoskeletal system, exocrine system (skin-biggest organ of your body), immune and reproductive systems! 

Who We Are!

We have spent years conducting research on the ingredients in our formula and are extremely confident in our product and ability to produce at large quantities without issue per our production partners. We have taken every step to ensure this campaign has minimal risks.

*Surefire Wellness makes no medical claims or guarantees of health benefits listed above. Information shared about health benefits of the ingredients in our product are based on independent medical studies available for public review. We have third party labs perform numerous tests on our product for purity and safety to bring you the most powerful nutrient rich green powder we can provide!

Edited talk available here. (3:43 mins) 
Sources:

Deaths: final data for 2009, Center for disease control (link)
WHO “The 10 leading causes of death in the world, 2000 and 2011” (link)
Global status report on noncommunicable disaeses 2010. Geneva, World Health Organization, 2011 (link)
Harvard School of Public Health. Obesity Prevention Source, Economic Costs (link)
Institute for health Metrics and evaluations, Global burden of Disease, 2010 Cause of death 1990-2010 (link)

Video made by The Underground Arts LLC, Chicago

story:
Many of you know Bill Stevens - dancer, author, and martial-arts teacher.  He has been a fixture of the Rocky Mountain Swing Dance Club for over 20 years.  He has taught many Denver dancers the fundamentals of West Coast Swing.  He has been an active member of the Club and has served on its Board of Directors.  He has given countless hours of his time for the benefit of the Club.

Now some of us may want to give something back to Bill to thank him for his contributions in a time of need.  You may have noticed that Bill has not been present at the club dance for several weeks.  This is rare, since over the past 18 years he has seldom missed a dance.  Recently, while at a club dance, Bill experienced a shooting pain in his right leg and foot.  The pain was so intense that Bill was required to leave the Club dance and go home.  Several days later, Bill was diagnosed with a severe aneurysm of the artery of his right leg.  This is a ballooning of the artery wall which if untreated could cause permanent damage, even the loss of his leg.  Bill's doctor has recommended immediate surgery.  To make matters worse, this is an inherited condition which also affects the artery in his left leg, thus requiring two separate surgeries.  The rehabilitation time for each surgery is estimated at 4 weeks.

Bill is an independent contractor for an insurance company, and is required to be on his feet daily.  The 4 weeks of rehabilitation will not allow Bill to engage in his job duties thereby causing a loss of income.  This financial impact will be devastating to him.  He needs financial help to allow him to meet his financial obligations while recuperating from the surgeries. Although Bill is 74 years old, he is employed full time out of necessity.

Those of you who know Bill personally or by reputation, and want to help are encouraged to make contributions through the web site identified with this message.  The web host will get about 9% of the sums collected, the rest will go to Bill.  Any amount will help and will be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!!!

story:
Lost but not forgotten

 

Andy was one of the few truly decent people left in the world. He was always there for the ones he loved to lend a helping hand or a sympathetic ear. Despite all of the hardships he faced for so long, he never let it break his spirit. Ten years have passed since the day he lost his long battle with lymphoma. It is time we honor him in the way that he deserves. Please help support us in creating a memorial bench in his honor. The majority of the funds raised will be used to build a new bench overlooking the duck pond in Johnson Park. An additional amount will be allocated to create a beautiful memorial plaque to be attached to the bench. The remaining funds will be used to reserve a picnic grove and for supplies to be used at the memorial event in August. Time is of the essence. We need to raise the funds in enough time to reserve the grove and create the bench prior to the 10 year anniversary of his passing which is in August. Please join us in honoring this wonderful person who was taken from us much too soon.

story:
So Here Is My Story:

Hi, my name is Judy and my Dad passed away in May of 2012. My elderly Mom suffers from Mid Stage Dementia and Type 1 Diabetes. Without Dad there to care for her, my Mom was faced with having to leave the comfort of her own home and go to the "dreaded" Nursing Home. I made the decision to sacrifice everything for my Mom. I moved to Kentucky to become my Mom's 24/7 caregiver. I am unable to get a job due to the comittment I have made. I receive no compensation.  Therefore, I have no way to make any money unless I make it from home. I love to crochet with yarn that is handspun from fiber and natural wools. I have been using a hand Drop Spindle to spin my yarn. However, I was diagnosed with Juvenile Rhuematoid Arthritus at the age of 12. My hands are becoming more and more painful. If I could raise enough to buy a Spinning Wheel my hands wouldn't be as involved. I would then be able to make enough handspun yarn to sell for a small profit so that I can feel more accomplished and have a little pocket money. Most importantly, this will allow me to help Mom stay in her own home. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what can make it possible for me to keep Mom home:

  • I am looking to raise $650 to purchase the Spinning Wheel and enough fiber to get me going.
  • Donations of $25 and up will be Thanked with a hand crafted crochet scarf of your choice (Men or Women)!
  • All donations will be used for this goal only and for no other use.

The Impact

She's my Mom and I love her dearly... I have to try.

  • I can't continue to care for her without an income.
  • I am very good at my craft and will be successful with your help.
  • If it was your Mom (or Dad) you would do everything you could too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • HELP ME get the word out and make some noise about My Mom.
  • Indiegogo has awesome share tools! I'll take all the clicks I can get too!

Thank You for reading.

story:
Dear Friend,

Samantha had been assured that she is an excellent candidate for Fertility intervention!

Samantha (Sam), my daughter, has had several miscarriages. Her last pregnancy ended with the demise of her infant baby girl, at 23 weeks of pregnancy. It was learned that a bacteria had crossed over to the placenta and killed her baby. This occurred due to the opening of the cervix. She had to go through a full delivery, all the while knowing she would never have the chance to hold & love her baby. This was a most devastating ordeal, leaving her grief stricken.

A few months later, Sam had an exploratory operation. It was discovered that she was born with a "Unicornuate Uterus" (a genetic condition that cannot be corrected), PCOS & Endometriosis. These conditions render her impossible to have a viable baby WITHOUT fertility intervention & the ovulation age is also much shorter. We have a loving family and friends that would help if they could, but unfortunately they are struggling with their own expenses.

As the months & years go by, her desire & despair deepens. Every month I watch her tears roll down her face as she silently tries to nurse her broken heart again and again. Only a fertility clinic can give her the chance to have a viable baby that she & her husband, Neal, can love and cherish. I'd like to add that Sam and Neal are a loving & kind couple. They are empathetic to the needs of others, and are always there for anyone they can help.

We pray and hope that you or maybe someone you know would be able to help with the fertility & pregnancy medical costs. Insurance companies do not cover this type of expense. Sam, won't be able to work when she gets pregnant (also due to the complications of “Unicornuate Uterus”) and must have total bed rest. That would leave only one paycheck that would be insufficient to pay their regular monthly bills. I am a soon-to-be 66 year old widow on disability. I am on a fixed income, and am trying to do all I can, but there is just no way I can get anywhere near the amount of money that is needed. All the funds that we receive would be to cover the medical costs and help to financially get through the months that Sam will be out of work.

Sam and Neal, can't even imagine a life without a child of their own, to love, and nurture in the best of ways. I, myself, yearn for a chance to spend time with a grandchild with the years I have left. We even explored adoption, but that turns out to be even more money than the fertility clinic. I have no experience in fund raising, but the only hope left is to reach out to you, the many people that would be kind and able enough to bring this miracle to my daughter Sam.

May I please thank you in advance for any financial help you can give, and for your prayers.

Sincerely, Lorraine Greenbaum

story: Gaberila Shufani is a young woman, 22 years old, just starting her adult life. She suffers from Intractable Primary Generalized Mioclunic Epilepsy. Despite a pharmaceutical cocktail of medications she still suffers seizures every 10 minutes making her currently, permanently disabled. Recently, her medication cocktail started to interfere with her cognitive view of the world, she became confused and hallucinogenic. Shortly after, she was admitted to Huntington Memorial Hospital in Pasadena CA and was diagnosed with Schizoaffective Disorder/Bipolar I. Since her medications are the cause of her hallucinations, there is hope for a cure. The challenge is to stop the pharmaceuticals and seizures all together. Gaberila and her mother were at John's Hopkins University Hospital and Gaberila is scheduled to start a modified Atkins diet for seizure control, similar to a ketogenic diet, they will use food to control her seizures. But first, she needs to stabilize, and then slowly get off of her current medications. She is currently in Santa Barbara CA at Sanctuary Psychiatric Center, a non-profit 24 hour facility that will work with Johns Hopkins to treat Gaberila's Epilepsy and Schizoaffective Disorder caused by the pharmaceuticals. The insurance company will cover a small portion of the cost, but her mother Bobbie Shufani is left to come up with $100,000 for the next year of treatment. She has exhausted her life's savings. This young woman needs a Miracle. There's no reason for Gaberila not to lead a perfectly normal life. A donation account has been set up in Gaberila's name at Santa Barbara Bank & Trust. We will continue to hold fundraising events to raise more money. Any donation you can make is appreciated.

story:
I love Spiderman.  Always have.  Ever since I was a kid, I was drawn to his sense of duty.  Always putting others ahead of himself.  Whether he was suposed to be going on a date, an important meeting or simply if he was just too tired, he would always go where he was needed first, selflessly.  Above all the wise-cracking and high flying, this is perhaps Spidey's most endearing quality and one that I've tried to emulate as I got older.

I'm 30 now, have a wonderful family and have been truly blessed.  I'm not sure whether or not my 6 month old son will like Spiderman.  His grand dad is hoping he's more of a Thor fan!

I've been donning the identity of the wall crawler for about 5 years now.  I had a custom suit made for me.  I've attended fundraisers, camps for children who live with cancer and multiple fairs.  It's suprisingly hard work but I love it.  Kids run over with a million questions.  They poke me in the eyes  and ask for photos.  I'm always prepared with gifts to hand out and I stockpile colouring in books, stickers, temporary tattoos, toys and loads more.  This is where my campaign starts.

How you can help

All donations are greatly apppreciated!  The funds will be used to buy colouring in books, snap wristbands, toys, stickers and so much more.   If I recieve the full target, I can also buy a new suit as my current one has been through many a piggy back ride and performed innumerable high-fives.  It's still in good condition but it wont be too long until the wear and tear that I see becomes noticable.

I've recieved a  message from a mother, telling me their child now sleeps with the mask I gave them.  Another mum told me her son was in and out of hospital and Spiderman helped him get through it.  This is why I love it.  There's no better feeling than hearing these stories and knowing you've helped (if only in a small way) a sick child feel good about themselves.

story:
What is Gorilla Gym?

 

How you can help and how your contributions will be used

We have successfully tested the working prototypes which you see in the pictures and videos. Everyone who has tried Gorilla Gym loves it: not only family and friends but also total strangers at the Harvard Square Octoberfest. Next, we will finalize the colors, file expanded legal  paperwork, and generally get ramped up for production. Your contributions will help put the project across the finish line, help the production process preparations, and help fund our first production run. The more funding raised, the more funders will be the first able to get their hands on Gorilla Gym in early 2013 at a special discounted price just in time to keep all those New Year’s Resolutions!

Production Schedule:

  • Building production molds: December 16th
  • Building final pre-production prototypes and engineering samples   December 20th
  • Safety and agency testing: December 28th
  • Legal Fees: December 10th and January 22nd
  • Manufacturing services: January 5th
  • Final color selection: January 5th
  • Buying components and materials: January 5th
  • First production run: if we get more contributors, we’ll increase the production run! January 20th
  • Rewards Shipped! February 20th

How it works

(Disclaimer: The descriptions below are for information purposes only)

Your Doorway – One of the Strongest Structures In Your House

The old saying: “in an earthquake, the safest place in your house is under your doorway.” comes from the fact that your doorways are framed on all sides by sturdy 2 by 4s which can support hundreds of pounds.  

Self-Adjusting Cantilevered Design Supports Up and Down Motion

Part of our design is cantilevered just like the old-school pullup bars which easily attach to a doorframe and are able to support up and down motion by transferring the force to the wall above the door frame and to the side of the door frame.  See figure below:


Traditional cantilevered pullup bars, however, are not designed to support motion (swinging back-and-forth or sideways). This is where Gorilla GymTM comes in!

Our Patent-Pending Vise Grips Secure Gorilla Gym To Your Doorframe

Swinging motion or the forces that result from using an attachment like a boxing bag introduce lateral (across the wall) and longitudinal (along the side of the wall) motion. The Gorilla Gym Vise Grips are designed to counteract these forces and keep Gorilla Gym secured to the door frames on each side.



Technical Specs:

  • Weight (Gorilla Gym): 8 lbs
  • Fits standard door frames: 24” to 36” wide
  • Size (assembled): 3 ft x 1 ft x 1 ft
  • Maximum supported weight
    • Gorilla Gym:  300lbs
    • Suspension straps:  240lbs
    • Pullup extender:  240lbs
    • Ab straps:  240lbs
    • Swing:  200lbs
    • Yoga swing:  200lbs
    • Fight station:  50lbs
    • Baby swing:  30lbs
    • Swing deluxe:  30lbs
  • Frame: Professional quality steel
  • Other materials: foam padding, injection molded plastic

 

About Us: 

 Peter has over 10 years of experience commercializing new products as an executive in multiple startups in the Boston area. An avid multi-sport athlete, Peter was the top scorer on our MIT-Harvard soccer team, leading the team to many championships and post-game celebrations. With a Master’s degree in engineering and an MBA, Peter’s incisive inputs gave life to Gorilla Gym and his focus on results helped move this project along quickly. Owner of the top frequent Home Depot shopper card, he cut so many pipes in crafting the prototypes for Gorilla Gym that we started calling him “Piper” instead of his usual soccer nickname “Pepe”.  A devoted father, Peter enjoys exercising with his son Christo, who has a blue belt in taekwondo and scores even more goals at soccer than his dad.  Concerned with Christo’s safety, Peter worked hard to ensure that Gorilla Gym is safe and fun to use for all ages.
 

 Kiril started his serial entrepreneurship during grad school by co-founding the national magazine The Boston Book Review which, in 1994, was the first national print magazine to also put its entire print content on the web. During that time period, he won the MIT $50K entrepreneurship contest & the Stanford Global Challenge while co-founding a biotech company Genigma (formerly Eyegen). Next, spinning the International Economic Alliance www.IEAlliance.org out of Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government with co-founder Van McCormick kept him busy until he started designing the world’s thinnest wallets on the side. That led to the creation of the Big Skinny line of ultra-thin wallets for men and women www.BigSkinny.net. In 2010, Big Skinny set a Guinness World Record for the World’s Largest Wallet which was on display in Harvard Square for 1 month during the Holiday season and helped raise money for 14 deserving local non-profit organizations http://www.bigskinny.net/wallet-large.html . He is even more excited about the Gorilla Gym prototype as it is helping him stay in shape while having fun with his 2 toddler sons and wife.
 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Will it fit in any doorway?  Gorilla Gym can fit a 24”-36” doorway which is the range that most doorways fall into.

What is the weight limit? The core Gorilla Gym is designed to support up to 300 lbs. Weight limits for attachments vary (see technical specs)

What colors will be available? We are currently finalizing the color scheme and would love to hear your feedback: please vote for your favorite color combination in our online poll on our website: http://www.gorilla-gym.com/poll.

What is the warranty? We will warrantee our products for 1 year for manufacturer’s defects.

What's the difference between the prototype unit in your photos and videos, and the final production unit?  Most likely, you will see little or no difference, except for the final color combinations. However, we reserve the right to make modifications as needed to improve usability and compliance with safety regulations. 

What is the final retail price of the core unit? Generally, the final retail price will be ~20% higher than the reward levels in this campaign. We want to show our appreciation for our early backers by offering them a special discounted price. The final price will depend on a number of variables including the success of this campaign and the number of units we produce.

What about the final retail price of the attachments? Again, that will depend on the same variables as the core unit. We plan to make attachments as affordable as possible.

What is the shipping cost? Our reward levels include shipping within the continental USA. Shipping internationally will involve additional costs based on location and size of the products. 

Is this safe for me and my children? So far, we have tested it rigorously and we’ve used it extensively ourselves and with our children. We are currently preparing for rigorous lab tests in order to comply with all applicable USA safety standards.  

When will it be ready? We hope to go into production as soon as we have adequate funding, perhaps even before the end of this campaign. We will give you updates as we go through the various design and mold stages.

How heavy is Gorilla Gym and how hard is it for a smaller person to install? Gorilla Gym is actually less than 10 pounds, and because of the cantilevered design, is easy to install by anyone. It should take you no more than 30 seconds to install.  You only need to  initially adjust the Gorilla Vise-grips to fit your doorway; the rest is just a snap. There is no need to hold it up for very long so almost anyone can do it easily and quickly.

What other attachments are coming out? We have more in mind and we’d love to hear from you what you want us to develop. If you have an idea for an attachment, please send us an e-mail at service@gorilla-gym.com. We will publish the best ideas and so everyone involved can vote and decide which ones come out next.

How can I try one out?  Many had the opportunity to try Gorilla Gym at the Octoberfest fair at Harvard Square. We are considering other open sessions in the greater Boston area, so stay tuned. If you have a suggestion, please write to us at service@gorilla-gym.com.

Ask a question. We want to hear from you!

http://gorilla-gym.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/...
