Rewards Shipped! February 20th

How it works
(Disclaimer: The descriptions below are for information purposes only)
Your Doorway – One of the Strongest Structures In Your House
The old saying: “in an earthquake, the safest place in your house is under your doorway.” comes from the fact that your doorways are framed on all sides by sturdy 2 by 4s which can support hundreds of pounds.  
Self-Adjusting Cantilevered Design Supports Up and Down Motion
Part of our design is cantilevered just like the old-school pullup bars which easily attach to a doorframe and are able to support up and down motion by transferring the force to the wall above the door frame and to the side of the door frame.  See figure below:Traditional cantilevered pullup bars, however, are not designed to support motion (swinging back-and-forth or sideways). This is where Gorilla GymTM comes in!
Our Patent-Pending Vise Grips Secure Gorilla Gym To Your Doorframe
Swinging motion or the forces that result from using an attachment like a boxing bag introduce lateral (across the wall) and longitudinal (along the side of the wall) motion. The Gorilla Gym Vise Grips are designed to counteract these forces and keep Gorilla Gym secured to the door frames on each side. 
Technical Specs:

Weight (Gorilla Gym): 8 lbs
Fits standard door frames: 24” to 36” wide
Size (assembled): 3 ft x 1 ft x 1 ft
Maximum supported weight 

Gorilla Gym:  300lbs
Suspension straps:  240lbs
Pullup extender:  240lbs
Ab straps:  240lbs
Swing:  200lbs
Yoga swing:  200lbs
Fight station:  50lbs
Baby swing:  30lbs
Swing deluxe:  30lbs

Frame: Professional quality steel 
Other materials: foam padding, injection molded plastic
 
About Us: 











Peter has over 10 years of experience commercializing new products as an executive in multiple startups in the Boston area. An avid multi-sport athlete, Peter was the top scorer on our MIT-Harvard soccer team, leading the team to many championships and post-game celebrations. With a Master’s degree in engineering and an MBA, Peter’s incisive inputs gave life to Gorilla Gym and his focus on results helped move this project along quickly. Owner of the top frequent Home Depot shopper card, he cut so many pipes in crafting the prototypes for Gorilla Gym that we started calling him “Piper” instead of his usual soccer nickname “Pepe”.  A devoted father, Peter enjoys exercising with his son Christo, who has a blue belt in taekwondo and scores even more goals at soccer than his dad.  Concerned with Christo’s safety, Peter worked hard to ensure that Gorilla Gym is safe and fun to use for all ages.




 












Kiril started his serial entrepreneurship during grad school by co-founding the national magazine The Boston Book Review which, in 1994, was the first national print magazine to also put its entire print content on the web. During that time period, he won the MIT $50K entrepreneurship contest & the Stanford Global Challenge while co-founding a biotech company Genigma (formerly Eyegen). Next, spinning the International Economic Alliance www.IEAlliance.org out of Harvard’s Kennedy School of Government with co-founder Van McCormick kept him busy until he started designing the world’s thinnest wallets on the side. That led to the creation of the Big Skinny line of ultra-thin wallets for men and women www.BigSkinny.net. In 2010, Big Skinny set a Guinness World Record for the World’s Largest Wallet which was on display in Harvard Square for 1 month during the Holiday season and helped raise money for 14 deserving local non-profit organizations http://www.bigskinny.net/wallet-large.html . He is even more excited about the Gorilla Gym prototype as it is helping him stay in shape while having fun with his 2 toddler sons and wife.




 


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Will it fit in any doorway?  Gorilla Gym can fit a 24”-36” doorway which is the range that most doorways fall into.
What is the weight limit? The core Gorilla Gym is designed to support up to 300 lbs. Weight limits for attachments vary (see technical specs)
What colors will be available? We are currently finalizing the color scheme and would love to hear your feedback: please vote for your favorite color combination in our online poll on our website: http://www.gorilla-gym.com/poll. 
What is the warranty? We will warrantee our products for 1 year for manufacturer’s defects.
What's the difference between the prototype unit in your photos and videos, and the final production unit?  Most likely, you will see little or no difference, except for the final color combinations. However, we reserve the right to make modifications as needed to improve usability and compliance with safety regulations. 
What is the final retail price of the core unit? Generally, the final retail price will be ~20% higher than the reward levels in this campaign. We want to show our appreciation for our early backers by offering them a special discounted price. The final price will depend on a number of variables including the success of this campaign and the number of units we produce.
What about the final retail price of the attachments? Again, that will depend on the same variables as the core unit. We plan to make attachments as affordable as possible.
What is the shipping cost? Our reward levels include shipping within the continental USA. Shipping internationally will involve additional costs based on location and size of the products. 
Is this safe for me and my children? So far, we have tested it rigorously and we’ve used it extensively ourselves and with our children. We are currently preparing for rigorous lab tests in order to comply with all applicable USA safety standards.  
When will it be ready? We hope to go into production as soon as we have adequate funding, perhaps even before the end of this campaign. We will give you updates as we go through the various design and mold stages.
How heavy is Gorilla Gym and how hard is it for a smaller person to install? Gorilla Gym is actually less than 10 pounds, and because of the cantilevered design, is easy to install by anyone. It should take you no more than 30 seconds to install.  You only need to  initially adjust the Gorilla Vise-grips to fit your doorway; the rest is just a snap. There is no need to hold it up for very long so almost anyone can do it easily and quickly.
What other attachments are coming out? We have more in mind and we’d love to hear from you what you want us to develop. If you have an idea for an attachment, please send us an e-mail at service@gorilla-gym.com. We will publish the best ideas and so everyone involved can vote and decide which ones come out next.
How can I try one out?  Many had the opportunity to try Gorilla Gym at the Octoberfest fair at Harvard Square. We are considering other open sessions in the greater Boston area, so stay tuned. If you have a suggestion, please write to us at service@gorilla-gym.com.
Ask a question. We want to hear from you!
http://gorilla-gym.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/...

story:
My name is Jay Molina and I'm a good friend of David Choy. David is a world class sax player and we play together in a jazz band called SLAM! David recently suffered a stroke and is currently in the hospital doing rehab and getting better each day. I decided to do an online fundraiser for David and his wife Debbie and daughter Erika to help with the enormous financial burden they are encountering because of his stroke. Your donations will be used to cover some of the medical costs involved and also to help pay for monthly living expenses since David was the main income source for his family and will not be able to work again for awhile. 

He is doing much better and is in good spirits but his recovery will take time.

Thank you for your donations and for keeping David in your thoughts and prayers.

Aloha,

Jay

story:
Short Summary

Active Minds at the University of Toronto is a student group that seeks to create awareness and community for mental health issues on campus. We'd like to extend our reach to support youth in our local community.

Oolagen is an organization that helps youth and their families cope with mental illness. They provide a variety of services, but our favourite is their FREE walk-in clinic, located at Church & Wellesley in downtown Toronto. Teenagers from 13-18 years old and their families can either walk in or make appointments to see a counselor and receive assistance for their mental health concerns. And that's right - it's free. They provide an amazing service and they need our help to keep it up and make it even better. 

Check them out:

We want to host a benefit in order to raise funds for Oolagen in April 2015. The date that we are planning for right now is Friday April 10th in the evening. It will be located in the Junior Common Room in University College.

The benefit will largely be a dance party with a more "sophisticated" cocktail period beforehand. We hope that older members of the community will join us at that time in order to participate in a silent auction, donate, and grab some food. Our broad theme is "comfort" - things that make you feel good and increase your mental health. Appetizers and desserts will be served to fit in with this theme as "comfort food". There will be a cash bar. 

We know that big parties, loud music and drinks make some people nervous - that's why we will have another small room open for people to take breaks and chat with their friends. We want to make this an enjoyable experience for everyone and a great way to end the school year, so we're open to suggestions. 

In addition to selling tickets, we want to raise money in other ways too - we'd like to have a silent auction featuring art pieces by students (preferably mental health inspired) and other donated items. We hope to feature students' work inspired by mental health in this way, or through short performances and displays. There will be a photographer present who will take great photos for you guys. 


What We Need & What You Get


We receive very little funding from the University of Toronto - what money we do receive is needed to keep Active Minds at UofT running during the school year. We do not charge any fees to our membership base and all of our regular events are completely free, though this year we are trying a "pay what you can" concept. This is because we want as many people as possible to be able to be a part of our community.

In order to put on this benefit in the first place, we need to raise some money to pay for things like:

-Food (~$500). We will be serving a variety of appetizers and desserts that tie into our mental health theme as "comfort food". It doesn't sound like much, but food for 100+ people adds up.
-Bar (~$400). The bar will be a cash bar (meaning you guys will have to pay for your own drinks), but the school still requires us to hire bartenders and pay a whole bunch of other fees. 
-Decor, advertising, ticket printing, etc. (~$100). Little things add up too.


We will also be trying to raise money during the year as well by selling merch, having bake sales, etc. We will be selling tickets starting in the spring - they will be $10 in advance and $15 at the door. 

For every $10 you donate, you will receive a ticket to the benefit. For example, donating $20 can get you a ticket for yourself and a date. 

If you don't want multiple tickets, but still want to donate more - thank you so much! You can choose from alternative perks as well. If you're not coming to the benefit, but still want to donate - again, thank you so much! We've got perks for you as well. Our favourite perk is also a little bit unconventional, so we just wanted to take a sec to explain it:

$5 - 1 song. Our cheapest perk is actually our favourite, and we think you'll love it too. If you donate at least $5, you get to pick a song that will be played at some point during the benefit, guaranteed. No need to pester the DJ with requests or be disappointed - it's happening. (As long as it's not offensive.) You can purchase your ticket later if you want, or request a song for that special someone in your life.
50 available.

The restrictions on this one are based on time. All other perk "packages" that include songs will be subject to the limitation of 50 as well. 

-

If we do not reach our goal, we will continue to fundraise throughout the year. 

If we surpass our goal, we will donate the excess funds to Oolagen. 


    Other Ways You Can Help


    If you can't afford to donate - we understand! You can still help us by spreading the word. Please share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media.

    You can also help spread the word on campus by making announcements in your classes, and posting in UofT groups online.

    If you would like to volunteer, we are looking for:
    -Artists (any kind) to donate pieces for a silent auction
    -Entertainers (e.g. musicians, comedians) to give short performances (preferably related to mental health)
    -Servers to assist with food preparation and distribution
    -Ticket takers and sellers (leading up to and during the benefit)
    -A photographer
    -A graphic designer (needed prior to the event)
    -Assistance with set up and tear down
    -Coat check


    If you're interested, please email Chelsea at activemindsuoft@gmail.com.

story:
TINA FIT

Is an enhanced version of the existing TINA Mobile APP (already trusted by 9000 Registered Fitness Instructors), extending it to Fitness Enthusiasts, creating a unique Fitness Online-Community platform.


In practice, this new version enables Monetised Online Fitness Sessions, Live and recorded. We are now very close to the first Go-Live.

Here's the latest Go-Live Agenda

We have not started yesterday, here's the history of this project.

We are currently testing the Live streaming and recording sessions; these tests should undertake one week, we will then prepare for the launch of the instructor scheduling and submit the new app version on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

In parallel, we will release the Fitness Fan Web app and schedule the first month of live classes, with instructors of all fitness programs, in every world timezone and many languages.

After allowing two weeks for users to register for their preferred sessions, we will officially launch TINA FIT LIVE STREAMING.

Innovation in Fitness

A Huge step for the fitness community in general, but especially during this pandemic struggle.

Online fitness provides access to coaches all across the world. You are no longer limited by the knowledge and experience of the instructors who work in their local gym. This means you can seek out experts that suit your needs and have extensive and niche-specific expertise in your own language. 

TINA FIT Big Picture

TINA FIT is much more than just another Online Fitness Solution.

Our ongoing focus is to develop the right tools for fitness instructors to start building their online business, and for fitness fans to practice their training at home in the best conditions, with their preferred instructors in their own language.


Soon we will be extending with social network capabilities, event management, and marketplace development.

 

TINA FIT Ongoing Development

This is the first design we created featuring some of the TINA FIT Capabilities.
Live Fitness Sessions LIVE NOW and Upcoming, sessions can be filtered by:

  • Language
  • Fitness Program, Brand or category 
  • Instructor search, Instructors I follow

TINA FIT Live Session, including Live Chat. Each Live Session will be automatically recorded and available on the instructor's channel for viewing later. The instructor can select to commercialize or not each session, Live or Recorded.

Streaming quality is one of our main priorities, TINA FIT is built on a market leader streaming platform, assuring the high standard quality of stream feeds. Streaming can be started from the TINA mobile app, from the web platform, or from any RTMP video source. 

We want to assure all fitness enthusiasts the best training experience, high image and sound quality, streamed to a laptop browser, mobile phone but also compatible with video streaming capabilities. 

Click here to experience an immersive ride by TINA Creator and Master Instructor Joao Ferreira: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/653213291

 

TINA FIT Existing Functionalities

 

TINA FIT Future Developments

Where are we going, how does the future look like?

 

Our Partners

Partnering is essential to the strength and expansion of the community, as we are still looking for new partners and building this section it up, feel free to get in touch with us to evaluate our potential partnership.

 

A big thanks to our current partners

  • TOTAL SHAPE: totalshape.com 
  • My Fit Station: myfitstation.com 
  • Just4Cycling: www.facebook.com/justfourcycling
  • AWBIC - Association Wallonie Bruxelles Indoor Cycling: awbic.be

 

Not just another Online Fitness Solution

Online fitness is not something new or revolutionary, so what makes us different?


Our focus is different; we propose the platform with tools for the fitness instructor to freely teach online and decide on his sessions' commercialization options. The platform will allow the instructor to build his community of followers and grow his business.

We base ourselves on the existing instructor's app, with more than 8.000 instructors registered and growing. Most instructors are eager to propose live and recorded paying sessions. The reality is that the majority of instructors got their fitness revenue streams reduced down to zero.
Today, no platform allows instructors to commercialize their work freely and propose it to a large fitness enthusiast community. 

We often use the word community, what does it mean for us, and why is it different from other platforms? 

Although fitness is a general term, there are many fitness bubbles or communities, usually depending on the program type. These bubbles can combine fitness brands or types, countries, and languages.

We created this new concept of a dynamic fitness community. Any user, instructor, or enthusiast identifies his/her fitness preferences, country, and language; this results in dynamic groups that will grow over time.

These dynamic communities will be used for instructors to propose their content adapted to a dynamic community, touching enthusiasts they could not reach before.

Fitness enthusiasts will discover instructors that provide content to their preferred community, they will evaluate the content, and by default, the best content will rise from the crowd.

Overall, this technique will improve the general quality of the content, just like Uber enhances cab service quality due to the end-user evaluations.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So, coming to the funding.

We need financial support from backers like you and we need it with some sense of urgency. To capitalize on the aftermath of this pandemic, which presents a great business opportunity for apps like TINA, we would like to get funds and accelerate her development. While we are currently building a MVP, we wish to add more helpful functions and your funding will help us reach that goal faster.

 

To be able to provide the best streaming quality and lower the cost per stream, we require to engage on an annual plan with our streaming provider. Your support will cover parts of that to.

 

Your funds will also be utilized to engage with our prospective customer base through marketing and PR activities. We want to do it right in the very first time and we hope that you’ll help us in that.

 

Fitness enthusiasts will get free premium memberships, to use the platform all they want, full access to live and recorded sessions.

Fitness Instructors will get a free instructor premium account, with full access to schedule free or paid live or recorded classes. Premium access is the highest revenue tier. 

 

The Impact

TINA.FIT is not just an app that lets fitness instructors run their live and online classes. It also allows them to monetize their sessions and restart their revenue streams.

On the other hand, TINA FIT lets fitness fans reconnect online with their favorite instructors and join in on their classes.

Fitness Instructors will now have a one stop shop to commercialize their work and get rewarded for all the hard work they put into their classes.

Fitness Enthusiasts can continue to train at home or while abroad, with their preferred instructor in their own language.

More than these features, we want to build a very complete fitness community solution.

We think this is pretty exciting. If you do too, then please consider investing in TINA. We will value all of your contributions and will use them to make this a real success. 

 

TINA - The Instructor's APP

TINA FIT is a brand new fitness platform that offers live and online fitness sessions to fitness enthusiasts worldwide. While the idea of TINA had been in my mind for years, it was only last year that I took on this project with all seriousness by deciding the scope and building up a real project plan.

TINA derives her name from her core competency and that is to be ‘The Instructor’s App’. And she is thus exactly that, a platform where fitness instructors can come together and reach passionate fitness fans around the world without the confinements of a physical location, gym or fitness centre.  Today 8.000 Fitness Instructors are registered in TINA

Find the download links here http://tin-a.com (available for ios and android)

 

TINA Storyline

 

TINA - In Numbers

     

    Risks & Challenges

    1. We face the challenge of meeting very tight deadlines. Since we wish to capitalize on post-COVID lifestyles, we need to get our app developed and out there as soon as it is humanly possible. The risk here then applies if we hit developmental delays which will affect TINA’s launch.
    2. While competition is always a risk for any business, we have to stay proactive and keep an eye out for other market-entrants during the time that we are still working on our idea. Our unique approach of focusing on fitness instructors should help us in faster content creation, but the challenge is in getting the platform up and running before the idea becomes stale.
    3. Lastly, though highly unlikely considering the success of our current beta test reach, there is always a risk of the solution not picking up or of the content not being enough. If we face a content scarcity, we will have to invest further in buying the content we lack.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • You believe you can't really help? although 1€ is already a nice support, you can help anyway, promote our event within your community, we appreciate that as well.

    And that's all there is to it.

Your funds will also be utilized to engage with our prospective customer base through marketing and PR activities. We want to do it right in the very first time and we hope that you’ll help us in that.
 
Fitness enthusiasts will get free premium memberships, to use the platform all they want, full access to live and recorded sessions.
Fitness Instructors will get a free instructor premium account, with full access to schedule free or paid live or recorded classes. Premium access is the highest revenue tier. 
 
The Impact
TINA.FIT is not just an app that lets fitness instructors run their live and online classes. It also allows them to monetize their sessions and restart their revenue streams.
On the other hand, TINA FIT lets fitness fans reconnect online with their favorite instructors and join in on their classes.
Fitness Instructors will now have a one stop shop to commercialize their work and get rewarded for all the hard work they put into their classes.
Fitness Enthusiasts can continue to train at home or while abroad, with their preferred instructor in their own language.
More than these features, we want to build a very complete fitness community solution.
We think this is pretty exciting. If you do too, then please consider investing in TINA. We will value all of your contributions and will use them to make this a real success. 
 
TINA - The Instructor's APP
TINA FIT is a brand new fitness platform that offers live and online fitness sessions to fitness enthusiasts worldwide. While the idea of TINA had been in my mind for years, it was only last year that I took on this project with all seriousness by deciding the scope and building up a real project plan.
TINA derives her name from her core competency and that is to be ‘The Instructor’s App’. And she is thus exactly that, a platform where fitness instructors can come together and reach passionate fitness fans around the world without the confinements of a physical location, gym or fitness centre.  Today 8.000 Fitness Instructors are registered in TINA
Find the download links here http://tin-a.com (available for ios and android)

 
TINA Storyline

 
TINA - In Numbers



 
Risks & Challenges

We face the challenge of meeting very tight deadlines. Since we wish to capitalize on post-COVID lifestyles, we need to get our app developed and out there as soon as it is humanly possible. The risk here then applies if we hit developmental delays which will affect TINA’s launch.
While competition is always a risk for any business, we have to stay proactive and keep an eye out for other market-entrants during the time that we are still working on our idea. Our unique approach of focusing on fitness instructors should help us in faster content creation, but the challenge is in getting the platform up and running before the idea becomes stale.
Lastly, though highly unlikely considering the success of our current beta test reach, there is always a risk of the solution not picking up or of the content not being enough. If we face a content scarcity, we will have to invest further in buying the content we lack.


 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
You believe you can't really help? although 1€ is already a nice support, you can help anyway, promote our event within your community, we appreciate that as well.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Was ist ‹Healing Garden›? 

‹Healing Garden› ist ein biodynamischer Heilpflanzengarten in Candelaria, Teneriffa. Das Projekt startet im Oktober 2014 auf 4000m2. Das Unternehmen ruht auf drei Säulen: Ökotourismus, Umweltpädagogik und, vor Allem, der Vertrieb von Heilpflanzen: Artemisia Annua Anamed, Moringa, Jiaogulan, Kurkuma, Ingwer, Zistrose, Guanabana, Ginseng etc.  

Wie entstand ‹Healing Garden›?

Im Frühjahr 2011 begann Ich in der Demeterlandwirtschaft zu arbeiten: zunächst auf dem ‹Trantenrotherhof›, danach auf dem ‹Hof Sackern› in Witten und schließlich auf dem ‹Dottenfelderhof› bei Frankfurt. – 2013 zog ich nach Candelaria und absolvierte dort ein einjähriges Praktikum im ‹Eridanos- Zentrum für Salutogenese›, wo ich gemeinsam mit einem Freund einen vielseitigen Permakulturgarten anlegte.

Aus dem Wunsch heraus, mich mit der Landwirtschaft selbstständig zu machen, verbunden mit der Begeisterung für Heilpflanzen, die im subtropischen Klima Teneriffas besonders gut gedeihen, begann ich im Frühjahr 2014 mit der Konzeption von ‹Healing Garden›.

                                                                             

     

                                                    

                                         Im Permakulturgarten auf Teneriffa


Worin liegt der originäre Impuls von ‹Healing Garden›?

Mit ‹Healing Garden› soll ein vielfältiger Lebensraum entstehen, der sowohl nach den Prinzipien der Biodynamik als auch der Permakultur gestaltet ist: Geschlossene Kreisläufe, Berücksichtigung des Kosmos, große Vielfalt von Pflanzen und Tieren, Steigerung der Bodenfruchtbarkeit, Solarenergie, ‹Landwirtschaftliche Individualität›, biodynamische Präparate, natürlicher Pflanzenschutz, Synergie durch Mischkulturen und Fruchtfolge.

Im Besonderen sind es zwei Merkmale, die ‹Healing Garden› einzigartig machen. Der ‹Low-Budget› und ‹Do-it-yourself-Ansatz› der Permakultur: Beobachten, Konventionen hinterfragen, möglichst alles selbst machen aus recycelten oder gefundenen Materialien. Zweitens: Der Fokus liegt auf  – teils noch wenig erforschten aber viel versprechenden – Heilpflanzen, die das Projekt wirtschaftlich tragfähig machen.

                                         

Inwieweit stellt sich das Projekt den Herausforderungen der Zeit? 

In Zeiten von Ebola und anderen globalen Seuchengefahren wird zunehmend deutlich: Das isolierende Prinzip – das Isolieren einzelner Stoffe zum Zwecke der Herstellung von Medikamenten – ist an sein Ende gekommen. Die traditionelle Pharmazie wird einerseits immer un-bezahlbarer, vor Allen für jene, die sie am dringendsten benötigen. Auf der anderen Seite zeigt sich, dass Viren und andere Erreger sich an isolierte Substanzen in kürzester Zeit anpassen und somit selbst teure Medikamente beängstigend schnell ihre Wirksamkeit verlieren.

Insofern ist ‹Healing Garden› ein Ort der Ganzheit im besten Sinne: Die produzierten Heilpflanzen wirken nachgewiesenermaßen als Ganzes – keine teure Isolation einzelner Stoffe – besser, als die Medikamente, die daraus hergestellt werden könnten: Die Extrakte der ganzen Pflanze  enthalten oft hunderte wirksamer Substanzen, die sich gegenseitig ergänzen, und sie sind dazu wesentlich erschwinglicher – sie kosten etwa ein Zehntel dessen, was die daraus gewonnenen Medikamente kosten würden. Sie bekämpfen zudem nicht nur einzelne Symptome, sondern sie helfen dem aus der Balance geratenen Organismus, sich selbst zu heilen. 

Darüber hinaus ist ‹Healing Garden› als Ganzes ein komplexes System, ein Organismus, an dem exemplarisch aufgezeigt und studiert werden kann, wie ganzheitliches Denken und damit tatsächliche Nachhaltigkeit für unseren Planeten in der Praxis aussehen können.


                                    

     Artemisia Annua Anamed nach drei Monaten, Centro Eridanos, Frühjahr 2014 

      

Wie wirken die Ergebnisse/Erkenntnisse/Erzeugnisse weiter, sind sie Anregungen für Andere? 

Auf den Kanaren wird bis heute DDT verwendet, der Einsatz von Pestiziden in der Landwirtschaft ist dort doppelt so hoch wie im übrigen Spanien. Darüber hinaus herrscht eine Jugendarbeitslosenquote von rund Fünfzig Prozent, staatliche Langzeit-Arbeitslosenhilfe gibt es nicht.

‹Healing Garden› könnte eine Art ‹Leuchtturm› sein, der zeigt, dass man sich seinen Arbeitsplatz auch selbst schaffen kann mit etwas, das auch für die Umwelt gut ist und das dazu auch noch eine Menge Spass macht! 

Die Kanaren gehören zu den biodiversesten Lebensräumen unseres Planeten, ein Drittel der hier wachsenden Pflanzen ist endemisch, weswegen sie auch die ‹Galapagosinseln der Botaniker› genannt werden.


                                             

                       Artemisiakeimlinge nach drei Wochen, September 2014


Die produzierte Heilpflanzen kommen zunächst der lokalen Bevölkerung zu Gute: sie sind effizient, kostengünstig, frei von Nebenwirkungen und sie leisten durch die Unterstützung von ‹Healing Garden› einem Beitrag zu Naturschutz und Artenvielfalt. 

Die Hälfte der Agrarflächen auf Teneriffa liegt brach! Der Anbau von Heilpflanzen könnten – über dieses Modellprojekt hinaus – eine Möglichkeit sein, das in Europa einzigartige Klima der Kanaren für den weltweiten Export zu erschließen und so extensive, ökologische Landwirtschaft wieder attraktiv und rentabel zu machen und darüber hinaus die wachsende Nische des Öko- und Agrartourismus auszubauen. 


Wer sind die Menschen, die ‹Healing Garden› tragen? 


                                                

                            Projektgründer und Leiter: Curro Martino Cachinero   

Gründer von ‹Healing Garden› ist Curro Martino Cachinero: geb. 1986 in München. Zweisprachig aufgewachsen: deutsche Mutter, spanischer Vater. 2006 Abitur, Note: 1,4 – Jahrgangsbester. Freies Jugendseminar und staatliche Kunstakademie in Stuttgart, Jugendsektion Dornach, Youth Initiative Program, Järna, Schweden, Studium der Philosophie und Kulturreflexion in Witten/Herdecke, Aufenthalt in Eridanos, Wechsel in die Landwirtschaft, Mitarbeiter von ‹Das Goetheanum›, Gründung von ‹Healing Garden›. 


                                                 

                              Berater und Unterstützer: Dr. pharm. Hans Martin Hirt

Berater und Unterstützer ist Dr. pharm. Hans Martin Hirt: Pharmazie-studium, 1978 Doktorarbeit über Möglichkeiten der natürlichen Verstärkung der Abwehrkräfte am Deutschen Krebsforschungszentrum in Heidelberg. Bis 1985 Leiter der Abteilungen für Herstellung und Analyse von Medikamenten an der zentralen Klinikapotheke des Landkreises Heilbronn. Ab 1984 Besuch von Hospitälern in Peru, Nepal, Indien und Zaire. 1985 Gründung der internationalen Organisation ‹Anamed – Aktion für natürliche Medizin› mit inzwischen über 1000 Projektpartner in 75 Ländern. 


                                                    

                                   Businesscoach: Dr. med. Fritz Helmut Hemmerich

Heilpflanzenkenner und Businesscoach ist Dr. med. Fritz Helmut Hemmerich: geb. 1954, studierte Humanmedizin und Philosophie in Bochum und Essen. 1992 wurde er Chefarzt der Frauenklinik in Germersheim, wo er am Aufbau einer ganzheitlichen Geburts­hilfe und eines eigenen Akutbehandlungs- und integrativen Nachsorgekonzeptes für Krebspatienten mitwirkte. Sein ursprüngliches Interesse für Neuro- und Psycho­therapie verband er so mit dem immer bekannter­ werdenden Ansatz der Salutogenese. Er übernahm die ärztliche Leitung eines Kurzentrums und baute es zu einem salutogenetischen Schwerpunkt aus.­ Heute liegt der Fokus seiner Arbeit als Leiter des Eridanos-Zentrums für Salutogenese auf Teneriffa im Bereich der Krisenberatung, Trauma-therapie, Neurotherapie und Bewusstseinsforschung.



Ist eine Stringenz in der Planung, Umsetzung, Nachbereitung ersichtlich? Sind die anfallenden Kosten klar dargestellt und liegt eine realistische Planung für die Finanzierung vor, bei der sich das Projekt nicht allein auf einen Geldgeber konzentriert oder von Stiftungen finanziell abhängig bleibt?

«Im Allgemeinen neigen wir dazu, zu überschätzen, was wir in einem Jahr erreichen können. – Doch wir neigen ebenso dazu, zu unterschätzen, was wir in fünf bis acht Jahren erreichen können». Fritz Helmut Hemmerich

Die Startphase des Unternehmens ist auf fünf bis acht Jahre angelegt. Einige der Heilpflanzen, wie die zunehmend bekannter werdende ‹Moringa› oder die antitumoral wirkende ‹Guanabana›, sind Bäume, die – auch wenn sie relativ schnell wachsen – mindestens fünf Jahre benötigen, bis sie ausreichend Blätter produzieren. Eine ähnlich lange Zeit dauert es, bis Ginsengwurzeln geerntet werden können. Sind diese und weitere Pflanzen jedoch erst einmal fest im Boden verwurzelt, produzieren sie stetig, ergiebig und ohne viel Arbeitsaufwand. – Das gleiche gilt für das aus der Permakultur entlehnte Konzept ‹food forrest› insgesamt. Ist ein vielfältiger und klug gestalteter ‹essbarer› oder in diesem Falle ‹medizinischer› Wald erst einmal über die Pionierphase hinausgekommen, produziert er stetig und benötigt dabei relativ wenig äußere Pflege.

Pflanzen wie das aus China stammende Adaptogen ‹Jiaogulan›, das anitviral wirkende ‹Zystus› oder der gegen Rheuma hochwirksame ‹Pilli- Pilli-Pfeffer› dagegen wachsen wesentlich schneller: Bereits nach drei Monaten kann der Verkauf von Teeblättern, Essenzen und Salben auf dem Wochenmarkt und über das Internet beginnen. – Im ersten Jahr wird der Schwerpunkt vornehmlich auf ‹Artemisia Annua Anamed› liegen, einer Hybridzüchtung, die bisher vor Allem in Afrika angebaut wird und gegen Malaria, inzwischen aber auch zunehmend zur Linderung der Symptome  von Krebs, Aids und vielen weiteren Krankheiten verwendet wird. Mit dieser Pflanze liegen bereits sehr positive Erfahrungen vor, sowohl was den erfolgreichen Anbau auf Teneriffa als auch was den Direktverkauf sowie die unmittelbaren Wirksamkeit als Medikament betrifft: 

Geerntet wird Artemisia 10 Monate nach Aussaat. Im ersten Jahr werden rund 200 bis 300 Kilogramm auf rund 1000m2 produziert und anschließend in 50-Gramm-Päckchen zu je 8€ auf dem lokalen Wochenmarkt vetrieben. 


Die Mietkosten für das Land betragen monatlich 200€, die Kosten für Wasser liegen bei 60 Cent/m3 oder 50-200€ im Monat. Die Installation eines effizienten Tröpfchen-Bewässerungssystems liegt bei einmaligen 200€ plus 16 bis 48 Cent/m2, je nachdem, wie eng gepflanzt wird.

Saatgut ist bereits ausreichend vorhanden, anfallende Kosten sind beliebig hoch, können aber zB. durch den Austausch mit anderen Gärtnern relativ niedrig gehalten werden. Ähnliches gilt für Werkzeuge. Da so gut wie alles in Handarbeit erledigt wird, fallen nur geringe Kosten für Maschinen und Strom an. Eine kleine Solarzelle kostet rund 500€.

Am Anfang, solange noch keine Tiere vor Ort sind, muss Kompost zugekauft werden. Durch den Anbau von stickstofffixierenden Pflanzen und die eigene Herstellung von ‹18-Tage-Kompost› mit Hilfe von Mist, Stroh und Wasser sowie weitere Techniken aus der Permakultur können auch hier die Kosten relativ niedrig gehalten werden. 18m3 hochwertiger Mulch kosten 300€. 

Für den Bau von Zäunen, Ställen sowie das Schaffen von Schattenflächen werden einfache Materialien wie Draht, Folie, Schilf, Palmenblätter und Holzpaletten verwendet, die Kosten dafür sind überschaubar. Das absolute Minimum um das erste, laufende Jahr zu finanzieren, bis die Artemisia-pflanzen geerntet werden können und ein stetiges Einkommen erzeugen beträgt 8000€.


                                    

                                                       Es gibt viel zu tun…

Eine ähnlich lange Zeit dauert es, bis Ginsengwurzeln geerntet werden können. Ist ein vielfältiger und klug gestalteter ‹essbarer› oder in diesem Falle ‹medizinischer› Wald erst einmal über die Pionierphase hinausgekommen, produziert er stetig und benötigt dabei relativ wenig äußere Pflege.
Pflanzen wie das aus China stammende Adaptogen ‹Jiaogulan›, das anitviral wirkende ‹Zystus› oder der gegen Rheuma hochwirksame ‹Pilli- Pilli-Pfeffer› dagegen wachsen wesentlich schneller: Bereits nach drei Monaten kann der Verkauf von Teeblättern, Essenzen und Salben auf dem Wochenmarkt und über das Internet beginnen. – Im ersten Jahr wird der Schwerpunkt vornehmlich auf ‹Artemisia Annua Anamed› liegen, einer Hybridzüchtung, die bisher vor Allem in Afrika angebaut wird und gegen Malaria, inzwischen aber auch zunehmend zur Linderung der Symptome  von Krebs, Aids und vielen weiteren Krankheiten verwendet wird. Mit dieser Pflanze liegen bereits sehr positive Erfahrungen vor, sowohl was den erfolgreichen Anbau auf Teneriffa als auch was den Direktverkauf sowie die unmittelbaren Wirksamkeit als Medikament betrifft: 
Geerntet wird Artemisia 10 Monate nach Aussaat. Im ersten Jahr werden rund 200 bis 300 Kilogramm auf rund 1000m2 produziert und anschließend in 50-Gramm-Päckchen zu je 8€ auf dem lokalen Wochenmarkt vetrieben. 
Die Mietkosten für das Land betragen monatlich 200€, die Kosten für Wasser liegen bei 60 Cent/m3 oder 50-200€ im Monat. Die Installation eines effizienten Tröpfchen-Bewässerungssystems liegt bei einmaligen 200€ plus 16 bis 48 Cent/m2, je nachdem, wie eng gepflanzt wird.
Saatgut ist bereits ausreichend vorhanden, anfallende Kosten sind beliebig hoch, können aber zB. durch den Austausch mit anderen Gärtnern relativ niedrig gehalten werden. Ähnliches gilt für Werkzeuge. Da so gut wie alles in Handarbeit erledigt wird, fallen nur geringe Kosten für Maschinen und Strom an. Eine kleine Solarzelle kostet rund 500€.
Am Anfang, solange noch keine Tiere vor Ort sind, muss Kompost zugekauft werden. Durch den Anbau von stickstofffixierenden Pflanzen und die eigene Herstellung von ‹18-Tage-Kompost› mit Hilfe von Mist, Stroh und Wasser sowie weitere Techniken aus der Permakultur können auch hier die Kosten relativ niedrig gehalten werden. 18m3 hochwertiger Mulch kosten 300€. 
Für den Bau von Zäunen, Ställen sowie das Schaffen von Schattenflächen werden einfache Materialien wie Draht, Folie, Schilf, Palmenblätter und Holzpaletten verwendet, die Kosten dafür sind überschaubar. Das absolute Minimum um das erste, laufende Jahr zu finanzieren, bis die Artemisia-pflanzen geerntet werden können und ein stetiges Einkommen erzeugen beträgt 8000€.
                                                                                           Es gibt viel zu tun…

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign is over, but you haven’t missed out! Hapbee is in stock and ready to ship.

Place your order now, and we’ll include fast US shipping for free.

In October 2020 we have finished shipping Hapbee to all of our backers. It has been an amazing journey and we are overjoyed with all the positive feedback we’ve received so far! Read what real Hapbee users say about their experience here.

To learn more and order a Hapbee, head over to Hapbee.com

For press inquiries, please contact support@hapbee.com 

Follow Hapbee on Youtube - Facebook - Instagram - Twitter



Hapbee ("Happy") is the world's first wearable that lets you feel calm, alert, focused, relaxed or sleepy on command - all with just a few taps on your smartphone.

This unique product allows you to experience the feelings and sensations you desire almost instantly, without ingesting any harmful substance or chemical, while having the ability to return to your normal baseline state within a matter of minutes.













The evolution of Hapbee.



"The most effective, substance-free, mood-altering tool on the market today."


Using patented technology and proprietary software, Hapbee sends predictable, low-wavelength electromagnetic signals throughout your body, emulating your favorite feelings and sensations, without the use of potentially harmful substances and chemicals.

You're in total control thanks to Hapbee's unique SignalMap functionality. Since Hapbee's different signals are mapped to specific feelings, you have complete control of which feeling or sensation you'd like to prompt with just a couple taps from your smartphone!

Most importantly, Hapbee does not require potent chemicals to evoke the feelings and emotions you desire. Hapbee puts you in complete control of the emotions or feelings you want – when you want them - giving you complete control of your state and empowering you to become more mindful of how you feel on a daily basis.

This kind of awareness in itself is a powerful movement toward living a better life.






See what these entrepreneurs are saying about Hapbee...



"This product is a stroke of genius. When I wear it around my neck I feel like Ironman. You've actually built something that works and it does what it says it's supposed to do."
- Dave Asprey | Founder | Bulletproof Coffee
 
 
"I'm experiencing the Calm signal, and this is radical! Revolutionary."
- Suzy Batiz | Founder | PooPourri
 

"You're really changing the world here. The best analogy I have for it is electricity."
- Dan Sullivan | Founder | Strategic Coach

 


"...the reports I'm seeing and the people responding to this are amazing."
- Joe Polish | Founder | The Genius Network
 

 



Hapbee is like a playlist for your feelings - with the ability to replicate dozens of different feelings by “playing” predictable electromagnetic signals.

Hapbee does not require potent chemicals to give you the feelings and emotions you desire. 

There’s truly nothing else like it on earth, and with 32

 

 patents behind this new technology – Hapbee stands alone in the industry of e-feelings. 
 


 

"Change Your State, Change Your Life..."

Hapbee's revolutionary technology allows you to...

  • Guard against today’s constant stress and fast-paced demands, and... 

  • Replace or reduce negative habits you've always wanted to leave behind

  • Eliminate reliance on endless cups of coffee for your morning boost of energy

  • Stay calm, cool, and collected under pressure during your big meeting

  • Cut out calories from traditional 'social lubrication' but still enjoy the buzz

  • Simply feel “yourself” without the need for mind-altering alternatives with Hapbee’s powerful magnetic frequencies
     



You can choose the feeling you’d like to play and control the strength of the signal simply and easily using the Hapbee mobile companion app. 



Hapbee works by emitting low-energy magnetic fields that are designed to emulate a specific feeling. 



Hapbee's magnetic field uses frequencies from 0-22kHz, much lower frequency than cell phones which are in the range of 600 MHz or greater. Hapbee’s magnetic field is non-ionizing and non-thermal.



Hapbee is designed to be lightweight, ergonomic and worn comfortably over the head, on the brim of a hat, or around the neck, where you can even tuck it comfortably under your shirt. ​




Using Hapbee couldn't be easier!

Simply download Hapbee's companion app, and select a specific signal to prompt your desired feeling. 
 
















 

 




...At your fingertips.

Hapbee can replicate dozens of different familiar feelings all falling under 6 signal categories, with more signals being launched every few months to members through the app.


 

Happy

Known as the "happy hour" signal, Happy is here to loosen you up. 

This signal can make you feel less stressed, more giggly, and even a bit flushed. Happy is the social lubricant you need to enjoy time with friends and family, or unwind from a long workweek.  It pairs perfectly with watching the big game, or in any social setting.  Cheers!
 

Calm

Give your mind the much-needed break it deserves with Calm. 

This signal is the definition of "chill," allowing you to mellow out and tone down unwanted stressors throughout their day.  Great after a long work day, watching a movie, playing video games, or any time you want a mental break.  
 

Relax

Let your body slowly melt away with Relax.

This signal eases the tension in your body.  This is a dream for anyone who sits at a desk all day.  Great after a workout, while hiking, watching a movie, folding laundry, long flights, or before bed. Sit back and enjoy!
 

Alert

Here comes the energy!

Alert was inspired by the jolt you get from an energy drink to help you feel more sharp, vigilant and aware. It feels like a cup of coffee, without the digestive issues. It's great for studying, running errands, before a big meeting, on a long road trip, and while playing music or sports. 
 

Pick Me Up

Pick Me Up is the right combination of focus and relaxation.

It's the perfect primer for any stressful situation, big presentation, interview, road trip, or tedious errands. Enjoy this signal anytime anywhere so you can enjoy the buzz without inhaling or ingesting harmful chemicals or toxins into your body.  When do you need a break?
 

Sleepy

Inspired by sleep aids, the Sleepy signal helps you wind down at the end of a long day.

Let the smooth, mellow vibes wash over you as you begin to yawn and your eyes get heavier. Great to play 30 minutes before bed, during bedtime routines, on a long flight, or in the middle of a restless night.  Ease into sleep.






When you purchase your Hapbee during our Indiegogo launch, you'll receive 3 months access to all of Hapbee's signals through the companion mobile app included with your perk. 

And if you join the at the Hapbee Legacy Perk Level, you'll receive 12 months access included! 





If Hapbee doesn’t deliver the feelings you need to help you feel better during the daily grind just let us know within 30 days of arrival of your Hapbee and request a refund.

If it doesn’t improve your mood, empower you to reduce stress, and make you feel better, or for whatever reason you’re not completely blown away by the ease and effectiveness of using Hapbee – request an immediate refund (but we know you're going to love it!). 

See and hear what others have said about feeling Hapbee for the first time...
 


 

 

 

 




 
 




 

  • The first 5 prototypes were completed on September 30th, 2019. Hapbee partnered with Product Creations Studio out of Seattle, WA, to finish the design, mechanical and electrical engineering phases and assist in writing the firmware and part of the software for the product.
     
  • Our internal team has completed the mobile app for both IOS and Android.
     
  • The first 6 Signals are available (Happy, Calm, Relax, Alert, Pick Me Up, and Sleepy) to play in the App.
     
  • We currently have 10,000 units in production with our manufacturing partners out of Ohio, and they are handling tooling and molding process now.
     
  • Our first 50 products will be finished for approval in late March and products will begin shipping in mid to late May 2020.


Manufacturing & Production


Help change the world by spreading the word about this life-changing technology!

story:
Luxe Ave Hair Company

"Luxury is in each detail"  Hubert de Givenchy 

I'm a young woman who needs your help with launching her first business. Luxe Ave Hair will be a company dedicated to offering its customers quality, and luxurious hair extensions. The hair is virgin (unprocessed) 100% Brazilian hair, and will be offered in a variety of textures: straight, wavy, and curly. There will also be a variety of lengths to choose from starting at 14". 

I'm starting this hair company because I believe in this product, and I love weave. I believe that hair does not define you, but it is an enhancement and can make you feel even more beautiful. Our hair is our crowning glory - no matter how you choose to wear it. I want to offer hair extensions to women (and men) who want a product that's not only QUALITY, but BEAUTIFUL. 

What We Need & What You Get

Help me launch Luxe Ave Hair:

  • Alright $6000.00 will fully help me to launch Luxe Ave Hair company. The bulk of the money will help me to purchase the hair from my wholesale retailer, and will cover the cost of the bundles + shipping. 
  • $6000 will also help me to purchase my packaging/shipping materials for the hair: carrying cases, bows, care instructions, tags, etc. 
  • Last but not least, it will help me to create a professional logo, website, and business cards to effectively advertise, and market the company. 
By supporting this campaign not only will you get that warm, fuzzy feeling but the more money that you donate, the more perks you'll receive. You'll receive a 30% discount on any 3 bundles you decide to purchase, or 15% discount on your order. Higher donations will also receive a 30% discount on 3 bundles, but also a small goodie bag filled with treats to help you maintain your Luxe Ave hair. 

The Impact

Not only would you be helping me by supporting me in building my first company, but you would also be helping me to supply a quality product to the public. Luxe Ave Hair wants to bring out your inner goddess, and make you feel even more beautiful with each bundle. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can't help. Please help spread the word around about this campaign: tell your family, friends, neighbors, pets. If you can think of anyone who you know wouldn't mind giving to this campaign - please do. Use the Indiegogo share tools and help me to get this company off the ground.

story:
Celebrate Stacy’s birthday and International Women’s Day by helping to BUILD the Suubi Health Center in Uganda to transform women’s health and create lasting change in the community. 

For every $25 contributed on Stacy's Birthday, March 3rd, Indiegogo will give $1 in honor of international women's day!

Warm greetings to you! My name is Latifah Kiribedda. I am a Katie from Uganda and I graduated with my Bachelor’s degree in Public Health in 2012. While at St.Kate's, I met Stacy - she was my supervisor who went an extra mile to be an amazing mentor and friend! Through our conversations about life and dreams, Stacy always encouraged my heart to keep going and dreaming big! 

About the Suubi (Hope) Health Center Project

I believe that all human beings deserve to have access to quality healthcare services. Unfortunately, this is not the reality in many places like my home country Uganda especially in the rural areas. In the rural village of Budondo, the closest health facility is 24 kilometers away. The common means of transport for pregnant women are motorcycles or bicycles. Others opt to walk the long distance if they can’t afford the transport fare. Pregnant women give birth without professional services, and many opt to give birth at home risking their lives and those of their babies.

That is all about to change. 

In partnership with Mama Hope, an organization that shares my vision for a grassroots approach to development, I am fundraising to help construct a comprehensive and good quality healthcare center – Suubi Reproductive Health and Family Center. The Center will give over 26,000 people access to quality health care, maternal health services, and accurate health information on nutrition, midwifery services, family planning and sanitation.

The SUUBI (Hope) Reproductive Health and Family Center

With the completion of the Suubi health center, women regain their dignity and health

The Construction of the Suubi Health Center is underway; the comprehensive healthcare center will comprise a main health clinic, maternity ward, full scale laboratory, surgery theater, and housing for health workers. Thus far, the main health center block building is up.

The Impact

In honor of the women in Budondo, please consider making a contribution that will transform their lives, those of their children, and their children’s children. So far, we have raised over $5,500 and the  goal is to raise $20,000 by May 1st and then I will return to Uganda to supervise the project and provide progress updates for donors to see the impact they are making! See progress on my overall fundraising goal. With your help, we can make this comprehensive health center a reality!

Cute babies  in Budondo village

Community gathering to discuss the health needs and priorities

Other Ways You Can Help 

Every contribution makes a huge difference. Please support this initiative by sharing the website with your friends and loved ones on Facebook or Twitter and/or word of mouth. For more information on this project and to keep track of our progress, visit my website!

Thank you so much for your generosity!

story:
Press Release

For Immediate Release

Zelosport, LLC
Spud Alford, Founder and CEO
www.zelosport.com

706.888.6065
Email: spud@zelosport.com

  It was inevitable! A National Competition for the Entire Family! Finger Golf is going on Tour!!!

Zelosport, the creators and marketing arm of the nationally acclaimed and award winning Finger Football game and the National Finger Football League has formally made the announcement that 2014 will be the inaugural year for the Professional Finger Golf Tour. With first place prize money at each event in the $5000 range, players are lining up!

The first step is raising the funds to build the only 18 hole Finger Golf course on the globe. "Since it is a unique print job and each hole is anywhere from 4 feet to 10 feet long, it's kind of expensive but I'm certain with the feedback we are getting we'll find the funding through our Indiegogo campaign."

The 18 hole course will be made available for sale to the marketplace only through Zelosport starting in May, 2014. Individuals or businesses can start their very own Finger Golf events and tournaments.

Spud Alford, founder and CEO of the parent company stated that the National Finger Football League was off and running so it was just a natural progression to take our Finger Golf game and give golfers the same national platform.  “I would guess that 75% of America’s population has at some time flicked a piece of paper or a pack of sugar across a table, whether in a lunchroom or a restaurant setting, hoping to score a touchdown by skillfully causing the object to rest with one portion of it hanging over the table’s edge. We simply took the concept to a whole new level.”

In the Zelosport Finger Golf version, according to Spud, “It is the only national competition to my knowledge where a child, a parent and a grandparent in the same family and of either gender can compete together with an equal chance at winning.”

An 18 city tour is being developed starting in 2014 with test events being held earlier in the year. 


With a recent study showing that the number one thing young people prefer to do is spend time with their family, Zelosport will create an environment that is wholesome and fun allowing sports enthusiasts a chance to compete with and against their own family members. Tanner Childs, a 19 year old from Columbus, Ga. who competed in and won a “test” Finger Football tournament held in 2006 when he was just 11 said “I made it all the way to the finals and wound up competing against my 47 year old uncle. And I beat him!” Tanner added, “It’s just a great way to spend a Saturday. And it’s not a computer game. The players are actually doing something. Everyone was competing as though we were on national television.” 

Spud, the inventor of the games, is actually himself a former U.S. Olympic hopeful in the 10 event decathlon. His whole idea behind the concept was to create games that families can play together in their kitchens and living rooms while building lasting memories. “The PFG Tour was simply a natural progression of the board game created in 2007 with tour players having partial ownership in the PFGT.”

A survivor of testicular cancer, Spud speaks nationally to young people about the living life intentionally and chasing their dreams, even while feeling fear.

For more information on the company and the PFG Tour, contact Zelosport or Spud at spud@zelosport.com. Spud may also be contacted by telephone at 706.888.6065.

story:
THE NOURISH & THRIVE INITIATIVE IS NOW 

FULLY FUNDED!


Please follow on Twitter @NourishThriveCo

Hello Friends!

My name is Brittany Van Ness and I am in pursuit of a seat on the Millennial Trains Project (MTP). I am passionate about holistic health and nutrition, especially for its application in cancer prevention and patient care. 

Poor diet and a lack of exercise are two key factors in increasing cancer risk, and about one third of all cancer deaths are linked to these same risk factors [1].

On the MTP journey, my goal is to gather industry-accepted health and nutrition practices from experts across the American South.  I would have access to some of the best resources across the country while meeting with cutting edge oncology and research centers. Through insights gained from the MTP experience, my objective is to spread awareness of the nutrition-health connection and create an accessible  guide to lead cancer patients and the general public to better health.


The Project

My project is The Nourish & Thrive Initiative - and with it, I want to open a conversation about health and nutrition for cancer patients. 
I want to erase the information gap between today's research and the average citizen. Reducing cancer risk and deaths is a real and tangible goal and it all starts with making this information accessible for all.
With my MTP journey, I will lay the foundation to create a toolkit to maximize nutrition and minimize environmental risks during cancer treatment and recovery. This information would serve as a road map regardless of diagnosis, geography, or economic status.

The Problem, The Vision, & The Future

Each year 14 million new cases of cancer are diagnosed around the world [2], this is leading to a massive community of patients within the United States that is currently being underserved. Cancer patients are often limited to the information provided by their local doctors or the cancer services available within their region. 
I believe that patients deserve easier access to top-rate nutrition and health guidance regardless of their geography. I want to help foster the creation of a multidisciplinary approach to health with obtainable directives that leads cancer patients though treatments, harsh side effects, and post-treatment recovery. 
In much of the country, there is a disconnect between cutting edge research and the direction given to cancer patients in terms of nutrition, mental health practices, and environmental risks. I want to close this gap, and create an accessible resource to help patients take control of the health variables within their personal power. 


The Game-plan 

I will take time in each city to meet with a variety of experts in the fields of cancer treatment, nutrition, health, and non-profit organizations that serve the greater cancer community across the United States. Through interviews and behind-the-scenes looks into some of the most successful programs in the country, I plan to gather a comprehensive introduction to lay the groundwork for a usable toolkit for cancer patients. 

The Breakdown

I've identified targets to meet with on the MTP journey in each city:

  • Los Angeles, CA: Simms/Mann – UCLA Center for Integrative Oncology; F C Cancer Foundation
  • Austin, TX: Whole Foods Market Headquarters
  • San Antonio, TX: University of Texas, Cancer Therapy & Research Center (CTRC); Center for Integrative Oncology - A Division of Oncology San Antonio
  • New Orleans, LA: Tulane University Center for Culinary Medicine; The ReFresh Project and SPROUT NOLA
  • Atlanta, GA: The American Cancer Society; The World Health Organization; Cancer Treatment Centers of America
  • Washington D.C.: The American Institute for Cancer Research; The National Cancer Institute; Environmental Working Group


Spreading the News

I'll be posting live from the tracks travelling across the southern United States. Ultimately, my project will be hosted entirely online to increase it's availability and visibility beyond traditional cancer treatment delivery systems.
You can start following the journey now at my newly minted twitter handle @NourishMTP

Please donate to help me pursue my passion via the Millennial Trains Project, and share this with your friends and family!

An Important Note:

If my campaign is among the first 20 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, any contribution you make will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of my journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs through MTP. 
***If I am not among the first 20 applicants to reach the crowdfunding goal, no supporters of The Nourish & Thrive Initiative will be charged. Additionally , I'll be responsible for covering the cost of my flight to LA to get to the kick off point of the MTP Journey. 
All photos featured on my site are courtesy of Joe Brier


Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Grab your copy before prices go up!

 

 

 

Our goal is to show the richness and deliciousness of a plant-based lifestyle. 

 

 

  

 

  

 

 

There are many great cookbooks out there, but Simple Happy Kitchen isn't a cookbook.

This book is a guide to all the wonderful options of a plant-based kitchen. It teaches the benefits of the diet and provides easy tips for implementation.

As part of this guide, we do have a few recipes to show you. These easy-to-make meals are great inspirations as you develop your plant-based kitchen.


 

 

Backing Simple Happy Kitchen is extremely rewarding! We produced great gifts designed especially for the project, all based on our cute tasty plant-based characters. 

To make it easier for you to choose, we’ve arranged the rewards in 7 different packs:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

After the campaign ends, you lovely backers will receive a SURVEY that'll allow you to select the plush dolls and charm sets (in case pledged for packages containing any of them), and verify your details for shipping. Feel free to message us with any questions!

Wanna order more than one pack? Buy one for a friend? No problem! After backing, you'll get an email asking to finalize your order, including your shipping address, and you'll be able to choose add-ons at a discount for backers only.

  • Back us!
  • Add a second copy to your pledge for someone you care about, to help them live a healthy life, full of happiness and compassion.
  • Tell all your friends to get their own copy, as you won’t be loaning yours to anyone - because we all know people never return things, right?
  • Subscribe on our Website, follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Share! Help us spread the word using these button below:


Hi! I'm Miki Mottes, an illustrator and designer. I’ve devoted my design skills and volunteer time to many animal welfare organizations and associations that promote plant-based nutrition. I decided to take it to the next level and do my best to make a big change, in a way that could reach everyone.

After illustrating the successful Kickstarter of Prof. Dan Ariely - “The Irrational Game” (1800% funded!), and after following its process, I know how things work and feel ready to manage this big production.

I base all information in the book on studies and reliable data, and you can easily find the references cited in the book and website. All nutrition information is written and verified by awesome vegan nutritionist BSc Tal Porat who volunteers in Challenge 22+ (Experience veganism for 22 days) as a professional clinical dietitian, as well as other experts.
 

I would like to thank Ziv Meltzer, Oren Fait, Gal Mamalya and Omer Matityahu for their effort, motivation, and support during the creation of this project. Special thanks to Shirley Charlie Kleinman and Shachar Bechor for being great vegan charm models. A big thank-you-almond-cheese-cake to Neta Dror for consulting and doing the things I'm not good at.

The book has many more important issues to cover, such as:

Nutritional comparison of plant-based VS non plant-based foods • Plant-based Omega 3 • Dietary fibers • Shattering the myths • Meat substitutes • Building a healthy plant-based grocery list • Easy to make plant-based burgers • Soaking and sprouting • Breastfeeding on a vegan diet • Kids and plant-based food • Super-healthy smoothie ideas • Nutrition facts reading guide • How to replace sweets with healthy eating • How to eat a raw plant-based diet • Sample meal plans for the vegan athlete • Answers to common questions • Oils guide • Tofu and Tempeh • Keto diet (and others) • Plant-based versions of common recipes • Amazing things you can do with aquafaba • Cultured vegetables • 22 days vegan challenge kit • How a plant-based diet can help you lose weight • The E number dictionary • Things you need to know about Vitamin B12 • The plant based pyramid • and more…

Some of the topics are already sketched, but we need your support to develop them into beautiful, funny and useful illustrated pages.

If you'd like to write about us, you can find high-resolution page samples, logos, rewards photos and campaign video here.

You can contact us via email: hello@simplehappykitchen.com

♥ Thank you for your support!

story:
Northwest Travelers 12U Blue Road to Cooperstown

Hello!  My name is Eduardo Dysangco and I am the manager of the 2015, 12U Northwest Travelers Baseball Team.  The Northwest Travelers Baseball Organization (NWT) is a completely volunteer-run, not-for-profit organization. We are committed to providing safe, fun, and family-oriented baseball instruction and experience to 9 to 14 year-old boys in the northwest Chicagoland area.

Each year the NWT 12-year-old team takes a trip to Cooperstown, New York, to participate in the Cooperstown Dreams Park Tournament. 

 The tournament comes as an additional expense to these players’ regular season costs, and that is why we are asking for your help.

What We Need and What You Will Get!

  • The estimated total cost for the Cooperstown Experience is $15,000.  We are asking for half of this total.  We will raise the remainder through other fundraisers we are holding locally in the Northwest Suburbs of Chicago.
  • Money raised will go towards: Tournament Fees, Baseball Training, Uniforms, Trading Pins, and Umpire Fees, and many more!
  • If we don't reach our goal we use our funds towards the tournament and extra expenses will be covered by the players individual family pockets.
Perks
  • $25.00 - Receive a personal thank you and mention on our team page
  • $50.00 - Receive the perks above and NWT Car Decal
  • $100.00 - Receive the perks above and official NWT Hat 
  • $250.00 - Receive the perks above and team autographed baseball (who knows one of these boys could become a baseball star and the ball would be worth millions)

Make the Difference

This is an experience of a lifetime for ballplayers and families alike. This tournament affords the boys valuable experience in being independent and accountable for their actions and provides an incredible look inside the history and traditions of the game of baseball.  

The players and coaches will stay together as a team throughout the 6 Day tournament. They will build a stronger bond; where friendships last a lifetime.  In addition, these boys will compete and meet players from all across the nation.  
Your generous contribution will make a difference for these boys.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise enough funds there is a possibility that the boys won't make the tournament in Cooperstown.  We will do our best in getting close to our fundraising goal and calculate the out of pocket expenses each family will need to provide.  If it is manageable we will go.

A major challenge is there are 2 other teams in our organization going to Cooperstown as well!  So, the pool of people attending our local fundraisers will be lower than normal.  We would work together as an organization to help teams that are short.  For example, if we are over our goal and another team is short - we would contribute money to help.   

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We realized that you may not be able to make a donation; however, you can:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thanks in advance for your assistance in getting us to Cooperstown!

story:
On December 21st 2012, my dad went in to UCSF to get a new, life saving  kidney. He had been suffering from renal failure for years and was down to about 15% function. He had lost all his energy and struggled with dizzy spells, nausea, vomiting, confusion, memory loss, and at 19 years old, I was faced with the very real fear of losing my dad.

Only 7 months before his surgery, in May, I had my 3rd and 4th spine surgery to take care of a spinal infection that resulted from scoliosis complications. My parents were already struggling with the hospital bills, the follow up appointments, and the cost of the intravenous medications I had to be on for 5 months. All the while, my parents were also worrying about how we would pay for his much needed treatments and when we would ever see a kidney match for him.


Little did we know, my grandmother had already begun tests to find out if she was a match to her son. In August, my grandmother told my dad that she was willing to donate one of her kidneys to him. Obviously, my dad resisted only to be met with, "What if your daughter came to you and told you her kidneys were failing, what would you do?" Needless to say, he then accepted her offer.


On December 11th, while at one of my follow up appointments, my dad got a call from UCSF. My grandma and dad were green to go for surgery.


We were so happy and so appreciative to my grandma. Only 7 years prior, she gave two-thirds of her liver to her dying sister, and now she would give the gift of life once again to her baby, my dad. My super grandma gave my dad life twice.

Now, it has been about 4 weeks since the surgeries. My dad is recovering very well and so is my grandma. But now, we are being faced with the financial burden...Only one of my dad's anti-rejection medications cost $3,754 and his insurance is giving us a bit of trouble. In order to pay for a majority of his medical costs for the rest of the year, he and my mom will have to come up with $3,000.


My grandma is a wonderful, hard working woman and she has always wanted to go on a cruise. My parents and I all feel that she deserves such a gift after the gifts she has given others. Please help us raise some money to get my dad's medications and send my super-grandma on her dream cruise.

All the while, my parents were also worrying about how we would pay for his much needed treatments and when we would ever see a kidney match for him.
Little did we know, my grandmother had already begun tests to find out if she was a match to her son. In August, my grandmother told my dad that she was willing to donate one of her kidneys to him. Obviously, my dad resisted only to be met with, "What if your daughter came to you and told you her kidneys were failing, what would you do?" Needless to say, he then accepted her offer.
On December 11th, while at one of my follow up appointments, my dad got a call from UCSF. My grandma and dad were green to go for surgery.
We were so happy and so appreciative to my grandma. Only 7 years prior, she gave two-thirds of her liver to her dying sister, and now she would give the gift of life once again to her baby, my dad. My super grandma gave my dad life twice.
Now, it has been about 4 weeks since the surgeries. My dad is recovering very well and so is my grandma. But now, we are being faced with the financial burden...Only one of my dad's anti-rejection medications cost $3,754 and his insurance is giving us a bit of trouble. In order to pay for a majority of his medical costs for the rest of the year, he and my mom will have to come up with $3,000.
My grandma is a wonderful, hard working woman and she has always wanted to go on a cruise. My parents and I all feel that she deserves such a gift after the gifts she has given others. Please help us raise some money to get my dad's medications and send my super-grandma on her dream cruise.

story:
MAYDAY 2013!

What does it take to create one of the greatest national Lyme disease protests in the history of our nation? A whole lot and then some, as you can imagine, especially people! And, of course, the reality is that it also takes $$$.

While so far this year we are fortunate that some wonderful companies are opting to donate their goods and services to us for the day, we are now in the process of raising funds to cover the many, many goods and services that we will have to be paying for, including:

- the PA system
- the stage
- a MAYDAY banner
- printing costs
- mailings and advertising
- large quantities of various paper goods such as folders, stickers, flyers, name-tags, hand-outs, etc.

 . . . and it all adds up. 

So, we could really use your help, if and only if, you are in a position to do so. It is a well known fact that this disease ravages not only our bodies, but also our wallets (and purses). But if you can afford it and would like to help to make MAYDAY 2013 a success, first, THANK YOU! Second, please use this site to make a donation of whatever amount you can afford right now. It's quick, easy and fairly pain-free! All major credit cards are accepted.

From $1 to “The Sky's the Limit!,” your generous contribution is helping to ensure that this is the absolute best MAYDAY ever to take place on the face of our planet and that our collective voice is heard. Any and all donations are appreciated, and there are incentives in place for those who qualify, so be sure to read through the "Perks" section located to the right on this page. Also, ALL DONORS to the campaign will receive a THANK YOU postcard in the mail from the Planning Committee. 

Donation Details:
We recently set up a designated MAYDAY 2013 bank account and MAYDAY 2013 PayPal account. Its current balance is $25. Each member of the MAYDAY 2013 Planning Committee has pledged to make a contribution, but we are going to need more, so we are counting on your support.

Any and all proceeds that are received will be DIRECTLY allocated to the event to help offset the costs of goods and services listed above. Since we are just a small, recently formed group of sick, yet dedicated Lyme patients ourselves who are diligently organizing the event this year, we do not have 501 (c) 3 nonprofit status, so your donation is not tax-deductable. Maybe someday!?

Also, as a token of our appreciation, a small donation will be given to two national/international nonprofit organizations that have kindly extended their assistance to MAYDAY this year:

International Lyme and Associated Diseases Society (ILADS www.ilads.org)

National Capital Lyme Disease Association (NatCapLyme www.natcaplyme.org)

 
MAYDAY 2013 Goals:
To bring together as many of us as possible in the Lyme and related conditions communities for one day this May in order to garner greatly needed attention to our disease(s) from the White House, Capitol Hill, the medical community, the media, passers-by and anyone/everyone who will listen; to inspire participants to go back to their own respective communities and do the same; to build upon the unique camaraderie that already exists in our tightly knit group – this is a rare opportunity to meet in person! Get inspired! Get involved! Get together! Get psyched!

Other Ways to Help:
If you would like to volunteer and have experience in nonprofit management, grassroots activism, patient advocacy, cause-oriented work, coalition building, professional writing, editing, proofreading, public relations, marketing, social media strategies, photography/videography, graphic design, web design, web maintenance, and/or finely honed organizational skills, we'd love to hear from you!  

We have high hopes for this MAYDAY project, lots of dedication and enthusiasm, high ethical standards and the utmost respect for honesty, trustworthiness, reliability, and transparency. Please rest assured that every single penny of your donation to this year's campaign will be used ONLY on essential MAYDAY rally needs, and that no committee members nor any single individual will be allowed to use ANY of the funds raised for any personal use (travel, food and lodging, etc). 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS DONATION!
The MAYDAY 2013 Planning Committee 

For additional information, please contact:
Email: lymediseaseMayDay2013@gmail.com
Facebook: MAYDAY 2013 (Event wall)
Tel: (843) 743-9580
